name: Aberrant Form (Akashic)
description: The daeva you have formed a bond with is a bit different from its kin. Special This feat can be selected multiple times.
benefits: select one veil granted by your passion, and one veil from the daevic veilweaving list. you permanently remove the selected passion veil from your list of passion veils and replace it with the selected veil from the daevic veilweaving list.

name: Adorn Akashic Treasure
description: You have gained insight into some of the treasures stored within the akashic record and have learned to adorn your veils with them. Whenever you shape your veils for the day, you may select one of your chosen treasures. You may adorn one of your veils with the selected treasure. This otherwise follows the rules for adorning akashic treasures. If you have the ability to adorn any akashic treasure from one of your class features, you instead increase the number of veils you may adorn with treasures each day by one. Special You may select this feat multiple times, choosing additional akashic treasures and gaining the ability to adorn one additional veil with a treasure each time it is selected.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 veil
benefits: when you gain this feat, choose a number of akashic treasures equal to your 1 + veilweaving modifier (minimum 2). if a treasure has a selectable component (such as choosing an elemental type for the elementium etchings treasure), you must choose the selectable components when you choose the treasure. you may choose multiple of these treasures if you wish to gain multiple selection options, but each counts as a unique chosen treasure for the purposes of this feat. if you later gain a permanent increase to your veilweaving modifier, you gain knowledge of additional treasures. if that permanent increase is lost and later regained, you lose those treasures while the increase is lost, and then regain those same chosen treasures when the increase is regained.

name: Adorned Fists
description: Your fists are adorned with the powers of your treasures that would normally only affect your weapons. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can adorn your veils that modify, affect, or empower your unarmed strikes with treasures that can normally only adorn veils that produce melee weapons, manufactured weapons, or any type of weapon (such as adorning the astral pugilism or forcestrike knuckles veil with the voidsphere treasure). you may apply the effects of these treasures to, or utilize the abilities of those treasures with, your unarmed strikes. if one of those treasures has an effect that triggers upon unsheathing or conjuring a weapon, or requires unsheathing or conjuring a weapon as part of its effects, you may unsheathe your unarmed strike for those effects. doing so requires the same actions you normally spend to unsheathe a weapon. you are still always considered to be wielding your unarmed strikes, unsheathing them in this way does not change that. the manner you use to unsheathe your unarmed strikes is determined by you. for example; you could unsheathe your unarmed strikes by taking a fighting stance, striking a pose, or removing your hands from your pockets.

name: Adorned Strike
description: You have learned to channel the powers of your treasures through the weapons they are adorned to. As a special attack action, you can make a single attack with a weapon produced by the veil adorned with such a treasure and use the standard action ability of the treasure on a successful hit. If the treasures ability requires a melee touch attack, it can only be delivered by a melee weapon attack. If the treasures ability requires a ranged touch attack, it can only be delivered by a ranged weapon attack. The ability is considered to have hit if the weapon attack hits. If the weapon attack is a critical hit, the treasures ability is only considered a critical hit if the initial attack roll was a natural 20 (or a 19 or 20, if you have Improved Critical or a similar ability that doubles the critical threat range of the weapon). If the treasures ability requires a saving throw, the struck creature receives a saving throw against that effect. If the treasures ability normally targets multiple creatures, the struck creature must be included among its targets. If the treasures ability affects an area, the struck creature must be included within its area. The struck creature must be in a legal location within the abilitys normal area (lines and cones still emanate from your space, bursts must be within their maximum range, and so on) otherwise the ability has no effect. If the treasures ability only affects you, such as the teleportation ability of the Keyhole treasure, that ability functions as if you had activated it normally if the attack hits. This ability cannot be combined with other abilities that allow you to apply your supernatural abilities to a weapon attack, such as the conductive weapon special ability. A special attack action represents a unique method of making an aack. They take a standard action to activate, and can be augmented by feats and talents just as if it were any other attack action (such as the Vital Strike feat), but a creature cannot perform more than one special attack action at a time.
benefits: whenever you adorn one of your veils that can produce a weapon (or that can empower your unarmed strikes if you have the adorned fists feat) with a treasure that has a special ability used as a standard action and isnt already delivered with a weapon attack, you can use your weapon to deliver that effect.

name: Akasha-Imbued Body
description: The akasha within you coats your bones and infuses your muscles, making you more resilient. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you take this feat, you gain 2 hit points for each akashic feat you have. whenever you take a new akashic feat, you gain 2 more hit points. if you are using the death by massive damage rules, you gain a +4 bonus on fortitude saves made to avoid death from massive damage.

name: Akasha-Infused Spells
description: You gain the ability to invest akasha directly into the spells you cast. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, ability to cast 1st-level spells.
benefits: when you take this feat, choose one school of magic. you can invest essence into this feat to increase the caster level of one spell you have known or prepared by 1. prepared casters apply this to all instances of the chosen spell (so if a wizard has prepared fireball twice, both instances gain the ). for each additional point of essence invested in this ability you may choose an additional spell from the selected school to gain this .

name: Akashic Animus
description: To you, the shifting power of animus is but a more chaotic form of essence.
prerequisites: animus pool or equivalent ability (such as a rubato bards tempo class feature or the tap animus feat).
benefits: when initiating maneuvers with an augment, you may spend points of animus as if they were essence points and vice versa.

name: Akashic Arms and Armor
description: You have learned to utilize your knowledge of akasha to enhance veils
prerequisites: benefit you may enhance veils with the [enhanced] descriptor as per the craft magic arms and armor feat. you treat your veilweaving level as your caster level when using this ability. if you do not meet the for any enhancements you apply (such as lacking the proper spells to enhance your veil with flaming burst), the dc for enhancing your veil increases by 5 for each you do not meet, as normal.

name: Akashic Augmentation
description: You can augment a psionic power with your chakra energy rather than mental energy. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, ability to manifest 2nd-level psionic powers.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat and choose a particular psionic power that you know. the total power point cost when augmenting that power is reduced by a value equal to the invested essence. this cant reduce the augmentation cost to less than 1. you cant invest more essence in this feat than the chosen powers level, even if the maximum essence capacity of this feat would normally be higher than that value.

name: Akashic Aura
description: You have learned to invest your essence into the auras granted by your faith, further empowering them and improving their radius. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: any aura granted as a paladin or antipaladin class feature.
benefits: you may invest essence in this feat. for each point of essence invested, the radius of your auras granted by paladin or antipaladin class features increase by 5 feet.

name: Akashic Charge
description: You can channel akasha to amplify your blows when charging. When you make a charge attack while this feat is active, your weapon is briefly encased in a thin sheath of akashic energy. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can bind essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus on attack rolls and damage rolls equal to the invested essence on all charge attacks.

name: Akashic Craftsman
description: You have adapted your ability to weave veils to weave essence into mundane objects, causing them to become magical
prerequisites: you can also bypass the normal restrictions for spell on spell trigger and spell completion items you craft by adding 3 + spell level to the crafting dc.

name: Akashic Demolitionist
description: Your personality isnt the only thing that lights up a room. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. when using thrown weapons that deal splash damage you gain an insight bonus to any saving throw dcs of their splash damage equal to the essence invested in this feat, and an insight bonus to damage and splash damage equal to twice the essence invested in this feat.

name: Akashic Flux
description: Your are able to channel the forces of the cosmos to tame the raging elemental energies within. In addition, you gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: two maneuvers known of two different disciplines, essence pool 1
benefits: whenever you would spend animus or tempo points, you may take an amount of essence burn equal to the number of points which would be spent to trigger the effect as if you had expended a number of points without actually expending any. in addition, whenever you reassign essence, you may spend animus or tempo points to gain an amount of temporary essence equal to half the number of points spent for 1 minute.

name: Akashic Fury
description: Your essence burns so brightly within you that when your anger flares it bursts forth in a burning light that envelopes you. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence in this feat. while you are raging, creatures who end their turns adjacent to you take 1d10 points of akashic damage per point of essence invested in this feat. a successful fortitude save (dc 10 + 1/2 your character level + your constitution modifier + the essence invested in this feat) halves this damage. this damage comes from a pulse of akashic power, ignoring any of the creature's hardness, damage reduction, or resistances.

name: Akashic Supply
description: Your internal reserves ensure that your ammunition never exhausts You gain one point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or ability to shape veils
benefits: you gain the ability to invest essence into a weapon you are carrying. for every point of essence invested, you may make one attack per round with that weapon which does not consume ammunition or charges. this ability does not enable you to make additional attacks per round with a weapon.

name: Akashic Talespinner
description: You have committed a specific story to heart and memory. You dedication this tale has expanded your mastery of it, when you call it forth from the akashic records.
prerequisites: ability to shape veils, perform (any) 5 ranks
benefits: choose a veil set (ex. angelic armaments or spiders stories). when you have 3 or more veils from that set shaped, your essence capacity for all veils you have shaped from that set is increased by 1. this does not stack with the feat enhanced capacity or other increases to essence capacity not derived from class abilities or veilweaver level.

name: Amateur Astrologist
description: You have begun to unlock the secrets of the stars. You gain 1 point of essence. Special You may take this feat multiple times, choosing a different constellation each time. If you gain the constellations class feature after taking this feat, you must immediately retrain this feat, exchanging it for any other feat you qualify for.
prerequisites: essence pool of 1 or higher, knowledge (arcana) 5 ranks, cannot have the constellations class feature.
benefits: choose a single constellation. you gain the ability to manifest the weapon, armor, or equipment options of that constellation as a zodiac of your class level, though you cannot manifest its champion form. you must still pay any essence costs to manifest the constellation as normal.

name: Amateur Stormbound
description: You have managed to learn a small amount of a stormbounds power despite not possessing their innate connection to the Elderstorm. Special If you gain levels in a class that grants the storm powers class feature, you can immediately trade this feat for the Extra Storm Power feat.
prerequisites: wisdom 13, you have no levels in a class that has the storm powers class feature.
benefits: you gain a single storm power available to the stormbound, treating your effective stormbound level as 1. if that storm power can be invested with essence, you may invest essence in it as if it were a normal essence receptacle. this feat counts as the storm power class feature for the purposes of the extra storm power feat, allowing you to gain additional storm powers by selecting that feat.

name: Apprentice Chef
description: You have begun to take your first steps in becoming a chef. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you gain the ability to shape the chefs armory veil. if you do not have any class levels in a veilweaving class, you may choose to use intelligence, wisdom, or charisma for your veilweaving attribute. if you later gain a level in a veilweaving class, this veil uses that classs veilweaving modifier for this veil. treat your veilweaving level as 1/2 of your non-veilweaving class levels higher (minimum 1) for determining effects related to the chefs armory veil. this effect cannot give you more veilweaving levels than you have hit dice.

name: Artificial Spartan
description: Your mechanical facets enable you to substitute keen learning where mortals rely upon emotion You gain one point of essence.
benefits: you may use intelligence in place of charisma for all of your daevic class abilities. in addition, you may invest essence into your nanite surge racial trait to gain an additional use per day for each point invested or invest essence into your fearless, strange mind, natural armor, crystal skin, memory matrix, or constructed racial traits (individually) to increase any of their bonuses by 1 for each point invested.

name: Bestial Senses
description: Your primal nature has granted you exceptionally sharp senses. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: creeper, morphbear, nameer, wolger, or wyrmkin.
benefits: you gain the scent special ability and a +1 racial bonus to perception and survival checks made using your sense of smell. you may invest essence into this feat to increase the granted bonus by +1 per point of essence invested.

name: Bind the Bestial Soul
description: Attaining mastery over your inner beast has reaped its rewards
prerequisites: level 11, ability to shape the beastblood transformation veil as a racial trait
benefits: you treat the beastblood transformation veil granted by your racial trait as if it were bound to the blood chakra. in addition as a full-round action you may change the animal form chosen for the effects of this veil to another valid choice. you may use this ability a number of times per day equal to your veilweaving modifier.

name: Bind the Myriad Visage
description: Your form is ever shifting and your mutable nature has reached its peak.
prerequisites: level 9, ability to shape the visage of the faceless veil as a racial trait
benefits: you treat the visage of the faceless veil granted by your racial trait as if it were bound to the head chakra. in addition as part of the alter self at-will ability this veil grants you, you gain any subtypes of that form for as long as you remain transformed.

name: Blessed of the Harrow
description: Truth is in the cards, if you have but the the gift to see it. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you may bind essence to this feat. for each point of essence bound in this feat, the bonuses granted by the harrowed feat increase by +1 and you may use the effects of that feat one extra time each day. you may still only have one card drawn by the harrowed feat at a time; if you draw a card while you have an unused card, the of the unused card are lost.

name: Blessings of Fate
description: You may tap into the powers of fate more often than normal. Special This feat may be selected multiple times, granting an additional 3 uses of draw the fates each day for each time it is selected.
benefits: you may use your draw the fates class feature an additional 3 times each day.

name: Blurring Essence
description: You can use diffused akasha to make your form appear hazy. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, int 13, combat expertise, improved feint.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. when you feint in combat, instead of denying your opponent their dexterity bonus to ac, that opponent suffers a 5% miss chance on attacks against you, for each point of essence invested in this feat the miss chance increases by +5%. this miss chance lasts until the start of your next turn. true seeing negates this miss chance.

name: Body-Bound Mind
description: The energy of akasha courses through your mind, increasing your mental capacity. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, a power point reserve.
benefits: you can bind essence into this feat. you gain bonus power points equal to twice the bound essence. if you have the ability to bind a veil to your head slot (even if you dont have one currently bound), you gain an additional 2 bonus power points as long as at least 1 point of essence is bound in this feat.

name: Born of Akasha
description: Your birth was brought about by the powers of akasha, whether it be by an immaculate birth caused entirely by magic or simply a vast amount of power tied to your bloodline. Special Unlike most feats, this feat must be taken at first level during character creation and can never be retrained.
prerequisites: finally, you can choose to gain the effects of the living veils incarnate form alternate racial trait as part of selecting this feat. if you do so, this choice cannot later be changed and you count as having that ability for the purposes of .
benefits: the powers of your veil granted by your racial trait are linked intrinsically to your body, making you a creature that is not-quite-mortal and not-quite-veil. your appearance is altered by your veil you shape as part of your racial trait and that veil is part of your body, it cannot be sundered and you take a -10 penalty on your disguise checks made to disguise it. if this veil would be suppressed (such as if you choose to suppress it, if it is dispelled, or if you enter an anti-magic field), you are staggered for the duration of the suppression. this veil cannot be permanently suppressed or unshaped. if you have the ability to shape multiple veils as part of the racial trait that granted this veil, you can only unshape it as part of shaping a different veil granted by that trait to replace it. if your veil would be affected by an effect that would permanently unshape it, it is instead only suppressed temporarily for 1 hour. while this veil is suppressed your appearance becomes dull, losing much of its color and patterns, and you become slightly translucent as if not fully there.

name: Bound Living Veil
description: The veil that makes up your physical form has become more firmly bound to reality, granting you even greater abilities. Special If you have the Composite Living Veil feat, the veil you swap in is immediately considered to be bound using this feat if you have the ability to do so.
prerequisites: character level 2, living veil racial trait
benefits: you gain the ability to bind your base veil to a chakra slot. at character level 2, you can bind your base veil to the hands slot if you have shaped it in that slot. at 4th level, and every 2 levels thereafter, you gain access to more powerful chakra slots in the following order feet, head, wrists, shoulders, headband, neck, belt, chest, body. at 9th level, you gain access to the blood, interface, ring, storm, and voice chakra slots in this way as well.

name: Bright Enervations
description: You are the light that saps strength with overwhelming brightness. Enervations still use the essence capacity of the unwilling bond or psikashic bond, like normal vivifications. Additional essence assigned to an enervation increases its effects, as normal. Vivifications that are not constant or do not have round by round effects cannot be used as enervations (e.g. renewal and restoration). Sundering an enervation is treated as sundering a brand veil. You may have a number of active enervations equal to half your veilweaving modifier. You gain 1 point of essence. Special If you have the psikashic bond class feature, the distance your enervations may remain on a creature is equal to the range of your collective.
prerequisites: radiant level 4th, unwilling bond class feature or unwilling participant feat
benefits: you may treat your vivifications as though they were veils with the [brand] descriptor (called enervations). an enervation has a reversed effect on the creature it is placed upon compared to a vivification. for example, the clarity enervation would inflict a penalty to intelligence, the durability enervation would cause the creature to take 1 additional damage when struck, and the regeneration enervation would cause the creature to lose 1 hp each round.

name: Chakra Strike
description: You can channel akasha into your precision-based attacks, damaging your foes inner energy and body simultaneously. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, sneak attack or studied strike class feature.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus on damage rolls made when delivering attacks with the sneak attack or studied strike class features equal to twice the invested essence.

name: Chakra-Enhanced Fortitude
description: You can use akasha to strengthen your blood and harden your internal organs. You boost your ability to resist effects that would adversely affect your health. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus on fortitude saves equal to the invested essence.

name: Chakra Power
description: You can take your bodys toughness and natural resilience and use it to fuel attacks whose power exceeds mere physical strength. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus to cmb to succeed on a bull rush, overrun, or sunder attack equal to the invested essence. you also gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on damage rolls made when using power attack.

name: Chakra Targeting
description: You can focus akashic energy into your ranged attacks, dealing more damage with successful critical hits. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, deadly aim.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. while using the deadly aim feat, you gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on ranged attack rolls against targets within 30 feet, and an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on ranged damage rolls.

name: Clarify Fate
description: Tapping into the power of fate allows you to clarify your essence. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you activate your draw the fates class feature you may reinvest your essence.

name: Clashing Essence
description: Your essence rushes to the forefront to aid where it is needed. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you may reallocate your essence as an immediate action in response to being targeted by an attack, making a saving throw, making an attack roll, or an ally under the effect of one of your veils being in any of these situations. you may use this ability after the result of the roll is revealed.

name: Composite Living Veil
description: Your form is composed of multiple veils, allowing you to switch between them. Special This feat can be selected multiple times, allowing you to choose an additional veil each time it is selected. If you have the Folded Veil feat and select your base veil with it, you can choose from any of the veils you have selected with this feat (or your base veil) any time you change your loadout. *The folded veil feat is found in Akashic Classes Transcendent
benefits: select a single veil. by spending one hour in meditation, you can replace your base veil granted by your living veil racial trait with this veil, treating it as your base veil for all purposes. if you have the ability to bind this veil to its chakra slot, you may do so as part of this hour. you can switch back to your original base veil by spending an additional hour. if you have the folded veil* feat, you can select your base veil as your veil with that feat. when you change loadout, you can swap your base veil with the veil gained from this feat (or vice versa).

name: Corrupted Ignition
description: You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: ability or veil that allows you to burn essence
benefits: whenever you would suffer essence burn, you can instead choose to corrupt an equivalent number of points of your own non-temporary essence (see corrupted essence ) in place of suffering the essence burn. unlike other corrupted essence, this self-inflicted corruption is removed from your essence the next time you rest and reshape your veils. you cannot choose to corrupt your essence using this ability if all of your non-temporary essence is already corrupted. if you corrupt your essence as part of using an ability that requires you to burn essence, you are still treated as if you burned your essence when determining its effects. if multiple points of essence would be burned, you choose whether to burn essence or corrupt your essence individually for each point of essence burned.

name: Daevic Rage
description: You can channel akasha to enhance your rage. When you do so, eldritch energy bleeds from your body with every wound you take, shrouding you in power that harms your foes and shields you from harmful magics. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, bloodrage or rage class feature.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. while raging, you deal an additional 2 points of untyped energy damage per point of essence invested on all melee attacks and a +1 insight bonus per point of essence invested on all saves vs. spells and spelllike abilities for one round after taking hit point damage. this ability can only be triggered once per round.

name: Dark Shogunate Wanderer
description: You have walked the caverns of the Dark Shogunate, in dream or reality, and emerged touched by death itself. In addition, if you have all five O-yoroi of the Obsidian Ronin veils shaped, whenever you deal negative energy damage to a creature it takes a -2 penalty on all attack rolls that do not include you as a target. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as you have at least two veils from the o-yoroi of the obsidian ronin veil set shaped, all of your attacks deal 2 additional points of negative energy damage against living creatures, plus 1 additional point of damage per additional o-yoroi of the obsidian ronin veil you have shaped. if you have the planar detonation class feature, you may choose to deal negative energy damage instead of the blasts normal energy type; this destructive energy only takes from its targets and cannot heal undead, instead dealing half the damage it would deal to living creatures.

name: Death Roll
description: You learn to harness your reptilian ferocity and master a devastating combat technique. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you make a successful cmb check to initiate or maintain a grapple, you may perform a death roll. as you cling to your foe, you tuck in your legs and roll rapidly, twisting and wrenching your victim. you inflict your bite damage and knock the creature prone. for each point of essence invested in your racial bite ability, you gain a +1 racial bonus to your cmb on grapple checks.

name: Deck of Chosen Fate
description: By shaping your deck as a veil you have learned a method of choosing your fate. Whenever you draw a card from the Deck of Fates as part of using a path of the augur class feature, you may bind 1 point of essence to that veil to to draw an additional card and choose which to use to determine the abilitys effects. If the ability causes you to draw multiple cards, you draw an additional card for each of those cards individually when determining their effects. For example if you use the ascension ability you would draw two cards to determine the effects of draw the fates (choosing one to determine the exaltation or descension) and then two cards to determine the effects of ascension (choosing only one to determine the ascension effect). You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: path of the augur, ability to shape the deck of the fates veil
benefits: while you have the deck of the fates veil shaped, you can choose to merge your deck of spectral cards with the deck produced by that veil. if the veil is suppressed, you may draw cards from your spectral deck as normal.

name: Demonic Doctrine
description: Death is an intrinsic part of your existence. In addition, if you have ten Trappings of Chaos veils shaped, the essence capacity for all veils from this set increases by 1. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as you have at least two veils from the trappings of chaos veil set shaped, all of your attacks are treated as chaotic-aligned for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. if you have the planar detonation class feature, your planar detonation deals one additional point of acid damage per trappings of chaos veil you have shaped.

name: Disciple of Charon
description: Death is an intrinsic part of your existence. In addition, if you have ten Boatmans Ensemble veils shaped, the essence capacity for all veils from this set increases by 1. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as you have at least two veils from the boatmans ensemble veil set shaped, all of your attacks are treated as lawful-aligned for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. if you have the planar detonation class feature, your planar detonation deals one additional point of cold damage per boatmans ensemble veil you have shaped.

name: Diving Fury
description: Swooping down on your foe, you unleash a furious avian barrage. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when using the charge action to attack with a manufactured or veil weapon while flying, you may also make a single free attack with each of your talons as part of the charge (these are treated as secondary natural attacks). in addition, your falcon blood racial trait may now be invested with essence, increasing the bonus to fly and perception checks by +1 per point of essence invested.

name: Duelist's Bind
description: Empowering yourself with essence allows you to further hone the skills brought to from extensive training. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence in this feat. for each point of essence invested, you gain a +1 insight bonus to attack and damage rolls made with weapons ing from your weapon training class feature.

name: Elemental Ambition
description: The ways of geniekind are as intuitive to you as breathing. In addition, if you have ten Genies Ambitions veils shaped, the essence capacity for all veils from this set increases by 1. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as you have at least two veils from the genies ambitions veil set shaped, you ignore the first 5 points of any types of energy resistance possessed by the target of your attack or ability. if you have the planar detonation class feature, your planar detonation deals one additional point of acid, cold, fire, or electric damage (chosen when you activate your planar detonation) per genies ambitions veil you have shaped.

name: Elemental Essence
description: Your soul is imbued with elemental power that can alter the elements of your veils. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence in this feat. as a free action, even if it isnt your turn, you can bind a point of essence invested in this feat and select a single veil you have shaped with the acid, cold, electricity, or fire descriptors; select one of those descriptors that veil loses its normal descriptor, and gains the chosen descriptor. any damage of the original type dealt by that veil is changed to the new type. if a veil has multiple such descriptors, choose one of them to change with this effect. this effect lasts until you rest and shape your veils for the day or until the veil is unshaped.

name: Enhanced Capacity
description: Your capacity for channeling Akasha allows you to maintain more essence in a single veil. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. You cant apply the feats effects to the same essence receptacle more than once.
benefits: choose one of your essence receptacles such as a veil, magic item designed to contain essence, or class feature. your essence capacity for that essence receptacle is increased by 1. you may change the chosen receptacle when you shape your veils each day.

name: Entitled Empire
description: Your titles reach far and wide, encompassing all. You gain 1 point of essence. Special If you possess the house of servants or royal attendants class feature, the range of that class feature is equal to the range of your titles. However, your servants cannot remain invisible once they are no longer within Medium range.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least two veils with the title descriptor, veilweaver level 3rd
benefits: your entitled creatures can move up to medium range (100 feet + 10 feet per veilweaver level) before your titles become suppressed on them. if your veilweaver level is at least 12th, the distance becomes long range (400 feet + 40 feet per veilweaver level). at 15th, it becomes limitless so long as the entitled is on the same plane as you. at 19th, it reaches even into other planes and dimensions.

name: Esoteric Insight
description: Veils, spells, what is the difference? Magic is magic, is it not? Example A radiant who gains this feat chooses cleric (both of which are Wisdom-based). The radiant can now count their radiant class levels as cleric caster levels if using a stave, or using wands and scrolls of cleric spells.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 6th with chosen class, knowledge (arcana) 6 ranks, spellcraft 6 ranks.
benefits: when you gain this feat, choose a spellcasting class. then choose one veilweaving class you possess. these two classes must use the same ability score for casting and veilweaving. you may count your veilweaver class levels as caster levels for the purposes of caster level-based abilities, such as determining your caster level when using a stave. as well, you may use spell trigger and spell completion items as though you possessed the chosen class spell list.

name: Essence Balanced Blades
description: You can use essence to adjust the balance of your weapons while dual wielding. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, dex 15, two-weapon fighting.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. for every odd-numbered point of essence invested you gain a +1 bonus on damage rolls made with your off-hand weapon while two-weapon fighting. for every even-numbered point of essence invested you gain a +1 insight bonus on attack rolls made with your primary-hand weapon while two-weapon fighting.

name: Essence Expertise
description: By achieving a special meditative state, you can focus your essence to grant yourself akasha-enhanced defenses. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, combat expertise.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus to cmb to make a disarm attack, a feint in combat, or a trip attempt equal to the invested essence. you also gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence to ac when using combat expertise.

name: Essence Focus
description: The blending of akasha and psionics you have mastered gives you unusual focus and recovery. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, a power point reserve.
benefits: you can invest a point of essence into this feat as a move action to regain your psionic focus. essence invested in this way cannot be reassigned for 3 rounds. in addition, while essence is invested in this feat you gain the ability to activate two abilities which require you to expend your psionic focus as part of the same action (for example, a psion using this ability could gain the of both quicken power and talented as part of the same expenditure).

name: Essence Forged Armaments
description: Your essence can be used to further empower your special armaments, increasing the damage you deal with them. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: monks unarmed strike class feature, warpriests sacred weapon class feature, or similar ability.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. when you select this feat, choose a single class feature that scales with class level and replaces the damage dice of a type of attack (such as the monks unarmed strike, or the warpriests sacred weapon). for each point of essence invested in this feat, treat your level in that class as 1 higher when determining the damage of that class feature.

name: Essence of Movement
description: You flow through the battlefield, nimbly evading the blows of your enemies. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: benefit you get a +1 dodge bonus to armor class against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or within a threatened area, plus an additional +1 per point of essence invested in this feat. in addition, you gain a +1 insight bonus per point of essence invested on all acrobatics checks. a condition that makes you lose your dexterity bonus to armor class (if any) also makes you lose the dodge and acrobatics bonuses. this feat counts as the mobility feat for determining .

name: Essence of Recovery
description: You can channel akasha to enhance your ability to heal. When you use your akasha-infused healing class feature, your body and hands hum with eldritch energy. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, lay on hands or wholeness of body class feature.
benefits: you can bind essence into this feat. add the bound essence to your class level to determine the amount of healing available to you from your lay on hands or wholeness of body class features. if you have both class features, the applies to both.

name: Essence of the Immortal
description: You fortify your body with akasha, making you even more durable. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: special this feat counts as the toughness feat for determining .
benefits: you gain hit points equal to your total essence pool. if the size of your essence pool changes, such as when taking essence burn, the number of hit points granted by this feat changes to match the new total. hit points granted by this feat are not lost first like temporary hit points.

name: Essence Predation
description: You can rip not just flesh from opponents to fill your stomach, but essence as well.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, str 13, bite attack, essence pool, improved sunder, power attack, base attack bonus +1.
benefits: whenever you successfully perform a sunder maneuver against an invested akashic receptacle with your bite attack, that receptacle must make a will save. the dc for this save is 10 + 1/2 your character level + your constitution modifier. if the receptacle fails any essence invested in that receptacle is treated as being under the effects of essence burn for a number of rounds equal to your constitution modifier (minimum 1). for the duration of this essence burn you gain temporary essence equal to the amount of essence burn, which you can immediately invest as free action.

name: Essence-Bound Channel
description: Infusing your channeled divinity with the powers of akasha amplifies your connection to your deity and empowers the energies you call forth. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence in this feat. whenever you channel positive or negative energy, increase the number of dice of healed or damage dealt by +1d6 per point of essence invested in this feat.

name: Essence-Honed Flesh
description: Investing your own flesh with your essence allows you to hone your skin to act as a potent magical armament. Additionally, you can invest essence in this feat. For each point of essence invested, you gain a +1 enhancement bonus to attack and damage rolls with your unarmed strikes and natural attacks. Special Unlike normal essence receptacles, this feat has its own essence capacity progression that cannot be increased or modified. Its essence capacity is 1 at character level 1, and increases by an additional 1 at character levels, 4, 8, 12, and 16. If an ability would allow you to invest essence in another receptacle in place of this feat, such as the Akashic Knowledge forbidden knowledge, that essence receptacle uses this essence capacity when interacting with this feat. If an ability would allow you to treat this feat as if it were invested with more essence, or allow you to bypass this feats essence capacity, its effects are limited to this feats essence capacity. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: your unarmed strikes and natural attacks are always imbued with the remnants of your essence, allowing them to count as magical weapons for the purposes of bypassing damage reduction.

name: Expanded Cosmology
description: You have learned how to open your spirit to the constellations of reality very different than your own. You gain 1 point of essence. Special You may take this feat multiple times, choosing a different constellation each time.
prerequisites: constellations class feature or amateur astrologist feat.
benefits: choose a single constellation from a cosmology other than the one you selected when you first gained the ability to manifest constellations. you treat that constellation as though it were part of your chosen cosmology and may manifest any of the chosen constellations available forms, paying the essence cost as normal. this new constellation replaces a constellation of the same element from your current cosmology. you lose the ability to manifest any form of the replaced constellation.

name: Expanded Veilweaving
description: Your ability to shape veils is expanded. Special The additional veil you can shape each day granted by this feat does not count against your total when determining the effects of the Shape Veil, or similar feats that grant you the ability to shape additional veils based on your maximum veils shaped.
benefits: the maximum number of veils you can shape each day increases by 1. this does not count as a veil slot granted by one of your veilweaving classes for any abilities that affect veils shaped only using a specific class's veil slots

name: Extra Essence
description: You are better able to harness your personal store of akasha.
prerequisites: con 13, veilweaver level 1, or ability to manifest a constellation.
benefits: you gain 2 points of essence

name: Extra Heraldry
description: Special You can gain Extra Heraldry multiple times.
prerequisites: benefi you gain one additional heraldry you meet the for.

name: Extra Reforge
description: You are particularly adept at reforging your own combat abilities. You gain 1 additional point of essence.
benefits: you gain the ability to reforge an additional combat feat each day.

name: Extra Wrathful Form
description: Your akashic spirit can enter its wrathful form more often. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.
benefits: your akashic spirit can remain in its wrathful form for 6 additional rounds each day.

name: Flesh-Shaped Veil
description: You have learned to shape a veil by incorporating it directly with your flesh. Special You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you take it, you can apply its effects to an additional veil each time you shape your veils.
prerequisites: con 17 or veilweaver level 9th or promethean 1
benefits: that veil gains the [fleshwarp] descriptor. if that veil would produce weapons or armor, they are instead produced directly from your body rather than being conjured using magic. any enhancements applied to this veil are still considered to be magical effects. armor produced by an [enhanced (armor)] fleshwarp veil merges with your body while polymorphed and does not provide its . spell-like abilities produced by a [fleshwarp] veil are still supernatural effects, and follow the normal rules for spell-like abilities. if a [fleshwarp] veil emulates a spell effect, that effect is supernatural as well.

name: Fleshwarped Construct
description: The following akashic upgrades can be selected by a Fleshwarped Construct in additton to the regular akashic upgrades  Adrenaline Surge You gain the ferocity universal monster ability while enveloped by your Akashic Construct.  Extreme Acclimation The Akashic Construct has adapted to some form of extreme environment, granting itself immunity to fire or cold damage. Damage dealt to the Akashic Construct is still split between you and the construct before applying this immunity. You must have a veilweaving level of 9th to select this upgrade, and it may be selected up to two times. Feral Construct When you invest essence in your Akashic Construct, you can choose to grant it two primary claw natural attacks instead of the normal slam natural attack. These claws deal the same dice of damage as the replaced slam attack.  Feral Mobility For each point of essence invested in the Akashic Construct, you gain a 5 foot increase to your base land speed.  Gushing Fluid When damaged the Akashic Construct violently pours forth vitriolic fluid that hoses its attacker. Once per round when the Akashic Construct takes damage from a slashing or piercing weapon, all creatures adjacent to you take 1d6 points of acid damage, plus an addittonal 1d6 points per 2 points of essence invested in the Akashic Construct. A successful Reflex save (DC 10 + the essence invested in the akashic construct + your veilweaving modifier) negates this damage.  Improved Feral Construct When you invest essence in your Akashic Construct it gains a primary bite natural attack. The damage dealt by this attack is treated as one size category larger than the slam attack normally dealt by the akashic construct. You must have selected the feral construct upgrade to select this upgrade.  Improved Feral Mobility You gain the pounce universal monster ability. You must have a veilweaving level of 11th and have selected the feral mobility upgrade to select this upgrade.  Instinctive Action If you become unconscious, stunned, or otherwise unable to take actions, your Akashic Construct acts instinctively to best protect you. It has a single standard action on your turn, which it uses to either attack an adjacent creature, move away from danger, or activate an ability of one of your veils. The construct is considered to have an intelligence score of - and a Wisdom score of 10 while acting in this way.  Redundant Organs While enveloped by your Akashic Construct you gain a 25% chance to negate critical hits and precision damage. This upgrade can be taken a second time to increase the chance to 50%, and a third time to grant you immunity to critical hits and precision damage.  Tissue Regeneration You only need to meditate for 1 minute to restore 5 hit points to your Akashic Construct. If your Akashic Construct is reduced to 0 hit points it still requires 1 hour in meditation to restore it to 5 hit points.
prerequisites: knowledge (nature) or knowledge (dungeoneering) 1 rank, ability to shape an akashic construct
benefits: your akashic construct gains the fleshwarp descriptor and all of the associated with that descriptor. your akashic construct can now also be targeted by effects that affect living creatures, aberrations, and constructs. this otherwise functions as normal for effects that target and affect your akashic construct.

name: Akashic Constructs
description: Akasha given shape and form to surround its weaver, akashic constructs are a rarely used form of akashic magic. These akashic constructs are difficult to use and require a great deal of specialization to master, but a veilweaver who does so is a formidable foe on any battlefield. Author's Note Despite functioning similarly to a veil, an akashic construct does not count as a veil for the purposes of features that grant you a veil known. Unless you are granted the ability to shape an akashic construct by a class feature you need to take the Shape Akashic Construct feat. Akashic constructs are special veils that function as a combination of creature and magical creation, and are treated as if they had the [Force] and [Enhanced (heavy armor; see text)] descriptors. You can shape this special veil in either the veilweavers Shoulders or Body slots, and it can be invested with essence as if it were a veil. Unlike a normal veil the akashic construct cannot be sundered, though it can still be affected by dispel magic or affected by similar abilities that dispel magic or suppress veils. An akashic construct is still considered a supernatural effect. Being enclosed in your akashic construct counts as wearing heavy armor for any class features, feats, or talents that depend on being armored or unarmored. You gain a bonus to your armor class that is based on your veilweaver level with the akashic construct while enveloped by it (see Table Akashic Construct), and this veil can be enhanced as if it were a suit of heavy armor. Because the akashic construct is derived from force, this bonus to armor class functions against the attacks of incorporeal creatures. The akashic construct is the same shape and size you, with the same number of limbs. It emulates all of your natural attacks, including those granted by veils or other magical effects. While enveloped in your akashic construct, you gain an enhancement bonus to your Strength and Dexterity based on your veilweaver level with the akashic construct, but otherwise use your own ability scores (see Table Akashic Construct). The akashic construct has its own Hit Dice and Hit Points (see Table Akashic Construct). It automatically recovers any hit points it has lost when you rest and shape your veils for the day, but can otherwise be healed as if it were you, or a creature of the construct type. You can also meditate for 1 hour to restore 5 hp to the akashic construct. Whenever you take damage while enveloped by your akashic construct, apply your akashic constructs hardness to it, as well as any other defensive abilities you possess that reduce damage such as resistances, and then split the remaining damage evenly between yourself and the akashic construct (the construct takes the extra damage if it's an odd number). The hardness granted by an akashic construct does not stack with hardness granted by other sources, or with any form of damage reduction. If the akashic construct is reduced to 0 hit points it is immediately dismissed and you cannot envelop yourself with it again until you rest and reshape their veils (restoring it to full health), or meditate for one hour, which returns it to 5 hit points and allows it to be healed as normal thereafter. Essence When the akashic construct is invested with at least 1 point of essence, you gain a primary slam attack that deals bludgeoning damage based on the size of the akashic construct, and the amount of essence invested in it (see Table Akashic Construct Slam Damage) while you are enveloped by your akashic construct. You may also use this slam natural attack in place of your unarmed strikes while enveloped by your construct, though you cant use this slam attack as a natural attack during any round in which you do so. When doing so, it is still treated as an attack made using an unarmed strike for effects that modify unarmed strikes, or for effects that trigger off of unarmed strikes. If you have an effect that increases the base damage dice of your unarmed strikes, it does not apply to the damage of this slam attack when used in place of an unarmed strike (this does not include size increases from other effects). Chakra Bind (Shoulders) Binding the akashic construct to your Shoulders chakra allows you to increase your akashic constructs size. When you envelop yourself in your akashic construct, you can choose for it to be of a size one category greater than your own. For each size category the akashic construct is increased, the space you take up increases by one category and grants you a +2 size bonus to Strength, a -2 penalty to Dexterity, a -4 penalty to Stealth checks, and increases your natural reach by 5 feet. You do not gain any other bonuses or penalties associated with your akashic constructs size (such as size bonuses or penalties), but are otherwise treated as the new size for all purposes, such as being affected by combat maneuvers. The akashic construct gains 10 additional hit points and the damage die of its slam increases in size as well (see Table Akashic Construct Slam Damage) for each size category it increases. These bonuses stack with themselves when increasing the akashic constructs size by more than one size category (such as through the effects of the Body bind, or the size increase akashic upgrade). When wielding weapons you are considered to be of the size of your akashic construct, suffering the penalties for wielding undersized weapons if applicable. If one of your veils creates a weapon for you to wield, you can choose for it to produce weapons sized appropriately for your akashic construct. Your natural attacks are also emulated by your akashic construct, dealing damage based on its size when you use them while enveloped by it. Alternatively, rather than increasing your akashic constructs size, you can instead increase the bonus to Dexterity granted by your akashic construct by +2 and grant the akashic construct an additional 10 hit points. These bonuses stack for each size category increase you choose to apply this option to. You must choose this option if increasing your akashic constructs size would make it larger than Colossal. Veilweaving Level Your veilweaving level with the akashic construct determines its statistics. Hit Dice The number of hit dice the akashic construct has. Akashic constructs normally have average hit points per hit die. For a d10, the average is 5.5. multiply 5.5 times the number of hit dice and round down to determine your akashic constructs base hit points. Armor Bonus The armor bonus to armor class granted to you while you are enveloped by the akashic construct. Hardness The akashic construct hardness. This hardness does not stack with hardness gained from other sources, or with damage reduction. Str/Dex Bonus The enhancement bonus granted to your Strength and Dexterity scores while enveloped by the akashic construct. Bonus Hit Points An akashic construct does not have a Constitution score, but begins with 10 bonus hit points at 1st level. Akashic Upgrade At 1st level, and again at 5th, 10th, 15th, and 20th levels, the akashic construct gains a permanent upgrade. By spending 8 hours in meditation, you can exchange a single upgrade you have selected for your akashic construct for another. For every additional 4 hours you meditate, you can change an additional upgrade. For more information on Akashic Upgrades, see below. While enveloped by your akashic construct, you treat the weapons or natural weapons produced by one of your veils, chosen when you shape your akashic construct each day, as if they were one size category larger when determining their damage dice. You may select this upgrade multiple times, allowing you to apply its effects to an additional veil for each selection. The akasha that forms the construct amplifies the weapons you wield, causing them to become more accurate. While enveloped by your akashic construct, you are treated as though you had the Weapon Focus feat with the weapons or natural weapons produced by a single veil, chosen when you shape your akashic construct each day. You may select this upgrade multiple times, allowing you to apply its effects to an additional veil for each selection. While enveloped by your akashic construct, you are treated as though you had the Greater Weapon Focus feat with the weapons or natural weapons produced by one veil selected by the Akashic Targeting upgrade. This upgrade can be taken multiple times, affecting an additional veil each time it is selected. The akashic construct increases its hardness by 5. The akashic construct extends the following construct features to its pilot while they operate it Immunity to all mind-affecting effects (charms, compulsions, morale effects, patterns and phantasms). This upgrade can be selected multiple times, selecting a different mech upgrade each time it is selected. Akashic constructs with this upgrade can make a DC 15 Fly check to fall safely from any height without taking falling damage, as if using feather fall. When falling safely, it may make an additional DC 15 Fly check to glide, moving 5 feet laterally for every 10 feet it falls. The akashic construct gains a swim speed equal to base land or fly speed chosen when this upgrade is selected. The akashic construct can remain submerged for 1 hour per Hit Die before its air filters start to fail and the pilot has to make Constitution checks to hold their breath or begin drowning. The akashic construct is capable of fantastic feats of agility. Akashic constructs with this enhancement gain a +15 bonus to Acrobatics or driver Ride checks made to perform a long jump or high jump. In addition, they are always considered to have a running start when jumping. The akashic construct extends the following construct features to its pilot while he operates it Immunity to bleed, disease, death effects, necromancy effects, paralysis, poison, sleep effects, and stunning. When you envelop yourself in your akashic construct, you can choose to increase its size by one category, gaining the bonuses and penalties listed in the Shoulders slot bind ability of the akashic construct. You can choose whether to increase your construct in size or increase its Dexterity each time you envelop yourself in it, as per the ability listed above. This akashic upgrade can be taken a second time if your veilweaving level with the akashic construct is at least 15. The akashic construct increases its hardness by 5. This stacks with the increase granted by the Arcforged Armor akashic upgrade. The akashic construct increases their current fly speed by 10 feet and increase their maneuverability by one step. If the akashic construct did not have a fly speed before taking this upgrade, it now has a maneuverability of clumsy. Each time it takes this enhancement, improve its fly speed by an additional 10 feet and its maneuverability by one step. This enhancement can be taken up to three times. When you envelop yourself in your akashic construct, it envelops your weapons in a shell of akasha as well. Your manufactured and natural weapons are considered to be magical and derived of force, dealing full damage to incorporeal creatures. You gain an insight bonus to your CMD against attempts to disarm your weapons while you are enveloped equal to twice the amount of essence invested in the akashic construct. If a creature attempts to sunder your weapons, you may choose to use the higher of the weapons or akashic constructs hardness against the attack, and may choose to split the damage between the akashic construct and the weapon if the creatures sunder attempt is successful. Whenever you increase the size category of your akashic construct, the shell enveloping your manufactured weapons increases in size as well, allowing your manufactured weapons to be wielded and deal damage as if they had increased in size along with the akashic construct. If your akashic construct has the Akashic Armament or Weapon Infusion upgrade, you can select a single manufactured weapon in place of a veil when using those upgrades, applying their effects to the chosen manufactured weapon. The aksha that makes up the construct infuses the weapons you wield, causing them to deal more damage. While enveloped by the akashic construct, you are treated as though you had the Weapon Specialization feat with the weapons or natural weapons produced by a single veil you can shape, chosen when you shape your akashic construct each day. This upgrade can be taken multiple times, affecting an additional veil each time it is selected. While enveloped by your akashic construct, you are treated as though you had the Greater Weapon Specialization feat with the weapons or natural weapons produced by one veil selected by the Weapon Infusion upgrade. This upgrade can be taken multiple times, affecting an additional veil each time it is selected.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 15 with your akashic construct, akashic infusion akashic upgrade
benefits: chakra bind (body) binding this veil to your body chakra grants you all the of binding it to your shoulders chakra, and allows you to cause your akashic construct to grow up to two size categories instead of only one.

name: Flow of Battle
description: Your power shifts as you prepare to strike. You gain 1 point of essence. Special If you possess the Clashing Essence feat, then you may reallocate your essence as though you had used Clashing Essence whenever you initiate a maneuver as an immediate action.
benefits: whenever you initiate a maneuver as a swift action, or enter a stance, you may reallocate your essence as part of the action taken to do so.

name: Focused Critical
description: You can focus your spirit into your weapon attacks, dealing more damage with successful critical strikes. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on attack rolls made to confirm a critical threat. you also gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on damage rolls made as part of a critical hit. (this extra damage is also multiplied for the critical hit.)

name: Foldable Bindings
description: You have learned to further adapt your chakra binds to better utilize them with your folded veils.
prerequisites: ability to change your chakra binds as part of shaping your veils, folded veil or ability to fold veils granted by a class feature
benefits: when you shape your veils for the day and choose which chakra slots you may bind, you may choose a different selection of chakra binds for each of your veil loadouts. the chakra binds chosen for each loadout must be legal choices for all of your shaped and bound veils within and outside of each loadout. for example as an 8th level transcendent you could select the hands, feet, and wrists binds for one of your loadouts, and the feet, head, and shoulders slot for your other load out. if you have a veil shaped outside of your loadouts in the hands slot that you wish to bind, you would need to have the hands bind selected as part of each loadout.

name: Fold Minor Veils
description: Your minor veils are folded as easily as your major veils. Special If your game is using the Automatic Minor Veils optional ruleset, veilweaving classes who gain the ability to fold their veils as a class feature (such as the transcendent) gain this feat as a bonus feat when they first gain that class feature.
prerequisites: ability to shape minor veils, folded veil or ability to fold veils granted by a class feature
benefits: you can fold your minor veils, as per the transcendents twice-folded veils class feature. you may fold every minor veil you can shape in this way. you may still only shape minor veils using your minor veil slots in both your primary and reserve loadouts. in addition to the above link, the rules for minor veils can also be found printed in akashic staples, published by studio m.

name: Folded Veil
description: You have learned to fold a veil within another, allowing them to be folded and refolded to change their effects. If you have the twice-folded veils or thrice-folded veils class feature, you instead gain the ability to affect one of your veil slots not normally affected by those abilities with that ability, following the same restrictions as above. Special This feat can be selected multiple times, allowing you to fold an additional veil each time it is selected.
benefits: you have learned to fold one of your veils, as per the transcendents twice-folded veils class feature. you may choose one of your veils to fold in this way each day when you shape your veils. the normal restrictions for which veils you may shape using those slots continue to apply (such as the veil granted by a huays veil of nature class feature, or a veil shaped using a volurs brandbinding slots).

name: Font of Light
description: Your storms can call down a wide beam of light, rather than a number of smaller beams. You can choose a new location for this beam, choose to buff individual creatures, or choose to stop buffing individual creatures and create a beam once per turn as a free action. You gain 1 point of essence
prerequisites: ability to shape the heavensfall or the hellsfall.
benefits: rather than affecting a number of individual creatures with the heavensfall or the hellsfall, you can create a single 5-foot radius beam of light within the area of the storm and affect all creatures within that beam with the veil. this beam extends from the top of the storm to the ground in a straight line. this beam does not move with you, and immediately dissipates if it leaves the area of the storm. for every 3 points of essence invested in the beams veil, you may increase the radius of the beam by up to 5 feet.

name: Fortified Bodily Enhancements
description: You have learned to further fortify the enhancements to your body granted by your obsession.
prerequisites: special this feat can be selected an additional time at promethean level 13, and this feat counts as the toughness feat for the purposes of .
benefits: you gain an additional 1 hit point per promethean level, and the natural armor granted by your bodily enhancements feature increases by +1.

name: Gory Veil
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 or more veils, con 15
benefits: when you shape your veils for the day, you can choose to shape one of those veils from your blood and viscera in the form of a goreveil. goreveils cannot be normally invested with essence from any source except this feat. instead, you can take a number of points of damage equal to your veilweaving level as a swift action to infuse one of your goreveils with power, treating that veil as invested with a number of points of essence equal to 1 + 1 point per four veilweaving levels or equal to that veils essence capacity, whichever is lower. this essence persists for as long as you continue to suffer this damage, if this damage is healed the effectiveness of this invested essence is reduced by 1 for each hit point of this damage healed, to a minimum of 0 essence which ends the effect. a single veil cannot be affected by multiple instances of this ability at a time, and this ability stacks with similar effects (such as essence catalysts). you cannot choose to reduce or otherwise ignore damage dealt by this ability, and this damage ignores any temporary hit points you possess. if a veil affected by this ability is suppressed, it continues to be affected by this ability when it is unsuppressed. if it is unshaped, the effect ends. you may have multiple instances of this ability active at a time, each affecting a separate one of your goreveils shaped using this feat.

name: Greater Psikashic Fusion
description: Veil, chakra, power, mind
prerequisites: thug level 12th, psikashic fusion class feature
benefits: you may use your psikashic fusion ability on your 2nd level non-cult thug powers. when you do so, you treat them as a 3rd level cult power when determining how they are affected by psikashic fusion.

name: Heat Adapted
description: Your body is well-adapted to hot environments. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: cactusfolk, gamla, morphbear, nameer, nisr, or wyrmkin.
benefits: you gain fire resistance 5. in addition, you are unaffected by very hot conditions, treat severe heat as very hot, and extreme heat as severe heat. you may invest essence into this feat to increase the granted fire resistance by 5 and gain a +1 racial bonus on fortitude saves to resist the effects of severe heat and very hot conditions per point of essence invested.

name: Heavenly Scion
description: The power of Heaven flows through you freely. In addition, if you have ten Angelic Armaments veils shaped, the essence capacity for all veils from this set increases by 1. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as you have at least two veils from the angelic armaments veil set shaped all of your attacks are treated as good-aligned for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. if you have the planar detonation class feature, your planar detonation deals one additional point of electricity damage per angelic armaments veil you have shaped.

name: Hellbound
description: Whether Hell is your master or you seek to master Hell, its power answer your call eagerly. In addition, if you have ten Reliquaries of Infernal Law veils shaped, the essence capacity for all veils from this set increases by 1. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as you have at least two veils from the reliquaries of infernal law veil set shaped all of your attacks are treated as evil-aligned for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. if you have the planar detonation class feature, your planar detonation deals one additional point of fire damage per reliquaries of infernal law veil you have shaped.

name: High Noon
description: You are like the sun at high noon, burning away all shadows under your light. Whenever you initiate a maneuver that has a least one point of essence invested into it, your next attack made within one round gains a bonus to damage equal to the level of the maneuver plus the essence invested in that maneuver. This bonus damage does not stack with itself. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: two radiant dawn maneuvers known, two maneuvers from another discipline known, cannot have sunrise or sunset feat.
benefits: you may invest essence into maneuvers that you cannot normally invest essence into.

name: Implant Thoughts
description: Your warped mind has allowed you to interact with the minds you can read, implemenng your thoughts into their minds. Prerequesites Promethean 5, hear thoughts, warped mind
benefits: you can communicate your own thoughts telepathically to creatures within range of your hear thoughts ability. this does not allow said creatures to respond to your telepathic communication unless you are actively reading their surface thoughts.

name: Improved Psikashic Fusion
description: Essence is power is essence is power
prerequisites: thug level 8th, psikashic fusion class feature
benefits: you may use your psikashic fusion ability on your 1st level non-cult thug powers. when you do so, you treat them as a 2nd level cult power when determining how they are affected by psikashic fusion.

name: Inaugurate Title
description: As the Rajah learns new veils, she can mold them to her unique abilities. You gain 1 point of essence. Special You can take this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack; each time you take this feat, you choose a new veil to gain as a title.
benefits: choose a veil from any classs veil list that is shaped into one of the following slots belt, body, chest, feet, hands, head, headband, neck, shoulders, or wrists. a veil that can be shaped in multiple slots is not eligible to be taken unless both slots are included in this list. you add this veil to your rajah veil list with the title descriptor, allowing you to shape it onto allies using the normal veilweaving rules. in order to bind this veil to a chakra, your veilweaver level must be at least equal to the level that the class the veil originally came from gains access to that chakra, using the lowest level if the veil comes from multiple classes. if the veil is not on any classes list, the rajah may bind that veil at 4th level for veils in the hands, head, or feet slots, 8th level for headband, shoulders, or wrists slots, 12th level for neck or belt slots, or 16th for chest or body slots.

name: King's Castle (feat)
description: A perfect castle repels all attacks. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when an opponent makes a melee attack against an ally with this feat who is no farther away from you than half your land speed, as an immediate action you can move up to half your speed directly towards the ally. this movement provokes attacks of opportunity. as long as you end this movement adjacent to the targeted ally, you may take the attack in their place. the attack is resolved as though you were the original target of the attack, comparing the attack roll to your defenses and dealing damage as appropriate. you may invest essence into this feat, increasing your land speed by 5 feet per point of essence invested.

name: Lattice-Born
description: Your soul has become a gateway to somewhere else. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: cannot have the convergence class feature.
benefits: choose the tier 1 convergence for a single plane. you gain the of the chosen ability, except for those which modify the nexuss planar detonation ability. if you have at least 12 hit dice, you also gain the of that planes tier 3 convergence. your nexus level equals your character level.

name: Life Bond
description: You can transfer your own vital essence into another. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you gain the ability to transfer your life force to other living creatures. as long as you are in physical contact with another creature, you can spend a full round action to transfer any number of your own hit points to that creature. you must transfer at least 1 hit point when using this ability, and you cannot lower your current hit points below zero. for each point of essence invested in this ability, increase the amount of healing your target receives by 5 hit points.

name: Lingering Cracks
description: You have specialized your techniques so that when you attempt and fail to shatter a veil, you leave lingering damage. This penalty stacks with itself if you make multiple successful sunder attempts without successfully suppressing the veil, and each such attempt renews the duration of each application of this ability. Once a veil affected by ability has been successfully suppressed by a sunder, the effects of this feat upon that veil end.
prerequisites: improved sunder, or ability to sunder veils through the use of a veil or other magical ability.
benefits: whenever you make a successful sunder attempt against a veil and fail to deal enough damage to suppress it, that veils hardness is reduced by 1 and the number of points of damage it needs to suffer to be suppressed are reduced by 2 for 1 minute. at 5th level, and every 5 levels thereafter, the veils hardness is reduced by an additional 1, and the hit points needed to sunder it are reduced by an additional 2. if this penalty would reduce the veils hit points required to sunder it to 0, it is suppressed as if it were successfully sundered.

name: Malleable Shardrain
description: Greater mastery over your shardrains has allowed you control over their shape. When doing so, the shard uses that weapons damage dice and critical threat range and counts as that weapon for the purpose of feats and abilities instead of a greatsword. When used as a melee weapon, the shard also gains any weapon abilities of that weapon (such as the reach property). You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you create a shard using the shardrain, you can choose to have that shard take the shape of any mundane melee weapon in which you are proficient. this weapon must be an entirely solid weapon, such as a spear or a longsword, not weapons formed of leather, chain, or other flexible or malleable materials.

name: Malefic Essence
description: You have learned to bolster your granted gifts with your own lifeforce. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, hex class feature.
benefits: you can bind essence into this feat. add the number of bound essence to your class level to determine the duration of your hexes.

name: Master Chef
description: Look upon my feasts, ye hungry, and eat! Additionally, you immediately learn (or create) 3 akashic recipes. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you gain the ability to bind the chefs armory veil. this does not grant you the ability to bind other veils to the hand slot, and any abilities that you would gain from being able to bind to the hand slot do not function (unless you have another way to bind to the hand chakra).

name: Merciful Veils
description: Though the road may be harder, you have tempered your might with mercy. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you shape your veils for the day, you may select one or more of your veils that deal damage. any damage dealt by the selected veils becomes nonlethal. this does not change the type of damage inflicted, a veil that inflicts fire damage inflicts nonlethal fire damage instead. the of this feat are not shared by attacks and abilities used by creatures created by a veil.

name: Minor Veil Mastery
description: Your mastery over minor veils allows you to weave them alongside more powerful constructs of akasha. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least one veil and one minor veil.
benefits: you may shape your minor veils to the same chakra slots as another veil. this stacks with other abilities that allow you to shape multiple veils to the same chakra slots, such as the twinveil feat.

name: Mistmask Mutation
description: The transformative nature of the mists allows you to effect short changes to your form for as long as you dare risk its power. You gain 1 point of essence. Games that do not allow or use summoning rules may wish to allow temporary use of a monstrous physique spell for the duration of Mistmask Mutation. The level of the monstrous physique spell should equal number of essence invested in this variant but still carries the same duration and usage limitations.
prerequisites: mistmask slayer; mistmask style; disguise 11 ranks, knowledge (planes) 11 ranks
