benefits: when investing essence in mistmask style, you may select a number of evolutions equal to the essence invested, you select evolutions as though you were an eidolon belonging to a summoner of half your hit dice. evolutions selected must be appropriate to a base form similar to your own (gm discretion). if you maintain essence in mistmask style while choosing to maintain evolutions for more rounds than the higher of your constitution or veilweaving modifier (if any) you must roll against the mist exposure table (see below) as though each extra round beyond your modifier was one hour of exposure. evolutions granting bonuses to the disguise skill do not impact your passive dc for mistmask style.

name: Mistmask Slayer
description: The predatory nature of the Mist has begun to empower your own mistmask persona unleashing a deadly mystical hunter. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: mistmask style; disguise 6 ranks, knowledge (planes) 6 ranks
benefits: in addition to concealing identity, your attacks and damaging effects against creatures failing to see through the mistmask passive disguise skill dc also gain an insight bonus to damage equal to the essence invested in mistmask style. additionally, creatures failing to see through the mistmask take a -1 morale penalty to ac and saves against you powers, spells, supernatural abilities, and spell-like abilities (including veils) per 2 essence invested in mistmask style.

name: Mistmask Style
description: Shaping the essence of the Mists you create a mask that distorts sound and clouds over movements and features beneath it. You gain 1 point of essence. Special The mistmask this feat creates is distinctive and can be recognized even when you are not. You may change the mistmasks appearance once per level. Mistmasks are a powerful tool of deception and concealment granting a number of advantages to the characters that invest in the feat chain. The narrative context of the feat chain is one of opposed schools of martial arts utilizing the powers of the Mists to enhance both their mysteries and prowess. It is advised that some GMs may not want to allow the Mistmask Style feat chain without an opposed faction of other Mistmask Style fighters.
prerequisites: charisma 13+, disguise 1 rank, knowledge planes 1 rank, must have been exposed for 1 hour to the mist of the cloud stairway.
benefits: when you adopt this style with a swift action, you create a special disguise called a mistmask. you gain a passive disguise skill check dc equal to 10+your ranks in the disguise skill+your charisma modifier. traits and feats increasing your disguise skill modifier are also added. you may invest essence in this feat. the passive disguise dc gains a +2 bonus for each essence invested in this feat. this disguise draws upon the mist of the cloud stairway. the mistmask disguises your species, gender, and identifying characteristics to those who fail to beat the dc of the check. additionally, creatures trying to identify spells, powers, and veils you utilize must beat the same passive disguise skill dc instead of the normal dc to recognize them, but still use the relevant skill. you received a bonus equal to your invested essence to saves against transmutation, polymorph, psychometabolic powers, and similar abilities. you are immune to transformative powers of the mist.

name: Moldable Minor Veils
description: You have learned to mold the akasha that forms your minor veils into other shapes. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least one minor veil.
benefits: when you shape a minor veil, you can alter the slot it is normally shaped in to one of the following slots hands, head, wrists, or headband.

name: Mystic Spinnerets
description: Your ancestors were long in the practice of weaving many things including webs, lies, and even the fabric of magic. You have inherited a small measure of their talents. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you gain the akashic subtype. while in your bestial form you are always considered to have the lashing spinnerets veil shaped and you do not count it against your total veils shaped or veil slots. as this veil does not count against your veil slots or chakras, you can still shape a different veil into the same slot as lashing spinnerets freely.

name: Narcissism
description: Be wary of the one who sets a title on their own brow. You can shape that veil using the normal veilweaving rules. If you do not have levels in a veilweaving class, you have total veils shaped of 1 and use your Wisdom to determine the DCs and effects of your veil abilities. If you gain any levels in a veilweaving class, your primary veilweaving attribute is determined by that class. Once chosen, the veil granted by this feat can never be changed. Your veilweaver level for this veil is equal to your character level. Finally, the veil you selected loses its title descriptor. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, choose a new veil.
benefits: when this feat is selected, choose a veil from any classs veil list that has the title descriptor. the veil must match one of the following slots belt, body, chest, feet, hands, head, headband, neck, shoulders, or wrists. a veil that can be shaped into multiple slots is not eligible to be taken unless both slots are included in this list.

name: Noble Astrologist
description: The stars step down from the heavens to fight at your command. You gain 1 point of essence. Special You may take this feat multiple times, choosing a different constellation each time. If you gain the constellations class feature after taking this feat, you must immediately retrain this feat, exchanging it for any other feat you qualify for.
prerequisites: amateur astrologist, essence pool of 3 or higher, knowledge (arcana) 8 ranks, cannot have the constellations class feature.
benefits: you gain the ability to manifest the champion option of the constellation you chose with the amateur astrologist feat. if you have taken the amateur astrologist feat more than once, choose one of your constellations to gain the champion from.

name: Pawn's Sacrifice
description: No war was ever won without casualties. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: sense motive 5 ranks, ability to manifest a veil companion or champion constellation.
benefits: whenever you have a veil companion or champion constellation you manifested yourself adjacent to you and become the target of an attack, you may attempt a sense motive check with a dc equal to the attack roll to anticipate the attacks trajectory and redirect the attack to the champion or companion instead, comparing the attack roll to its ac normally as though it had been the original target of the attack (even if the attack would not normally have been able to reach the champion). you may invest essence into this feat, gaining a +1 insight bonus on sense motive checks per point of essence invested.

name: Pistoleros Bind
description: With a flick of the wrist you repair your damaged weapon with a thin layer of akasha.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, proficient with at least one firearm, ability to bind veils to your hands slot.
benefits: you can use a swift action to remove the broken condition from a single firearm you are currently wielding, as long as that condition was gained by a firearm misfire. this is not a permanent fix, as you have merely reinforced the weapon with a weak akashic veil. an additional misfire will shatter the akashic bonds, returning the weapon to the broken condition.

name: Precision Veil Breaking
description: You can aim multiple precise blows against a veil to shatter it in a flurry of smaller strikes. Normal You must deal enough damage to sunder a veil in a single hit.
benefits: when you sunder a veil multiple times as part of the same action (such as when making multiple attacks as part of a full-attack), treat all of the damage you deal to the veil, after subtracting its hardness from each hit, as if it were dealt by a single sunder attempt when determining if you successfully sunder the veil.

name: Psionic Insight
description: Veils, powers, what is the difference? Magic is magic, is it not? Example A guru who gains this feat chooses psychic warrior (both of which are Wisdom-based). The guru can now count their guru class levels as psychic warrior manifester levels if using a psicrown, or using dorjes and power stones of psychic warrior spells.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 6th with chosen class, knowledge (psionics) 6 ranks, spellcraft 6 ranks.
benefits: when you gain this feat, choose a manifesting class. then choose one veilweaving class you possess. these two classes must use the same ability score for manifesting and veilweaving. you may count your veilweaver class levels as manifester levels for the purposes of manifester level-based abilities, such as determining your manifester level when using a psicrown. as well, you may use power trigger and power completion items as though you possessed the chosen class power list.

name: Queen's Knight
description: No mortals loyalty can match the constancy of the stars. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: knowledge (arcana) 5 ranks, ability to manifest a veil companion or champion constellation.
benefits: as long as you and a veil companion or champion constellation you have manifested are within 60 feet of each other and able to see or hear each other, you both gain a +2 morale bonus on will saving throws, and your veil companions and champions cannot be compelled to attack or harm you by any means. charm and compulsion effects still work as normal, but any attempt to command one of your companions or champions to attack you or take any other action that would cause you direct harm automatically fails and grants them a new saving throw (if applicable) against the effect. you may invest essence into this feat, increasing the granted morale bonus to will saving throws by +1 per point of essence invested.

name: Radiant Dawn Style
description: Your martial abilities are laden with restorative akasha. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: 1 or more radiant dawn stances, diplomacy 3 ranks.
benefits: whenever you initiate a maneuver, you or an ally within close range (25 feet + 5 feet/2 character levels) is healed for a number of hit points equal to your character level, plus the amount of essence invested in that maneuver. this effect can only trigger once per round.

name: Radiant Daybreak
description: Your akasha hardens the body, mind, and soul. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as long as an ally is ing from temporary hit points granted by you, they gain a +2 bonus on saves and to ac, and a +10 bonus to all movement speeds. the bonus to saves and ac increases by +1 and the bonus to movement speeds increases by +5 at 15th level and every 5 levels thereafter.

name: Radiant Sunlight
description: What akasha that cannot heal will become a potent shield. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: whenever you restore hit points to an ally, if this healing would raise their hit points to its maximum, they are granted temporary hit points equal to any excess healing. these temporary hit points stack with other temporary hit points granted by you, up to a maximum of of half of the allys maximum hit points, and last for one minute.

name: Rapid Fleshsculpting
description: By utilizing your essence you can rapidly change a creature whose flesh you have sculpted.
benefits: you can take 1 point of essence burn and touch a creature ing from your fleshsculpting feature and change the abilities you have granted them. for each use of this ability on that creature beyond the first, it requires an additional point of essence burn to use this ability (2 essence burn upon the second use, 3 upon the third, and so on).

name: Rapid Incorporation
description: Specialized training has allowed you to more rapidly incorporate objects within your body and call them forth.
prerequisites: special this feat counts as the quick draw feat for the purposes of . if one of your feats or abilities would allow you to draw your weapons or grant you bonuses when you draw your weapons, partially drawing forth a weapon you have incorporated qualifies for both.
benefits: you may incorporate objects within your body by spending one full round, rather than 1 minute, you can partially draw forth an incorporated object as a free action, and you can don and doff incorporated armor or clothing as a free action.

name: Rapid Folding
description: Your particularly potent attunement between your soul and your veils allows you to fold and unfold them more quickly a limited number of times each day. Special This feat can be selected multiple times, allowing you to fold your veils more rapidly two additional times each day each time it is selected after the first.
benefits: you are able to fold your veils twice each day as a move action. at 6th level, and every 6 levels thereafter, you may more rapidly fold your veils one additional time each day. you may only fold your veils in this way once per round.

name: Rapid Shift
description: You have learned to meditate upon a single veil you have shaped, allowing you to shift and reshape its akashic energies. If you have the veilshifting class feature, you instead gain an additional use per day of that ability. You gain 1 point of essence. Special You can gain this feat multiple times, granting an additional 1 point of essence and allowing you to use the effects of this feat one additional time per time the feat is gained, or an additional use of your veilshifting class feature for each time this feat is gained
prerequisites: veilweaver level 9th, shift veil or veilshifting class feature
benefits: once per day as a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity you can unshape one of your existing veils and instantly reshape the released energy into a new veil. the veil that you shape using this ability cannot be bound to a chakra until you have spent one hour in meditation, even if the veil replaced this way was already bound.

name: Regency
description: Your granted rule has been given greater autonomy.
benefits: you gain the ability to bind veils shaped in the voice slot. this does not allow you to bind more than one veil to that chakra, even if youve gained the ability to bind there from another source.

name: Registered Foe
description: You have learned to tap into your memories stored within the akashic record and temporarily alter them, allowing you to change your favored foe for a brief period of time. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as a swift action you may bind a point of essence to this feat, allowing you to change one of your favored enemies to a new creature type for 10 minutes per ranger level. if the chosen creature type is already one of your favored enemies, you may swap it with the favored enemy type you wish to replace for the duration, allowing you to utilize your higher bonuses on the selected type and your lower bonuses with the other. you may only bind a maximum number of essence to this feat equal to your essence capacity.

name: Reindeer Form
description: While not a shapeshifters in the traditional sense, a tuktus body is partially composed of akashic energy which grants their form a limited measure of malleability. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: special a tuktu may select this feat any time they would gain a bonus feat from a source that would allow them to select from among multiple options (e.g. sorcerer bloodline feats, or wizard bonus feats). they must still meet the to gain this feat, even if the source would normally allow them to ignore them, such as if they would gain this feat as a monk bonus feat.
benefits: by taking a point of essence burn you can take the form of a reindeer whose appearance is static and cannot be changed each time you assume this form. you retain the of your gore and tundra born racial abilities while transformed. changing from humanoid to reindeer form is a standard action. this ability otherwise functions as beast shape i, and your ability scores change accordingly. essence burn taken to transform in this way lasts until you return to your humanoid form as a standard action.

name: Rending Essence
description: Razor sharp akasha coats your claws. Additionally, if you hit a creature with two claw attacks in the same turn, the second claw attack deals additional damage equal to the invested essence. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, rending claws, str 13, two claw natural weapon attacks, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on critical confirmation rolls with your second claw attack each turn.

name: Repulsion Shield
description: You can use akasha to drive creatures before your shield. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, improved shield bash, shield proficiency, shield slam, two-weapon fighting, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. when taking the free bull rush attack granted by shield slam you gain an insight bonus equal to the invested essence on the bull rush attempt.

name: Resist Corruption
description: You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you do not suffer a penalty to your strength score from corrupted essence , and you are not killed (or destroyed) if your strength is reduced to 0 while you have corrupted essence.

name: Sand Slide
description: The gamlas size and awkward hands belie their uncanny adroitness when battling in their natural environs. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you successfully trip an opponent, you may use your spit racial ability against the target of your trip as a free action. in addition to the spits normal effects, when this ability is used in a sandy environment the spit mixes with sand on the tripped opponents face to form a clay-like substance that blinds the target until they spend a standard action to clear it away. in addition, your desert strider racial ability may now be invested with essence, granting you a +1 racial bonus to cmd to resist a trip and to acrobatics checks in sandy environments per point of essence invested.

name: Selective Veils
description: Long hours of meditation and focus upon your shaping of veils has allowed you to reduce their effects against trusted allies. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: when you shape your veils for the day, you may select a number of allies equal to your veilweaving modifier (minimum 1). you can choose to change these selected creatures once per turn as a free action. these selected creatures take no damage from veils you have shaped, and if they must roll a saving throw against a veil you have shaped they are always treated as if they passed the saving throw when determining its effects.

name: Self Empowerment
description: Sometimes you must take matters into your own hands. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: at least 1 veil with the title descriptor known.
benefits: whenever you shape a veil, you may choose to remove the title descriptor from that veil, shaping it as a normal veil.

name: Set Knowledge
description: You have focused your study on a subset of veils known as a set, granting you a limited knowledge of a few veils. If a veil from a set is shaped to an esoteric chakra (such as the Blood or Ring slot), this feat alone does not grant you the ability to shape that veil.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 veil belonging to a veil set.
benefits: select a single veil you know how to shape that belongs to a veil set (such as angelic armaments). you add all the veils belonging to that set to your veil list, allowing you to shape them using the normal rules in which you shape your veils. if the chosen veil belongs to more than one veil set, you choose which of those sets you add to your veil list when you gain this feat.

name: Shape Minor Veils
description: You have learned to harness your power in such a way that you can shape veils of lesser power that grant minor effect. Special You may select this feat a second time if doing so would not increase the total number of minor veils you can shape to greater than four. If you later gain an ability that would cause this, you automatically retrain the second selection of this feat as part of gaining that ability.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaving level 1, wis 13 or veilweaving modifier +1.
benefits: you gain the ability to shape two minor veils each day, using your character level as your veilweaving level for these veils. if you do not have a veilweaving class, use your wisdom as your veilweaving modifier for these veils. if you have levels in a veilweaving class, or gain any levels in such a class, use your primary veilweaving modifier for these veils. the saving throw dc for these veils is equal to 10 + the number of points of essence invested in the veil + your veilweaving modifier.

name: Shapes of the Primordial Chaos
description: Your advanced convergence with the Primordial Chaos has granted you insight into shaping your very flesh with akasha. Special  To select this feat you must have learned the ability to shape any veil with the [Fleshwarp] descriptor using the Shape Veil feat. You cannot retrain that feat or change the veil you learned using that feat as long as you have this feat.
prerequisites: nexus 8, tier 3 primordial chaos convergence, shape veil (see text)
benefits: you add every veil with the [fleshwarp] descriptor to your veil list.

name: Shape Veil
description: Your ability to shape veils expands, granting you knowledge of a new veil. If you have the ability to only shape a number of veils fewer than 1 + 1 per 5 Hit Dice you possess, you also gain the ability to shape one additional veil each day. If the total veils you can shape in a given day exceeds this maximum, you lose any additional shaped veils granted by this feat that would bring you beyond this total. This does not count as a veil slot granted by one of your veilweaving classes for any abilities that affect veils shaped only using a specific class's veil slots (such as the volur's brandweaving class feature, or the spellweaver's ability to shatter veils they shape to cast spells). If you do not have levels in a veilweaving class, you use your character level as your veilweaving level, and your Wisdom as your veilweaving modifier. The saving throw DC of your veils is equal to 10 + number of points of essence invested in the veil + your veilweaving modifier. Special You can gain this feat multiple times, choosing a new veil to add to your veil list each time you select it. If you have the ability to shape fewer veils than the maximum printed above, you also gain the ability to shape one additional veil each day for each time you select this feat (up to the above maximum).
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaving level 1, wis 13 or veilweaving modifier +1.
benefits: when this feat is selected, choose a veil from any classs veil list that can be shaped in one of the following slots hands, feet, head, wrists, shoulders, headband, neck, belt, chest or body. if a veil can be shaped in more than one slot, each slot it can be shaped in must fall within the above list.

name: Shift Veil
description: You have learned to meditate upon a single veil you have shaped, allowing you to shift and reshape its akashic energies. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can spend 1 hour in meditation to unshape a single veil you have shaped, and then immediately shape a new veil in its place. you can bind this newly shaped veil if you are capable of doing so as part of this process.

name: Shifting Dread
description: You can alter your appearance to briefly strike dread in a foe, allowing you to deliver a particularly deadly strike against them. When attacking a creature who you are mimicking the appearance of who is also shaken by this ability, the bonus to attack rolls and the damage dealt by your dice of precision damage granted by your mimicking dread ability against that creature are both increased by 50% (rounded down). If you have startling dread ability, this feat can instead be used as a free action once per turn and it cannot be used in the same round as your startling dread ability. If a creature has been shaken by that ability and fails a save against this feat, the duration of the shaken condition applied by that ability is instead increased by 1 round.
benefits: you can briefly cause your face to take on a horrific visage as a swift action, forcing a single creature within 5 feet of you to make a will saving throw (dc 10 + 1/2 your promethean level + your intelligence modifier) or become shaken until the start of your next turn. this is a fear effect. this shaken condition cannot be worsened to frightened, nor can it worsen other applications of the shaken condition to frightened.

name: Soul Synergy
description: Your inherent nature empowers those veils that mirror it.
prerequisites: racial trait that grants a veil
benefits: you treat the veils you shape as part of your racial traits as if they were invested with 1 additoonal point of essence, and treat your veilweaving level with those veils as 2 higher (this essence does not count against the veils essence capacity).

name: Stellar Strike
description: Your strikes are charged with the destructive power of the stars themselves. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: base attack bonus +1, ability to manifest a constellations weapon form.
benefits: whenever you are wielding the weapon form of a constellation, you may spend a swift action to release some of the constellations latent power, dealing an additional 2 points of energy damage of the constellations element type with all attacks made with it for 1 round. you may invest essence into this feat, increasing the additional energy damage by 2 per point of essence invested.

name: Storm Scoured
description: Your body was scoured by the force of a particularly powerful or magical storm, awakening essence within you and allowing you to overcome even the most devastating of weather. You gain 1 point of essence. Special If you have the ability to shape Storm veils but do not possess the weatherproofing class feature or a similar ability that allows you to resist the effects of your own Storm veils, in addition to the base effects of this veil you gain the following effects If you would be subjected to a saving throw from a Storm veil you have shaped, you are treated as automatically passing that saving throw. If you would by subjected to an attack roll from a Storm veil you have shaped, that attack automatically misses if you wish it to. If you would take damage from a Storm veil you have shaped, you may choose to reduce the damage dealt to you to 0.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. for each point of essence invested in this feat, you reduce the miss chance imposed by natural and magical weather by 5% (to a minimum of 0%), reduce any penalties to perception checks imposed by natural and magical weather by 1 (to a minimum of 0), and reduce the damage dealt to you by natural and magic weather by 2 (to a minimum of 0). these effects also apply to storm veils used against you.

name: Storm Souled
description: You are the storm, the storm is you. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: any creatures gaining the of your weatherproofing also gain the of storm scoured. additionally, you and all weatherproofed creatures can see through 10 feet of fog, smoke, mist, dirty water, and similar effects per point of essence invested in storm scoured. if the effect was magically caused by you (such as by shaping a storm veil), this distance is doubled. if it was magically caused by an enemy (such as a hostile wizard casting fog cloud), the distance is halved.

name: Striking Mirage
description: You form your essence into the simile of a soldier, which rushes forth to deliver a powerful blow. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: as a move action, you may create a soldier of akasha in your space, or in the space of any creature currently ing from your titles. you may then immediately move this soldier up to your movement speed using any movement mode you have available to you. this soldier of akasha lasts until the end of your turn. you may initiate maneuvers through this soldier using your vassalage class feature as though it were a creature you had entitled. as this soldier is an akashic effect, and not a creature, it cannot be attacked, nor can it attack, make attacks of opportunity, make actions, and so on, but occupies the same number of spaces as the creature whose space it originated in, as though it were a creature of that creatures size category. this soldier is an obvious fake with even a cursory glance; and as such, does not provoke attacks of opportunities as it moves.

name: Studied Veilweaving
description: Your studies have allowed you to improve your veilweaving to make up for your training in another profession.
benefits: add +4 to your veilweaving level, to a maximum of your hit dice. this grants you no other related to veilweaving, such as veils shaped, chakra binds, essence, or essence capacity.

name: Subtle Veilweaving
description: Your veilweaving is particularly subtle, more easily concealed than the effects of other veilweavers. If you conceal the effects of a veil that affects another creature while hidden using Stealth, you must make a Stealth check in addition to the Bluff or Disguise check to avoid revealing yourself. Observers apply their opposed Perception roll to both of these skill checks. If they dont beat your Stealth check, using your veils effect while hidden does not reveal you. You gain 1 point of essence. Normal Activating the effects of a veil has a visual manifestation that reveals you as the source of the effect, and using a veil effect against another creature while hidden reveals you.
benefits: when you use the effects of a veil while observed, you can make a bluff or disguise check opposed by any observers perception checks to conceal the effect from them. if the veil produces an obvious effect (such as a summoned creature or object) you suffer a -4 penalty to this check. if a creature fails this perception check, they either do not notice the effect or do not realize you are the source of the effect (at your gms discretion). creatures directly affected by a concealed effect who fail this perception check know they have been affected by an effect, but do not know you are its source.

name: Sunrise
description: You are like the rays of the rising sun, leading the charge into the darkness. Whenever you initiate a maneuver that has at least one point of essence invested into it, you gain a bonus to AC equal to 1/2 the maneuver level plus the essence invested in that maneuver (Thus, a 4th level maneuver with 2 essence invested in that maneuver grants +4 AC). This AC bonus does not stack with itself, and lasts for 1 round. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: two radiant dawn maneuvers known, two maneuvers from another discipline known, cannot have high noon or sunset feat.
benefits: you may invest essence into maneuvers that you cannot normally invest essence into.

name: Sunset
description: You are like the setting sun, whose last rays bolsters others against the oncoming darkness. Whenever you initiate a maneuver that has at least one point of essence invested into it, one ally within close range (25 feet + 5 feet per 2 initiator levels) gains a number of temporary hit points equal to your character level plus the essence invested in that maneuver. These temporary hit points stack with other temporary hit points granted by you, up to a maximum of of half of the allys maximum hit points, and last for one minute. This effect can only trigger once per round. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: two radiant dawn maneuvers known, two maneuvers from another discipline known, cannot have sunrise or high noon feat.
benefits: you may invest essence into maneuvers that you cannot normally invest essence into.

name: Suppressive Dissolution
description: Your form can be suppressed to such a point that it loses physical cohesion.
benefits: while your base veil is suppressed you can fully suppress your physical form as a free or immediate action, gaining the effects of gaseous form as an extraordinary effect. while in this state you gain the bonus to stealth checks granted by willful suppression. deactivating this ability can be done as a free action on your turn, or automatically when your base veil stops being suppressed. this effect does not apply to any of your non-magical equipment (causing any mundane equipment you are carrying or wearing to fall to the ground in your space), and activating this ability automatically suppresses all of your veils you have shaped until you deactivate this ability. if you have a swim speed, you can enter water and other liquids while in your gaseous form using this ability, and are considered to have a swim speed of 10 feet while doing so.

name: Swift Dissolution
description: You retain your mobility and speed while your physical form is suppressed.
prerequisites: suppressive dissolution or incarnate form racial trait
benefits: while in your gaseous form granted by suppressive dissolution or by your incarnate form trait, your fly speed is equal to your base land speed (to a minimum of 10 feet), and you are not treated as staggered if your base veil is suppressed (even while outside of your gaseous form). while moving through a space less than half your size while in your gaseous form, you move at half your normal fly speed (to a minimum of 10 feet). additionally, you can use stealth and move at your full movement speed while in your gaseous form without penalty.

name: Symbol of Mercy
description: This akashic seal is proof that you have the power to slay your foe, and yet chose to spare your blade. Additionally, you may force the creature to enact a single, simple command of two words or less. For example, you may tell a creature to move here or start talking, but you couldnt tell the creature to go to the city (As this would be too many words) or tell the truth as its both too many words and truth is too complex for this ability. Symbol of Mercy is a unique feat that allows one to save an opponent for death. In exchange, they are able to give the target a single command to follow. The GM has the final word on what command can be given, but as a guideline, the command should be simple enough to be stated in one or two sentences. Things like Go home Drop your weapons or Sing the national anthem are all valid choices, assuming that theres nothing preventing the creature from doing so. An immobile creature cannot go anywhere, a wolf cannot drop their weapons (unless they happen to be carrying one), and a bandit couldnt sing an anthem if they had no voice (Or didnt know the words). As commands get more complex, the greater chance they have of not being executed properly, or simply failing out right. A cultist couldnt be forced to tell the truth about a certain incident, after all, as truth is a complicated subject, and while they may be forced to speak about a certain incident, they do not have to tell the truth, or may choose to omit certain details. Likewise, telling someone to complete everything on this page or sign this page, and then presenting someone with a page of tasks or a contract is the same as commanding them to do all of those tasks or adhering to everything in that contract, which would fail because this would be multiple commands instead of the single granted by the feat. Should a command be given that they could not complete, the command is wasted, but the character who owns the feat should have a good idea about what the feat can accomplish and what it cannot; even if the characters player doesnt. Thus, the GM and player should work out what would work and what wont work in regards to this feat.
benefits: whenever an opponent within close range (25 feet + 5 feet per 2 character levels) would die or be destroyed, you may intervene as a free action, even if it is not your turn. the opponent is instead reduced to 1 hit point, and an akashic seal is placed somewhere on their body that lasts until next sunrise. while this seal persists, you may prevent the target from taking any action (such as moving, attacking, talking, etc), except the actions that you explicitly allow.

name: Thick-Skinned
description: Your flesh is unusually tough and resilient. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: magical beast type or akashic subtype.
benefits: you gain a +2 natural armor bonus; if you already have a natural armor bonus of +1 or greater you instead increase your existing natural armor bonus by +1. in addition, you gain dr 2/- against nonlethal damage. you may invest essence into this feat to increase your natural armor bonus by an additional +1 and increase the nonlethal damage reduction by 2.

name: Titles from Distant Shores
description: With a bit of training, any veilweaver can shape a veil onto another. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 veil.
benefits: whenever you shape a veil that does not have the title descriptor, you may apply the title descriptor to that veil. this veil can be shaped on an ally as if it were a normal title. you cannot bind this veil to its chakra unless you can both bind veils to the chakra in question and are at least veilweaver level 7th (for the hands, head, or feet chakras), veilweaver level 13th (for the headband, shoulders, or wrist chakras), or veilweaver level 17th (for the neck or belt chakras). when shaping a veil in this way, you can never bind it to chakras other than those listed here.

name: Treble Walls
description: You can channel the tale of the metal clad walls of Atlantis into your own aura. Moats and Walls (Su) The warden emits a 15- foot radius aura centered on themself that makes assailing them and those within their domain difficult. All creatures within this aura, other than the warden, reduce all of their movement speeds by 5 feet to a minimum of 5 feet. Decreases to movement speeds last until the end of a creatures turn. In addition, arrows, rays, and other ranged attacks made against the warden and allies adjacent to them, have a 5% miss chance. This miss chance does not stack with miss chances gained from other sources such as concealment. The warden can begin or end this effect as a swift action, and it automatically ends if the warden is knocked unconscious. As a free action during their turn, the warden can choose to exclude a number of creatures equal to their veilweaving modifier from the harmful effects of this aura. The selected creatures also automatically pass Reflex saves against the ability nothing can escape, gained at 9th level. This ability can be invested with essence. For each point of essence invested in this ability its radius increases by 5 feet and the miss chance increases by 5%. At 5th and 13th level, the miss chance increases by 5% and movement speed reduction increases by an additional 5 feet. The effects of nothing can escape are applied when creatures attempt to enter the radius of this aura. Entangled creatures are automatically freed if this effect ends or once they are no longer in its area of effect You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you gain the following alternate aura that you can activate as a swift action. you can not have both this aura and containment field active at the same time. activating one ends the other.

name: Treewalker
description: You can run up trees and other living vertical surfaces as though they were solid ground. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 15 or veilweaver level 3, ability to bind veils to your feet slot.
benefits: you gain the ability to bind your essence to trees, plants, and other non-sentient living things, allowing you to move up and down the surfaces of these as though you had a climb speed equal to your base land speed.

name: Truly Malleable Form
description: You have mastered the art of altering your form, allowing you to blend in effortlessly with living creatures.
prerequisites: malleable form racial trait, living veil.
benefits: you gain the ability to disguise your base veil and you treat it as if it were invested with no essence when doing so, and you are no longer restricted by your base veil when using your malleable form racial trait, allowing you to fully customize the appearance of your form and granting you a +10 racial bonus on disguise checks when doing so. this bonus does not stack with the disguise self spell, or similar abilities.

name: True Psikashic Fusion
description: ESSENCE OVERWHELMING!
prerequisites: thug level 16th, psikashic fusion class feature
benefits: you may use your psikashic fusion ability on your 3rd level non-cult thug powers. when you do so, you treat them as a 4th level cult power when determining how they are affected by psikashic fusion.

name: Twinveil
description: One of your chakra slots becomes more receptive and capable of sustaining more akasha than would normally be possible. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. You cannot select the same chakra slot using this feat multiple times
benefits: choose a chakra slot which you can shape veils to. two of your shaped veils can occupy that chakra simultaneously. both of these veils count against your number of shaped veils, as normal. if you have the ability to bind veils to the chosen chakra, you may bind both of the veils to it. when you shape your veils each day, you may change the chakra slot chosen with this feat to another.

name: Twinned Treasures
description: You have learned to entwine two treasures together, allowing them both to adorn a single veil. Adorning a single veil with two treasures in this way counts as adorning two veils when determining the number of veils you have adorned with treasures. For example if you can adorn four veils with treasures, using this feat you could adorn one of your veils with two treasures, and two of your veils with one treasure each. Special This feat can be selected multiple times, allowing you to select an additional veil each day to adorn with up to two akashic treasures.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 9th, ability to adorn an akashic treasure
benefits: when you shape your veils for the day, you may adorn a single veil of your choice with up to two of your akashic treasures.

name: Unlock High Binding
description: Your ability to bind your veils reaches a level that is impossible to surpass without truly dedicated training, unlocking one of your high chakra Special You can gain this feat multiple times, choosing a different chakra slot each time you select it
benefits: choose one of the following chakra slots neck or belt. you gain the ability to bind veils to the chosen chakra.

name: Unlock Flexibility
description: You have achieved a manner of flexibility with the chakra slots you have learned to unlock. Special If you become able to bind veils to all of the chakra slots available to one of the above feats, you may retrain this feat for free as part of leveling up.
prerequisites: unlock low binding or unlock middle binding or unlock high binding.
benefits: each day when you shape your veils, you can change the chakra binds you have chosen to unlock using the unlock low binding, unlock middle binding, and unlock high binding feats

name: Unlock Low Binding
description: Special You can gain this feat multiple times, choosing a different chakra slot each time you select it
prerequisites: you have honed your ability to shape veils, unlocking one of your low chakras veilweaving level 5th, veilweaving modifier +1
benefits: choose one of the following chakra slots hands or feet. you gain the ability to bind veils to the chosen chakra. if you have a veilweaving level of 7th, you can also choose from the head bind

name: Unlock Middle Binding
description: Your ability to hone your veils by binding them to your chakras has further improved, unlocking one of your middle chakra Special You can gain this feat multiple times, choosing a different chakra slot each time you select it
benefits: choose one of the following chakra slots wrists or shoulders. you gain the ability to bind veils to the chosen chakra. if you have a veilweaving level of 13th, you can also choose from the headband bind.

name: Variable Adaptation
description: Your adaptations are more variable than others of your kind, allowing you to further specialize your weapons towards defensive ends. Any time you meditate to change your bodily adaptations you can choose to exchange a weapon adaptation for a bodily adaptation, turn an exchanged weapon adaptation back into a bodily adaptation, or both. Any time you invest essence, you can choose to exchange a bodily adaptation for a weapon adaptation, turn an exchanged bodily adaptation back into a weapon adaptation, or both. You may never have more than one adaptation exchanged at a time using this ability. For example; a 5th level adaptationist promethean has the ability to choose 2 weapon adaptations and 1 bodily adaptation. Using this feat, they could have 3 weapon adaptations and 0 bodily adaptations, or 1 weapon adaptation and 2 bodily adaptations (or the original number of each type of adaptation).
benefits: you can increase the number of bodily adaptations you choose by 1 by reducing the number of weapon adaptations you choose by 1, or vice versa.

name: Veil-Bound Detection
description: Using your essence you can better manipulate your senses, allowing you to preternaturally sense danger to detect hidden traps and foes. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaving level 1, wisdom 13 or veilweaving modifier +1.
benefits: this feat can be invested with essence. as long as it is invested with at least 1 point of essence, you can disable magical traps using the disable device skill. for each point of essence invested in this feat, gain a +1 insight bonus on perception check to spot hidden creatures and to find traps, on disable device attempts, and to ac and reflex saves against traps.

name: Veilbound Metamagic
description: You can use essence to enhance your spells. You gain 1 point of essence
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, ability to cast 1st-level spells, any metamagic feat.
benefits: when you take this feat, choose one metamagic feat you know. once per day, you can invest essence into this feat and choose one or more spells that you know (and have prepared, if you prepare spells) to apply the effects of the selected feat to. using this ability adds one hour to the normal time required for spell preparation (for spontaneous casters this requires an hour of meditation). you must invest a number of points of essence equal to the normal spell level adjustment required by the metamagic feat (minimum 1 point of essence) for each spell to be affected. the next time you cast that spell, the spell gains the effect of that feat without any change to its level (or casting time, if you cast spells spontaneously). you can apply the effect of this feat to as many spells as you can afford to invest with essence. for example, you could invest 4 points of essence to quicken one spell (as quicken spell), or 12 points of essence to quicken 3 spells, as long as you had at least 12 points of essence to invest, an essence capacity of at least 4, and knew the quicken spell feat. once essence is invested in a spell, it remains invested until the spell is cast, at which point the essence returns to your essence pool.

name: Veilbound Resilience
description: You can use akasha to seal your wounds, causing the wounds to throb with eldritch energy while they mend. If you have the ability to bind a veil to your body slot, each use of this ability instead heals 5 hp per point of essence invested in the feat. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, heal 1 rank.
benefits: once per day, you can invest essence in this feat. as a swift action, you can heal your own wounds. each use of this ability heals 3 hp per point of essence invested in the feat, and you can use the feat a number of times per day equal to the invested essence. this is a supernatural ability. once the amount of essence invested is chosen, it cannot be altered and remains invested for 24 hours.

name: Veil-Touched Nemesis
description: Akashic energy imbues your attacks, enabling your allies to more easily exploit your enemys weaknesses. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, favored enemy class feature.
benefits: whenever you successfully deal weapon damage to a favored enemy, that enemy suffers a penalty to armor class against all attacks made by your allies equal to the amount of essence invested in this feat for 1 round. this penalty does not apply to attacks made by you.

name: Veil-Woven Channel
description: You can enhance the power of your Channel Energy ability with akasha-focused power. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, channel energy class feature.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. when you use your channel energy class feature choose one of the following armor class, fortitude saves, reflex saves, will saves, or attack rolls. when you use channel energy to heal, all creatures healed by the effect gain a bonus equal to the amount of invested essence to the selected ability for 1 round. when you use your channel energy class feature to deal damage, all creatures who fail their save take a penalty to the selected ability equal to the amount of essence invested for 1 round.

name: Veiled in Purity
description: You can wrap your chakra in positive energy, concealing your true nature.
benefits: you gain a +1 sacred bonus to the save dcs of veils with the good descriptor and increase any sacred bonuses normally offered by such veils by +1. if your alignment is not good, you appear as one alignment step closer to good for each veil with the good descriptor you have equipped when subjected to abilities like a paladins detect evil ability or detect alignment spells. if you have at least three veils with the good descriptor bound, you are treated as being good aligned for spells and abilities whose effects are determined by alignment, such as a paladins smite evil or a holy smite spell.

name: Veils of Life
description: The bonus effects of this feat cannot exceed the normal healing provided by your veils. For instance, an Immaculate Touch veil with 2 points of essence invested in it would heal 2d6+1 hit points. If you roll all ones on the dice, for a total of 3 healing, you would only heal 3 additional hit points from this feat, even if you have enough levels to add more.
benefits: whenever you use a veil that heals hit point damage to heal a target other than yourself, your veil heals the target an additional amount of hit points equal to half your veilweaver level (minimum 1). this is considered to be part of the effect itself, and only occurs once per effect, if the healing happens over time (such as fast healing). if the veil affects multiple creatures including yourself, all creatures except you gain the additional healing. if using a healing effect that damages undead, this effect applies to the damage applied to the undead. if you have at least three veils with the healing descriptor shaped, you instead use your full veilweaver level when determining the additional hit points you heal.

name: Veilwielder's Dissolution
description: You have learned to further refine your suppressed form, leaving your base veil in its physical form and retaining your use over it.
prerequisites: suppressive dissolution or incarnate form racial trait
benefits: while in your gaseous form granted by suppressive dissolution or by your incarnate form trait, you can choose to grant your base veil physical form as free action on your turn or when you activate your gaseous form, unsuppressing it. when given physical form you may use your base veil exactly as you could in your physical form, ignoring the normal penalties imposed by your gaseous form. you can choose to suppress your base veil through normal methods, or as part of reinvesting your essence while in your gaseous form. you may only unsuppress your base veil using this feat if it was willingly suppressed by you, not if it was suppressed through other methods (such as being dispelled or shattered).

name: Versatile Detonation
description: You have an unusual facility for manipulating your planar detonation. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you may bind essence into this feat to expand the capabilities of your planar detonation. if you have at least 1 point of essence bound to this feat, you may choose to deal either bludgeoning or slashing damage with your planar detonation instead of piercing, chosen each time you activate your planar detonation. for each additional point of essence bound to this feat, treat your class level as 1 higher than it actually is when determining the damage dealt by your planar detonation and the effects of any level-based convergence abilities which alter your planar detonation (such as the number of lines created by the elysium tier 2 convergence).

name: Viceroy
description: You were neither born to rule nor did you take that right by force, and yet rulership in the name of another has been granted to you. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, choose a new Voice veil that you can shape using this feat.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 3rd, wis 13 or veilweaving ability score 13.
benefits: when this feat is selected, choose a single voice veil. you can shape that veil using the normal veilweaving rules, allowing it to be shaped in the voice slot using one of your normal daily veils, and allowing you to invest essence in it as if it were a normal veil. if you do not have levels in a veilweaving class, you have total veils shaped of 1 and use your wisdom to determine the dcs and effects of your veil abilities. if you gain any levels in a veilweaving class, your primary veilweaving attribute is determined by that class. once chosen, the veil granted by this feat can never be changed. your veilweaver level for this veil is equal to your character level. you cannot bind this veil to the voice chakra unless you gain the ability to do so from another source.

name: View Energy
description: You can imbue your eyes with chakra, allowing you to see the life energy that flows through living things. If you have the ability to bind a veil to your Headband slot, the chakra-sight granted by this feat is capable of detecting both living and nonliving creatures. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, wis 13, perception 5 ranks.
benefits: once per day, you can invest essence into this feat. while essence is invested in this feat you can spend a move action to activate a special mode of sensory perception, chakra-sight, which allows you to accurately detect and pinpoint living creatures, regardless of invisibility or lighting conditions. this chakra-sight has a range equal to 5 feet per point of invested essence. the chakra-sight lasts until the start of your next turn.

name: Wall of Brass
description: Brass is believed to have properties that ward the flesh from harm. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: 3rd level fisherking, containment field class feature, treble walls.
benefits: you imbue your aura with the mystical protective properties of brass. if you have your moats and walls aura active, allies within the radius of your aura that are excluded from its harmful effects, gain dr 1/-. this dr increases by +1 for each point of essence invested in walls and moats. if you have containment field active, you instead invert these properties, which reduces one form of damage reduction possessed by creatures under the effects of this aura by 1 +1 for every point of essence invested in containment field. the type of damage reduction affected is chosen for each creature individually. if a creature has multiple forms of damage reduction, and they are unknown to you, the form of damage reduction affected is chosen at random.

name: Wall of Orichalcum
description: Orichalcum is known to alter the flow of essence. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: 9th level fisherking, containment field class feature, treble walls.
benefits: you imbue your aura with the essence manipulating properties of orichalcum. you can bind essence into this feat. for each point of essence bound into this feat each of your allies other than yourself, within the radius of your containment field, or moats and walls, aura gains 1 point of temporary essence; enemies within your aura immediately take one point of essence burn for each point bound essence. temporary essence gained in this way is never burned, can not be bound, and vanishes once the creature possessing it leaves your aura. essence burn caused by this feats effects is immediately recovered upon leaving the area of your containment field, or moats and walls, aura.

name: Wall of Tin
description: It is often forgotten that tin enhances one's power to divine the future. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: 3rd level fisherking, containment field class feature, treble walls.
benefits: you imbue your aura with the divinatory properties of tin. when you shape your veils for the day, roll a number of d20s equal to your veilweaving modifier and record the results as a pool to use later. if you have either containment field or moats and walls active, as an immediate action when an ally within the radius of your aura fails a skill check, attack roll, or saving throw you can replace their d20 roll with one of the recorded rolls, removing that roll from your pool. alternatively, as an immediate action when an enemy within the radius of either of these auras succeeds on a skill check, attack roll, or saving throw you can replace their d20 roll with one of the recorded rolls, which removes that roll from your pool. an unwilling target can make a will saving throw against your aura's dc. if they succeed, the roll is resolved as normal, and the roll you tried to substitute is still removed from your pool. any rolls still remaining in your pool the next time you shape your veils for the day are lost.

name: Warrior of Asgard
description: The triumphs and tragedies of Valhalla beat fiercely in your mighty heart. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: in addition, if you have ten asgardian saga veils shaped, any time you defeat a creature whose hit dice are greater than or equal to your own you gain an aura that grants all allies within 30 feet regeneration 5 for three rounds. additional kills within that time reset the duration of the aura and allies who move outside of the aura lose its at the start of their next turn.

name: Weapons of the Swarm
description: You have learned to wield weapons using the vermin that make up your swarm as well as using your own limbs. Additionally, you can utilize your special swarm attack as if it were a primary natural attack. Unlike your normal special swarm attack, you only affect a single creature with this attack and must make a successful attack roll to deal damage to your target
benefits: you can wield shields and make attacks using wielded weapons, or using your natural attacks or unarmed strikes while in your swarm form. you are considered to have the same number of limbs as your combined form when making weapon attacks and when wielding shields. if you are holding multiple weapons and shields within your swarm, you can choose which you are considered to be wielding at any time. if you attack with a two-handed weapon or with a weapon using each of your hands, you cannot from a wielded shield until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Weavers Reflexes
description: You can use akasha to boost your ability to avoid harm by giving yourself enhanced reaction speed. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus on reflex saves equal to the invested essence.

name: Well of Corruption
description: Additionally, by focusing your soul and mind as a standard action that provokes an attack of opportunity you may burn 1 point of temporary corrupted essence without suffering the normal damage for doing so.
benefits: you can meditate in an area of dim light or darkness to gain a pool of temporary corrupted essence points up to a maximum of 1/2 your character level (rounded down). you must meditate for 1 minute for each point of temporary corrupted essence you gain in this way. these points of temporary corrupted essence persist until burned, and are lost if the corruption is removed from them.

name: Wildclaw Chakra
description: You can channel akasha to enhance your combat prowess while wild shaped. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: con 13 or veilweaver level 1, wild shape class feature.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. while wild shaped, you gain an insight bonus on attack rolls made with natural weapons equal to the invested essence.

name: Willful Suppression
description: You can willfully suppress your form, allowing you to more easily blend in with your surroundings. Special If you have the ability to shape veils, they become transparent while your base veil is suppressed if they are invested with no points of essence. A shaped veil with one or more essence invested is immediately obvious and negates the bonuses to Stealth checks granted by this feat.
benefits: you can willingly suppress your base veil as a move action, and restore it as a free action on your turn. while your base veil is suppressed you are staggered, but your body becomes nearly transparent, granting you a +20 bonus to stealth checks, or a +10 bonus if you are moving. this bonus does not stack with the invisibility spell, or similar effects. if you are carrying or wearing mundane manufactured items they remain visible, potentially affecting your bonus to stealth checks at your gms discretion. magic items you are wearing or wielding suppress their visibility alongside you. wearing nonmagical armor or clothing completely negates the bonus to stealth checks granted by this feat.

name: Will of the Daeva
description: You can use akasha to boost your willpower, giving you newfound strength of purpose. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you can invest essence into this feat. you gain an insight bonus on will saves equal to the invested essence.

name: Willful Throw
description: It is the strength of your desire, not the finesse of your hand, that determines your weapons destination. You gain 1 point of essence.
benefits: you may invest essence in this feat. when you have at least 1 point of essence invested in this feat, you may use your charisma modifier in place of your dexterity modifier for your attack rolls when attacking with thrown weapons, and gain a bonus to damage rolls with these attacks equal to the total essence invested in this feat. in addition, for each point of essence invested your thrown weapon attacks ignore 1 point of ac your target has due to cover, and reduce the penalty for attacking a prone target by 1.

name: Chakra Focus
description: You have further focused the power of one of your chakras, allowing any veil shaped within it to be further empowered.
prerequisites: ability to bind veils to a chakra slot, veilweaving modifier +3.
benefits: special this feat can be selected multiple times, once for each chakra slot you can bind veils to. a single veil can from this feat multiple times, assuming it can be shaped to multiple chakras which are being enhanced using this feat.

name: Elemental Akashic Focus
description: You have learned to further focus and hone the power of your elementally attuned veils.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least one veil with the acid, air, cold, earth, electricity, fire, sonic, or water descriptors, veilweaving modifier +3
benefits: special you can gain this feat multiple times, choosing a different descriptor each time it is gained. this feat cannot a single veil more than once.

name: Greater Elemental Focus
description: Special You can gain this feat multiple times, once for each instance of Elemental Akashic Focus you have gained.
benefits: the bonus to saving throws granted by elemental akashic focus to veils of the chosen element increases by an additional +1. if you have gained elemental akashic focus multiple times, you choose one instance of that feat you wish to increase upon selecting this feat.

name: Focused Veil
description: You have learned to further focus your akashic powers into a single veil, hardening its essence and empowering its effects. Special This feat can be selected multiple times. You cannot apply its effects to a single veil more than once.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 veil, veilweaving modifier +3.
benefits: when you shape your veils for the day, choose a single veil you have shaped. double that veils hardness, and the saving throw dc of any of its effects are increased by +2. this does not stack with similar feats, such as ability focus, chakra focus or set focus.

name: Set Focus
description: You have attuned your essence to a specific subset of veils, empowering their abilities. Special This feat can be selected multiple times, choosing a new veil set each time it is selected. If a veil you shape belongs to multiple sets you have selected using this veil, it only gains a +1 bonus to its DC, but the hardness increases stack.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 veil, veilweaving modifier +3.
benefits: when you select this feat, choose a single veil set (such as the angelic armaments set, or the gravelords regalia set). the saving throw dc of all veils you shape from that set are increased by +1. when you shape a veil from your chosen set, it gains a +3 bonus to its hardness for each other veil shaped from the set. for example if you have three veils shaped from the gravelords regalia set, each would have their hardness increased by 6. this feat does not stack with similar feats, such as ability focus, chakra focus, or focused veil.

name: Greater Set Focus
description: Special You can gain this feat multiple times, once for each instance of Set Focus you have gained.
benefits: the bonuses to saving throws granted to the veil set you chose with set focus increases by an additional +1. if you have gained set focus multiple times, you choose one instance of that feat you wish to increase upon selecting this feat.

name: Aberrant Form
description: The daeva within you is a bit different from its kin.
benefits: select one veil granted by your passion, and one veil from the daevic veilweaving list. you permanently remove the selected passion veil from your list of passion veils and replace it with the selected veil from the daevic veilweaving list.

name: Access Higher Chakra Slot
description: You gain the ability to bind veils to a Higher Chakra, increasing their power and versatility. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new slot.
benefits: in addition, you gain a minor from this new bind, depending on the slot chosen

name: Access Low Chakra Slot
description: You gain the ability to bind veils to a Low Chakra, increasing their power and versatility. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new slot.
benefits: in addition, you gain a minor from this new bind, depending on the slot chosen

name: Access Middle Chakra Slot
description: You open up one of your bodys centers of power, allowing you to bind a veil or a magic item to that chakra. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new middle chakra.
benefits: in addition, you gain a minor from this new bind, depending on the slot chosen

name: Additional Hypercharge
description: You have learned to push your bonded vessel in a new way.
benefits: you may select an additional hypercharge from the list of helmsman hypercharges, adding it to your list of hypercharges known.

name: Aspected Energy
description: Your energy and essence resonate, twisting together.
prerequisites: ability to select an active element or active energy type, ability to shape at least 1 veil with an elemental descriptor
benefits: while maintaining an active element or active energy type, you may burn a point of essence to change the descriptor of one of your veils to that element or energy type for 1 round. if the veil grants elemental resistance or deals elemental damage, its resistance or damage changes to match the descriptor.

name: Auroral Armaments
description: Sometimes destruction requires more than just stellar power.
prerequisites: zodiac with the aurora orbit, bab +4
benefits: while you are wielding the weapon form of a constellation you may take a swift action to add your aurora torch damage to a single attack with that constellation.

name: Binding of the Bands
description: Your mastery over your ancestors veil has further improved.
prerequisites: character level 11th, racial trait that allows you to shape a veil belonging to the gifts of the bearer collection
benefits: you treat the veil granted by your racial trait belonging to the gifts of the bearer as if it were bound to its chakra.

name: Crawling in My Skin
description: All things are connected, even when they seem separate.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 11th, improved skin shift class feature
benefits: you gain the ability to use your skin shift as swarm skin. this special skin shift has an essence investment requirement of 3. when taking swarm forms, you treat your veilweaver level as your caster level when determining the effects of the spell.

name: Crystek Attunement
description: You gain the ability to wield a single crystek device. Crystek Devices Made by the soul-locked humans of the Brionithic Empire with input from both Zeian and Steamwalker allies, these devices allow extremely limited access to veil abilities for characters without otherwise any capacity to use them. The wielder must be implanted with modified crystals of life and universal essence to become compatible with most crystek devices. Each crystek device is attuned to a single veil from any veilshaping class list when created. They increase the base item cost 50 gp plus 100 gp per effective veilweaving level beyond 1st. An additional 1000 gp cost is added for each potential essence slot beyond the first. A character must have the Crystek Attunment feat and cannot attune a crystek device with a higher effective veilweaver level than they have hit dice. Attuning crystek is a move action. Essence crystals are depleted after one day of powering a crystek device. Once attuned the user gains access to the base ability of the veil emulated by the device augmented by any currently slotted essence crystals.
benefits: you may use crystek devices to emulate the power of akashic veils (see sidebar). you must provide crystallized essence to empower the device. you may re-attune a different crystek device as a move action.

name: Dual Enhanced Veils
description: You have learned how to change the properties of your weapon each time you shape them.
prerequisites: at least 2 veils known with the enhanced descriptor.
benefits: when shaping at least 1 veil with the enhanced descriptor for the day, you may choose a second veil with the enhanced descriptor that you know that you did not shape and store it in this feat. by burning a point of essence as a move action, you may swap an enhanced veil that you have shaped with the veil stored in this feat. this unshapes the veil and stores it in this feat, and shapes the veil that was stored in this feat. essence invested in these veils becomes uninvested. if you are capable of binding the newly shaped veil, you may bind them as long as you have the capability of doing so.

name: Dual Hemisphere
description: A turn of the globe brings new insight.
prerequisites: ability to manifest a constellations champion form
benefits: you may manifest the same constellation twice. when doing so, it must be manifested in two separate forms. you may manifest a constellation in its champion form along with one of its item forms (armor, equipment, or weapon) and reduce the total essence burn of the two manifestations by 2, but if you do so, that item is considered an intrinsic part of the champion and cannot be wielded or worn by another creature until both the champion and the item are dismissed and remanifested. a champion is always proficient with its own constellations item forms.

name: Element Dancer
description: You have an unusually deep connection to the powers of creation.
benefits: you may now change your elemental affinity up to three times per day as a full-round action. you no longer need to bind a point of essence to change your elemental affinity. you may use this ability one additional time per day for every 5 levels you possess.

name: Elemental Spellweaving
description: Special This feat can also be selected by a psiweaver or a sphereweaver, allowing them to change the damage types of their manifested power and cast sphere powers. They must be able to manifest a power or have a sphere ability that deals elemental damage to select this feat.
prerequisites: spellweaver 1, ability to shape at least one veil with an elemental descriptor (see below), ability to cast at least one spell that deals elemental damage.
benefits: when you shatter a veil with an elemental descriptor (acid, cold, electricity, or fire) and cast a spell that deals damage of one of those types, you can change the damage of the spell to match the type of one of the shattered veils elemental descriptors. this counts as a matching descriptor for the purposes of the metaweaving ability.

name: Essence Rejection
description: A strange defect or racial quirk has left you utterly devoid of even the vaguest hints of akashic energy, and your chakra energy is unusually resistant to akashic effects.
benefits: special you lose the of this feat if you gain any essence.

name: Essence Void
description: You are an abyss of magic, swallowing up all power.
benefits: the veilweaver of any veil that targets you, includes you in its area of effect, or is used to attack you must make a veilweaver level check (dc 15 + your hit dice) or have that veil be suppressed for 1d4 rounds. any purely akashic damage, such as from the loyal paladins spear of light veil or a batals sword of the sun king class feature, deals half damage to you.

name: Extra Akashic Upgrade
description: You have developed an additional way to upgrade your akashic construct. Benfits Choose one akashic upgrade for which your akashic construct qualifies; it immediately gains this upgrade. Special This feat may be taken up to three times.
prerequisites: ability to shape an akashic construct

name: Extra Mech Enhancement
description: You have developed an additional enhancement for your mech. Prequisites Bonded Mech class feature or Mech Piloting Special This feat may be taken up to three times.
benefits: choose one mech enhancement for which your mech qualifies; it immediately gains the of this enhancement. whenever you change your mech body type, build a new mech, or repurpose an existing mech as your bonded mech, you may change this mech enhancement to another which you qualify for.

name: Extra Recorded Talent
description: Special This talent can be selected an additional time at vizier level 3, and every 2 levels thereafter.
benefits: you gain an additional recorded talent.

name: Extra Skin Form Slot
description: Your shapeshifting is more versatile. Special This feat may be taken multiple times.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 5th, skin shift class feature
benefits: you gain an additional skin form slot.

name: Extra Storm Power
description: You have unlocked the latent powers from the storm dwelling inside you. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Each time you take this feat, you gain an additional storm power
prerequisites: benefit you gain one additional storm power. you must meet all of the for this storm power, as normal.

name: Fluid Theory
description: You have learned how to change the properties of your weapon each time you shape them. Special If you possess the Unified Theory feat, you may change the Enhanced veil separately from one another, allowing them to possess different enhancement bonuses and weapon special properties.
benefits: when you shape a veil with the enhanced descriptor with at least a +2 weapon bonus, you may change the configuration of enhancement bonuses and weapon special properties of that veil. for example, if you shape a veil with the enhanced descriptor that is a +1 flaming, you may change the enhancement bonuses for that veil to a +1 frost, a +2, a +1 keen, and so forth.

name: Improved Veil of Nature
description: Your connection to the essence of the natural world deepens.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 7th, veil of nature class feature
benefits: choose one veil from any list. this cannot be a title, a veil that creates a manufactured weapon, or a veil that can only be shaped in a class-specific slot (such as ring or storm). that veil is added to your list of choices for your veil of nature class feature. each time you gain a new level, you may change the veil this feat grants.

name: Innate Binding
description: Your control over your body's innate veil grows in strength, allowing you greater command over its abilities. Special Your must have a sufficiently high character level to select this feat based on the chakra slot of your innate veil, as per the following
prerequisites: avead, innate veil racial trait, sufficiently high character level
benefits: you gain the ability to treat your innate veil as bound to its chakra slot.

name: Martial Astrologist
description: The constellations heed your command, forming a weapon you are more comfortable with.
prerequisites: ability to initiate maneuvers, ability to manifest a weapon constellation with an associated discipline.
benefits: you may manifest your weapon constellations as any weapon from the associated weapon group of their associated discipline. you may not manifest a constellation as a natural weapon. if you manifest it as an unarmed strike, it appears as a set of masterwork handwraps that grant the wielder improved unarmed strike.

name: Mass Branding
description: Special This feat can be selected an additional time at veilweaving level 13 and 19, allowing you to apply an additional brand with each use of this ability.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least two veils with the [brand] descriptor, veilweaving level 7
benefits: you can apply two of your brands to two separate creatures in range as a full round action.

name: Painful Severance
prerequisites: ability to shape at least one veil with the [brand] descriptor, veilweaving level 5
benefits: whenever a creature sunders one of your brands, the branded creature takes 1 point of damage for each of your veilweaving levels. this damage is from an akashic pulse of power, and ignores damage reduction and resistances.

name: Reaching Brands
prerequisites: ability to shape at least one veil with the [brand] descriptor, veilweaving level 5
