benefits: your brands stay effective on branded creatures out to medium range (100 feet + 10 feet per veilweaver level). this does not increase the range at which you can apply brands.

name: Sculpting Strike
description: You can deliver your sculpting touch alongside your strikes, rather than only as a touch. Special This ability counts as a talent with the [strike] descriptor for the purposes of feats and abilities such as Spell Attack. This ability is considered to have a caster level of 0 for caster-level based effects.
prerequisites: fleshsculpter obsession, sculpting touch class feature
benefits: as a standard action, you may make a single weapon attack at your full base attack bonus. if that attack hits, the target also suffers the effects of your sculpting touch. when using your sculpting touch in this way you do not add your intelligence modifier to its damage rolls. if your attack is a critical hit, the damage of your sculpting touch is not multiplied. a creature affected by this ability receives a saving throw against your sculpting touch, as normal. this ability cannot be combined with the conductive property or similar abilities.

name: Shape Akashic Construct
description: Your akasha flows around you to form a hardened shell enclosing your limbs and body, protecting you from harm and enhancing your physical prowess. Special You may take this feat a second time, allowing you to use your full veilweaver level when determining the abilities of your akashic construct.
prerequisites: veilweaving level 5, ability to shape 2 or more veils.
benefits: you gain the ability to shape a special form of veil known as an akashic construct. you treat your veilweaver level as 4 levels lower (minimum 1) when determining the abilities of your akashic construct. shaping this special veil takes up one of your shaped veils for the day and a chakra slot, as normal for a veil.

name: Shape Storm
description: You gain the limited ability to channel an aspect of the Elderstorm. If you do not have levels in a veilweaving class, you gain the ability to shape one veil each day using your character level as your veilweaving level and your Wisdom as your veilweaving modifier. The saving throw DC of this veil is equal to 10 + number of points of essence invested in the veil + your veilweaving modifier. If you later gain levels in a veilweaving class, you lose the ability to shape a veil using this feat. This does not stack with the ability to shape veils granted by the Shape Veil feat or similar abilities. Special You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, choose an additional Storm veil to add to your veil list.
benefits: when this feat is selected, choose a single storm veil. you add the chosen veil to your veil list. if you do not have the ability to shape veils to your storm chakra, you gain the ability to do so. you cannot bind veils to the storm chakra unless you gain the ability to do so from another source.

name: Shaping Focus
description: Your powers of shapeshifting outstrip your dabbling in the druidic faith.
prerequisites: wild shape class feature, knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.
benefits: your wild shape ability is calculated as though your druid level were four higher, to a maximum level equal to your character level.

name: Shared Veil
description: You can share a veil with an ally with which you have a special bond.
prerequisites: ability to shape veils and an animal companion, eidolon, familiar, mount, or creature whose services are granted as part of a known veil.
benefits: when shaping your veils, any one veil shaped by you can also affect your familiar, animal companion, mount, or any creature currently created or controlled by one of your shaped veils. you may change which veil is shared in this way, or which companion it is shared with, as a standard action. the creature in question must remain within 15 feet of you to receive the and must have the appropriate limb or body part (a horse cannot from a veil that occupies the hands slot,for example). if the creature leaves this radius of effect, it loses the of the veil until such time as it returns within 15 feet. if the veil has an activated ability (like gorget of the wyrms breath weapon attack) the companion instinctively knows how to use it and can be commanded to do so with a handle animal check as though it were a trained trick. familiars do not require a check, and can be commanded to utilize their veil as a free action (though they must still spend the appropriate action to activate it). your companion also shares the of any essence you have invested in the veil.

name: Skilled Soul
description: The souls you forge are particularly skilled. Special This feat does not stack with the Skill Focus feat. If you have the ability to forge two souls you may select this feat a second time, choosing a skill from the second soul to gain a bonus to.
benefits: when you forge your souls for the day, choose a single one of your souls associated skills. you gain a +3 bonus to that skill. if you have 10 ranks in that skill, this bonus increases to +6.

name: Soulveil Focus
description: You have focused the veils of your soul until their forms have been honed to devastating potential. Special If you have the ability to forge two souls you may select this feat a second time, choosing the second soul with that feat. If you shape a veil associated with both of your souls, the effects of this feat stack.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 veil associated with a forged soul, veilweaving modifier +3.
benefits: when you forge your souls for the day, choose a single one of your forged souls. the veils you shape associated with that forged soul have their saving throw dcs increased by +1, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls using the abilities of those veils. this feat does not stack with similar feats, such as ability focus, chakra focus, or focused veil.

name: Spirit Familiar
prerequisites: ability to acquire a new familiar, arcane spellcaster level 7
benefits: when choosing a familiar, you can instead choose to bond with an akashic spirit. when you do so, select a single aspect of any aspectual circle your akashic spirit gains that aspect. you use your arcane spellcaster level as your effective volur ability for your akashic spirit, but you do not gain the telepathic link, share senses, or improved share senses abilities, and you treat your effective volur level when determining the passive ability of your spirit as your arcane spellcaster level -6. if your spirit familiar is slain, it returns to life at full hit points with any ability damage or drain cured the next time you rest to regain your spell slots.

name: Spirit Familiar Embodiment
benefits: you gain the ability to embody your spirit familiar, as the volurs spiritual embodiment ability. when determining the abilities granted by the embodiment, you treat your effective volur level as your arcane spellcaster level -6.

name: Sworn to Protect
description: Through a unique ritual, you may swear yourself to protect an individual with your life. You always know the state of your Charge if you are within 30 feet of them, as per the status spell. If you are further than 30 feet from your Charge, you know their relative location to you, as well as a general distance (close, medium, long, or far). If they are on another plane other than yours, you know what plane they are on. If you are adjacent to your Charge, you may, as an immediate action, redirect any single target spell or effect, or an attack made against them to yourself.
benefits: by performing a 1 hour ritual, you may bind yourself with one other individual with an oath to protect them from harm. this individual is known as your charge, and you may only have 1 charge at a time. you may change your charge to another creature, or remove any charge you may have by performing this 1 hour ritual again.

name: Tainted Essence
description: Your essence is tainted with the energy of some dark entity or shadowed bloodline, giving your veils and akashic abilities a sinister cast.
benefits: you gain a +1 profane bonus to the save dcs of veils with the evil descriptor and increase any profane bonuses normally offered by such veils by +1. if your alignment is not evil, you appear as one alignment step closer to evil for each veil with the evil descriptor you have equipped when subjected to abilities like an antipaladins detect good ability or detect alignment spells. if you have at least three veils with the evil descriptor bound, you are treated as being evil aligned for spells and abilities whose effects are determined by alignment, such as an antipaladins smite good or an unholy blight spell.

name: Tooth and Veil
description: Your veil weaponry mingles with your natural weapons.
prerequisites: veilweaver level 5th, any natural attack, ability to shape a weapon-like or [enhanced (weapon)] veil
benefits: whenever you would shape a weapon-like or [enhanced (weapon)] veil, you may channel its power into one of your natural attacks instead. the chosen natural attack gains all the the veil normally would, including being treated as a masterwork weapon, gaining any enhancement bonus or weapon special abilities the veil would normally be entitled to (though these do not stack with enhancement bonuses or weapon special abilities from an amulet of mighty fists or similar item, or from spells like magic fang; you must choose whether to receive the veils enhancements or those from another source), gaining any special abilities that would normally be available to the veil (such as the extended reach of the loyal paladins spear of light), and ing from effects that require you to wield the a weapon-like or [enhanced (weapon)] veil (such as a stormbounds fury of the storm storm power). you cannot channel more than one veil into a given natural attack, though you can have multiple veils channeled into natural attacks of the same type (for example, a catfolk could channel the efreeti's brass scimitar into one of their claws and the sword of justice into the other claw).

name: Unified Theory
description: You have learned to enhance any veil you shape instead of just a single one. Whenever you shape a veil with an Enhanced descriptor with a weapon, armor, or shield, you may apply the enhancement bonuses, special qualities, and special materials from this weapon to the weapon, armor, or shield respectively.
prerequisites: at least 1 veil known with the enhanced descriptor.
benefits: you may add enhancement bonuses, weapon, armor, and shield special qualities, as well as special materials to this feat as if it were a veil with the enhanced descriptor and produced an appropriate armor, weapon, or shield. each armor, weapon, and shield enhancements are considered separate track (for example, you can upgrade this feat as a +1 flaming weapon, a +2 adamantine shield, and as a +1 spell resistance armor).

name: Veil of Balance
description: Your dedication to neutrality gives you power over those who follow extremes.
benefits: so long as at least one of your alignment axes is neutral, you can use the effects of veils which only work on creatures of a certain alignment (such as halo of holy light only affecting evil creatures) instead on any creature whose alignment does not match your non-neutral alignment axis. for instance, if you are chaotic neutral, you can affect any non-chaotic creature. if you are true neutral, you can affect any non-true neutral creature and the dc for your veils with an alignment descriptor increases by +1.

name: Weapon Fusion
description: Your unique physiology allows you to fuse manifested constellations with your own natural weapons.
prerequisites: quadrupedal racial trait or nameer, sobek, or solhofaat.
benefits: whenever you would manifest the weapon form of a constellation, you may choose to channel the constellation directly into one of your natural attacks instead. the chosen natural attack gains all the the weapon form of the constellation normally would, including being treated as a masterwork weapon, gaining any enhancement bonus or weapon special abilities the weapon form of the constellation would normally be entitled to (though these do not stack with enhancement bonuses or weapon special abilities from an amulet of mighty fists or similar item, or from spells like magic fang; you must choose whether to receive the constellations enhancements or those from another source), gaining any special abilities that would normally be available to the weapon form of the constellation (such as the bonus bludgeoning damage and water blast attack offered by the weapon form of leviathan), and ing from effects that require you to wield the weapon form of a constellation (such as the solar zodiacs increased base attack bonus). you cannot channel more than one constellation into a given natural attack, though you can have multiple constellations channeled into natural attacks of the same type (for example, a wolger of 6th level or higher could channel the sultan of flame into one of his claws and leviathan into the other claw).

name: Fractured Entropy
description: The fractures in your power leak deathly energy. If you have at least 1 veil shattered, whenever you cast a necromancy spell you gain an aura of entropy that extends outwards 5 feet from you until the end of your next turn. Whenever an enemy first enters the aura on their turn or begins their turn in the aura, they must make a Fortitude saving throw or become sickened for a number of rounds equal to the number of veils you have shattered. The DC of this saving throw is equal to 10 + your veilweaving modifier + twice the number of veils you have shattered. If you shatter a veil as part of casting a necromancy spell, it is considered as among your shattered veils when determining the effects of this feat. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, the target becomes nauseated for 1 round in addition to being sickened on a failed Fortitude saving throw.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting necromancy spells.

name: Fractured Figment
description: The fractures in your power create delusions in others. While you have a veil shattered you gain a single illusionary image as per the mirror image spell, using your veilweaving level as your caster level for its effects. You gain one additional illusionary image for each veil you have shattered (to a maximum of 8 images). This ability does not stack with the mirror image spell, casting that spell causes any images granted by this feat to be destroyed, and they only reform 1 minute after the effects of the spell expire. Should these images be destroyed by being dispelled or by being struck with an attack, they reform 1 minute later. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, these images become hostile to those who would strike them, dealing your veilweaving modifier in damage when they are destroyed. This damage is the result of a pulse of pure akashic power and is not subject to energy resistance or damage reduction.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting illusion spells.

name: Fractured Form
description: The fractures in your power manifest in your physical form.  Fury +1 competence bonus to melee damage rolls per shattered veil.  Mobility +1 competence bonus to Acrobatics checks per shattered veil.  Toughness +1 increase to Natural Armor per veil shattered.  Vigor gain temporary hit points equal to your veilweaving modifier (minimum 1) multiplied by the number of veils you have shattered.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known
benefits: special if you possess the wildshape class feature, the change shape racial ability, or alternate form racial ability you may choose new to replace the old ones as part of the action of using those abilities. you are treated as if you had one additional veil shattered when determining the power (but not the number) of the you are granted by this feat.

name: Fractured Panacea
description: Your fractured power is a balm to those you aid. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, you instead increase this healing to twice your veilweaving modifier.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: while you have a veil shattered, add your veilweaving modifier to the amount healed by healing effects you create. if the healing occurs over time (such as by granting fast healing), this bonus healing only occurs once at the beginning of the effect. if you shattered a veil as part of activating a healing effect, that veil is counted among your shattered veils when determining the effects of this feat.

name: Fractured Spellfire
description: Your shards of power burn those who would see you harmed. If you have at least 1 veil shattered, whenever you cast an evocation spell you gain an aura of flared power that extends outwards 5 feet from you until the end of your next turn. Whenever an enemy first enters the aura on their turn or begins their turn in the aura, they take untyped damage equal to the level of the evocation spell cast multiplied by the number of veils you have shattered. If you shatter a veil as part of casting an evocation spell, it is considered as among your shattered veils when determining the effects of this feat. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, the range of this aura increases by 5 feet.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting evocation spells.

name: Fractured Summons
description: As your soul fractures, your ability to summon magical beings grows. While you have at least one veil shattered, creatures you summon gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to the number of veils you have shattered and bonus temporary hp equal to the level of the spell multiplied by the number of veils you have shattered. If you shatter a veil as part of summoning a creature, it is considered as among your shattered veils when determining the effects of this feat. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, you may reduce the casting time of conjuration (summoning) spells with a level equal to the number of veils you have shattered or lower with a casting time of 1 round to a standard action.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting conjuration (summoning) spells.

name: Fractured Visions
description: Your shards of power reflect visions of what could be. While you have at least 1 veil shattered, once per round you may gain a bonus to a single d20 roll equal to the number of veils you have shattered as an immediate action. You may use this feat to modify a roll after the results have been revealed but before their effects have been applied, potentially changing the results of the roll. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, this ability is instead usable once per round as a free action that can be used even outside of your turn.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known, alertness
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting divination spells.

name: Fractured Warding
description: Your fractured power empowers your defensive magics. While you have at least 1 veil shattered you may gain DR/- and Energy Resistance to acid, cold, electricity, and fire equal to twice the number of veils you have shattered for 1 round as an immediate acon. This may be activated after the triggering effect has been announced but before its results have been revealed. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, you gain DR/- and Energy Resistance equal to the number of veils you have shattered, and may use the immediate action effect to increase the DR and Energy Resistance to twice the number of veils you have shattered for 1 round instead.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting abjuration spells.

name: Fractured Whispers
description: The fractures in your power sway those around you. If you have at least 1 veil shattered, you can cause whispers and doubts to enter the mind of another as an immediate action, causing them to take a -2 penalty on a single attack roll, saving throw, or skill check. You must be aware this action is taking place to affect it, and you may choose to inflict this penalty after they have rolled, but before the consequences of the roll are revealed. If you have at least 3 veils shattered, this ability is instead usable once per round as a free action that can be used even outside of your turn. This penalty increases by 1 for every veil you have shattered after the first.
prerequisites: ability to shape 1 veil or 1 other shard feat known.
benefits: you gain a +1 competence bonus to your caster level when casting enchantment spells.

name: Fragmented Mageglyph
description: Your fractured soul fuels your powers, increasing their versatility, If you shattered a veil as part of using that ability, that shattered veil is included when determining the effects of this feat.
prerequisites: special you can gain this feat multiple times, affecting a different one of the feats each time it is selected.
benefits: choose one class that provides spellcasting, manifestation, or spherecasting when you gain this feat; once chosen this cannot be changed. when you have a veil shattered, you increase your effective caster/manifester level for that class by 1 for each veil you have shattered for the purpose of determining one of the following aspects of the spell, power, or talent chosen when you cast or manifest it

name: Fragmented Soulward
description: Your power not only heals, it defends. While you have at least 3 veils shattered, you may apply the effects of this feat without reducing the effects of Fractured Panacea.
benefits: when a target from your fractured panacea feat, you can choose to reduce the bonus healing granted by that feat by  (rounded down, minimum 1) to grant the target a +1 bonus to armor class and saving throws for each veil you have shattered for a number of rounds equal to your veilweaving modifier.

name: Minor Soulshard
description: Your shards of spent power amplifies the effects of your minor magics. Shattering your veils further increases these effects. For every veil you have shattered, this feat is treated as if it were invested with an additional 2 points of essence. This effective invested essence bypasses this feats essence capacity. You gain 1 point of essence. Example Ioric has this feat and invested 2 points of essence into it. When they cast acid splash they increase the damage dealt by 2. If Ioric casts guidance on themselves they gain +1d2 to the next attack roll, saving throw, or skill check they make.
prerequisites: ability to use cantrips, knacks, orisons, or psionic talents
benefits: your minor magics from the power of your soul. for each point of essence invested in this feat, any 0thlevel spell or power you cast or manifest that deals damage deals an additional point of damage. if the ability does not deal damage but grants a numerical bonus or penalty, those bonuses and penalties instead increase by 1 step on the following progression for every 2 points of essence invested in this feat 1->1d2->1d3->1d4->1d6->2d3->2d4.

name: Minor Veilshard
description: Through the broken shards of your greater gifts, your weakness becomes strength. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: ability to shape at least 1 minor veil.
benefits: for each veil you have shattered, treat your shaped minor veils as if they were invested with an additional point of essence. this additional essence may exceed your normal essence capacity.

name: Shards of Expertise
description: While your focus increases, your power grows. Shattered feats are considered to be shattered veils when determining the effects of Shard feats. Due to the strain that this feat puts on your body and mind, you can only shatter a limited number of feats at a time. You can have a single feat shattered at a time at 3rd level, gaining the ability to shatter another feat every 5 levels thereafter. You gain 1 point of essence.
prerequisites: at least 1 other akashic feat that can be invested with essence, character level 3rd
benefits: you may now shatter akashic feats that can be invested with essence in place of veils to power shard feats. feats must have at least one point of essence invested in them to be shattered and while shattered the essence invested in these feats is burned, and the feat cannot be invested with essence. you cannot shatter feats that have essence bound to them. the feats remain shattered for 10 minutes, though you may choose to have the feats remain shattered after this time period (as per a shattered veil).

name: Abacinite Miner
description: Your exposure to high temperatures over a prolonged period of time in your youth has made you resistant to it.
benefits: you gain steam resistance equal to 5 plus your character level.

name: Accelerated Healing
description: You have honed your powers of regeneration to almost supernatural levels.
benefits: you regain 1 hit point each hour. in addition, a trueform with this ability can regrow severed or destroyed limbs, tentacles, tendrils, tails (etc.) in 3d4 days (instead of 3d4 weeks).

name: Additional Assault
description: You can channel an elemental attack an additional time per day of a different energy type.
benefits: you gain an additional mystical assault per day. its energy type will be of other element that you did not chose at 1st level, but that was an option at that time.

name: Adept Chelipeds
description: You can use your chelipeds as an extra hand.
benefits: by using both of your chelipeds together, you can emulate one extra arm. you can wield an addition weapon with this virtual arm, but only one hand is its primary hand, and all others are off hands. you can also use this hand for other purposes that require a free hand.

name: Adjusting Transformation
description: Your equipment adjusts to fit while you transform. Normal Equipment normally falls off while you transform.
benefits: any equipment that is possible for you to wear in both elf and seal form, automatically adjusts to fit you while you transform to either form.

name: Advanced Arm Use
description: You can use one of your many arms to perform minor tasks in addition to your tool use ability. Normal Even with multiple arms, the hand- equivalent tool use ability only confers the effective use of two humanoid hands, meaning it takes several arms to mimic that usefulness, while others are used for stability and locomotion.
benefits: while you cannot wield extra weapons with a single arm (note that an ikasaru uses his tentacles for weapon wielding and not arms), this well-trained arm can retrieve small, stowed objects carried on your person as a swift action, even if both of your hands are in use with your hand- equivalent tool use ability.

name: Alchemical Craftsman
description: Your craftsman racial trait extends to alchemy.
benefits: you may apply your +2 racial bonus to your craft (alchemy) check, and you add +2 to the dc of any ingested poison you create.

name: Ambassador To The Deep
description: You have permanently acclimated to deeper depths. Special This feat can be taken multiple times, until depth tolerance is equal to 1000 feet.
prerequisites: a depth tolerance of less than 1000 feet.
benefits: your racial depth tolerance increases by 100 feet.

name: Ambassador To The Shallows
description: You have permanently acclimated to shallower depths. Special This feat can be taken up to 3 times until pressure sensitivity is zero.
benefits: the nommo's pressure sensitivity decreases by 100 feet.

name: Ancient Grudge
description: Ancient combat techniques have been passed on to fight an ancient foe.
benefits: you receive a +2 bonus on attack rolls against sharks (including carchardians) if you are a delphin or penguins (including squawks) if you are a hydrurgan, because of special training against these traditional foes.

name: Apsar Senses
description: You can feel hostile intent in your bones, a tribute to your apsar heritage.
benefits: you can use detect hostile intent once per day as a psi-like ability (manifester level equals the your class level).

name: Arcane Armor Affinity
description: Youve never cast a spell outside of your diving armor and it shows.
prerequisites: pragian, ability to cast 1st level spells.
benefits: reduce the arcane spell failure chance due to the diving armor you are wearing by 15% for any spells you cast. this feat stacks with arcane armor training and arcane armor mastery.

name: Arcane Connection
description: You can channel a bit of your will into your tupilaq, granting it a small sliver of your magical aptitude.
benefits: you may cast any spell with a target of self on your tupilaq. additionally, any spell with a range of touch may now be delivered by your tupilaq. the tupilaq may deliver this spell as part of its natural attacks.

name: Archaic Savagery
description: Your critical hits with improvised weapons are much more damaging. Normal Your critical threat range for improvised weapons is 19-20 2.
benefits: when attacking with an improvised weapon, your critical threat range is 19-20 3. if you have the stick and spear feat, for weapons affected by that feat with a lesser threat range than 19-20, the critical hit threat range increases to 19-20.

name: Artistic Celerity
description: You can perform your art with mystifying speed.
prerequisites: woggle, racial bonus to a craft skill.
benefits: when you craft an item using the craft skill with a racial bonus, you may do so in half the time with no penalties.

name: Aweless
description: You have overcome the effects of magical fear.
benefits: if a spell or spell-like effect causes you to be panicked or frightened, you are instead shaken, which also triggers your unshakable racial ability (you may re-roll the failed save). you cannot be shaken otherwise by a spell or spell-like effect.

name: Bargain
description: You have an instinctual knack for dealing with money.
benefits: you may add your wisdom modifier as a competency bonus to appraise and diplomacy skill checks. this stacks with your greed racial trait.

name: Better Biter
description: Youve gotten good at timing exactly when to throw your protrusible jaws forward.
benefits: if you miss by 5 or less with your bite attack, you get another bite attack as a free action, once per round.

name: Better Jetter
description: Youve honed your racial ability to jet.
benefits: your jet speed increases to 120 and you can make one turn of up to 90 degrees at any point during that movement.

name: Bioelectricity
description: You can channel your bioelectrical current into a powerful jolt.
benefits: as a supernatural ability, you may launch an electrical attack against a single opponent as a touch attack, or in conjunction with a natural or unarmed attack. on a successful hit, the character inflicts 1d6 electricity damage (in addition to melee damage, if applicable). this attack may be launched once per day per level, and may be used only once per round.

name: Blip
description: You can disappear and reappear somewhere else.
benefits: you can use a limited version of dimension door once per day as a spell-like ability (caster level equal to your class level). you are limited to use this only on yourself, the range is only 10 feet per character level, and if you arrive in a place that is already occupied by a solid body, you take 1d6 points of damage and the spell simply fails (you are not redirected as per the spell).

name: Blood in the Water (feat)
description: The taste of blood bolsters your bite attack on the following round.
benefits: when you score a hit with your natural bite attack, you gain a +2 racial bonus to your attack roll for your bite attack during the next round.

name: Blood Vengeance
description: Seeing an ally fall in combat fills you with a raging and murderous fury. As with a barbarians rage, when this weaker rage ends, you are fatigued; if another ally falls before this duration ends, the weaker rage lasts for an additional 4 rounds. This feat does not allow you to enter a rage if you are fatigued. You may only use this feat if the fallen ally had at least as many Hit Dice as you (excluding conjured or summoned allies).
benefits: whenever one of your allies is reduced to negative hit points or killed, you may enter a state similar to but less powerful than a barbarians rage as a free action on your next turn. if you have the rage class feature and are already raging, your morale bonuses to strength and constitution increase by +2 for the duration of your rage. if you do not have the rage class feature, or you have no more rage rounds left, this weaker rage gives you all the and penalties of a barbarians rage, except your morale bonus to strength and constitution is only +2. in either case, this state lasts for 4 rounds.

name: Bloodied Beak
description: You can make attacks using your beak.
benefits: you gain a natural bite attack that deals 1d3 points of damage.

name: Blow Over
description: When your anger blows over, you're no longer scary. Intimidation is always a class skill for you.
prerequisites: natural comedian and quackitude racial characteristic
benefits: when you use intimidate to influence an opponent's attitude, you can limit the duration to 1d6 + 4 minutes. if you do, the target's reaction to you does not change to unfriendly after the duration expires.

name: Boiling Gore
description: Your crystal gore attack can cause additional steam damage.
benefits: once per day, after you successfully deal damage with your gore attack, you may immediately cause an additional 1d8 points of steam to this same opponent as a swift action.

name: Boiling Power
description: Your powers with the [steam] descriptor create steam that continues to cling and burn the target. In addition, the hazy steam interferes with the vision of those affected. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. The effects of Boiling Power do not stack, but the most recent attack does replace the effect and duration of the feats previous applications.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. the steam of your steam power continues to boil the water around the target, partially blinding it and causing additional damage to it for a short time. that creature takes damage equal to the powers level at the start of its next turn and is dazzled. on the next turn, if one half of the base damage dealt from the boiling power feat during the previous round is equal to or greater than 1, that creature takes that much damage and remains dazzled during this round. this continues until one half of the base damage is less than 1 point. for example, if energy ball (level 4 kineticist) is successfully used to cause steam damage to an opponent and augmented by this feat, that opponent would take 4 steam damage and become dazzled at the start of the next round, 2 steam damage and remain dazzled on the round after, and finally 1 point of steam damage and continued vision impairment on the 3rd round after the initial attack. afterwards, the effect dissipates without further damage or vision issues. this feat can only be used with powers that have the steam (formerly fire) descriptor and deal damage. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 3.

name: Bolstering Boost
description: You spend fewer power points to boost your mutations.
benefits: spend one less power point (minimum 1 point) per boost to boost your mutations.

name: Brainiac
description: You inherited a knack for engineering from your father.
benefits: you gain a +2 racial bonus on craft (mechanical) checks, and are considered a hitogoi in regards to maintaining and crafting hitogoi inventions. in addition, you treat any weapon with the word hitogoi in its name as a martial weapon.

name: Break the Ice
description: Your humor can make friends.
benefits: you can change the initial attitudes (see diplomacy) of non-player characters as a full-round action. targets must make a will save (dc 10 + 1/2 your perform (comedy) skill check modifier) or their attitude improves by one step. this is a charm, enchantment, and language-dependent effect. you cannot make a creature helpful this way, the best possible attitude you can achieve is friendly. you cannot use perform (comedy) to influence a given creatures attitude more than once in a 24 hour period.

name: Breathlink
description: You can share your ability to breathe water with other creatures that do not have gills. Special You may take this feat more than once. Each time you may add one more person to your breathlink at a time.
benefits: you may share your ability to breathe underwater with any adjacent creature as a free action. there is no limit on the duration, though the effect must be reactivated each round. if the subject is ever not adjacent to you, the effect ends. this effect does not interfere with the subjects ability to breathe air.

name: Bribe Fate
description: You may pay money to avoid failing a saving throw.
benefits: once per day, when you fail a saving throw, you may lose half your level in hit points (minimum 1 point) to reroll that saving throw. this feat is used as an immediate action after the first save is attempted, but before the results are revealed by the gm. you must take the second result, even if it is worse. the hit point loss bypasses damage reduction.

name: Brute Strength
description: With a ferocious burst of brute strength you can bust through tough objects.
benefits: you gain a +4 competence bonus to strength checks made to break or burst items and objects with a sudden force (refer to chapter 7 of the pathfinder roleplaying game for more information on breaking or bursting items).

name: Brutish Defense
description: Wearing the skin of beasts brings you good health and luck.
benefits: you gain a +1 resistance bonus to your reflex and fortitude saves, as long as you are not sickened by your technology allergy.

name: Buoyancy Control
description: Your natural buoyancy control gets better. Special You can take this feat multiple times until you obtain a type C air bladder.
benefits: if you have no air bladder, you gain a type a air bladder. if you have a type a air bladder, you gain a type b air bladder. finally, if you have a type b air bladder, you gain a type c air bladder.

name: Caustic Flesh
description: You have developed poisonous skin that burns those that bite you. Creatures immune to poison are not affected.
benefits: a creature that makes a successful bite attack against you takes 1d4 acid damage.

name: Chameleon Camouflage
description: You know how to blend in with the sea floor.
benefits: you have the ability to match your coloration to the sea floor and sit perfectly still. this grants you a +4 racial bonus on stealth checks when hiding on the sea floor, but only while the majority of your skin is visible (no armor or clothing), and only when you are not moving.

name: Chaotic Surge
description: Chaotic energy explodes from your weapon when you score a critical hit.
benefits: if you confirm a critical hit, you may add an additional 1d6 damage of a random energy type by rolling a d10 and applying the following energy type 1-2 acid, 3-4 cold, 5-6 steam, 7-8 electricity, 9-10 sonic.

name: Child of the Sea
description: You share a strong mystic connection with the sea.
benefits: while you are in the ocean, your natural healing rate (the amount of hit points and ability damage you heal from a full nights rest) doubles.

name: Choose Mutation
description: You may choose which form you receive from the Daily Form racial trait.
benefits: every other day, instead of rolling for your daily form trait, you may choose one out of the list.

name: Chromatophore Prowess
description: You can change your color to best match your surroundings.
benefits: as a full-round action, you can adjust your color to match your current terrain, granting a +4 racial bonus on stealth checks while within that terrain type. this camouflage remains until you actively dismiss it (free action), or until you go unconscious.

name: Clarity
description: You and your equipment can become transparent for a short time.
benefits: you and your equipment can assume the color and transparency of water for up to 1 minute per character level. this grants you a +8 racial bonus to stealth checks.

name: Clobber
description: You can trample with your hooves. Special A kai-lio fighter may select Clobber as one of his fighter bonus feats.
benefits: when you attempt to overrun an opponent your target may not choose to avoid you. you may make one hoof attack against any target you knock down, gaining the standard +4 bonus on attack rolls against disoriented targets.

name: Collective Mind
description: You can tap into the great zef collective to gain knowledge.
benefits: you can use all knowledge skills untrained. three times per day, you can meditate to actively tap the collective for a +2 racial bonus on a knowledge check. tapping the collective can also give you a second attempt on a knowledge skill roll you have previously failed on your own.

name: Collective Power
description: Once per day, you can manifest a power that you do not know.
prerequisites: able to manifest 3rd level powers or higher, collective mind.
benefits: once per day, add one additional power of any level up to two levels lower than the highest-level power you can manifest to your powers known. you can choose any power, including powers from another disciplines list or even from another classs list, even if that power is already on your classs power list. a different power may be chosen each day, but the one before it is lost.

name: Coral Link
description: You can make a telepathic link through coral formations.
benefits: this feat confers the ability to link with any open coral formation. you can exchange information across vast distances almost instantaneously. while you are within 100 feet of any part of any open coral reef, you can speak with any other creature currently linked to the same reef (usually using the same feat), instantly and telepathically. all cindarians gain this feat at first level.

name: Cosmic Swap
description: You and your animal can instantly swap places.
benefits: once per day, regardless of the distance, you can swap places with your spirit twin as a full round action that provokes an attack of opportunity.

name: Crab Armor
description: Your exoskeleton is thicker and spikier than normal.
prerequisites: kirah with a natural armor bonus.
benefits: your natural armor bonus increases by +2 and you gain the of armor spikes when you are not wearing manufactured armor.

name: Craft Ioun Bubble
description: You can create a psionic ioun bubble that can warn of impending danger.
benefits: you can create an ioun bubble. doing so takes one day for each circumstance that it can detect. the base price of an ioun bubble is equal to the number of circumstances it can detect multiplied by 100 gp. to create an ioun bubble, you must use up raw materials (usually crystal bottles and elaborate stoppers) costing one-quarter its base price.

name: Craft Mystic Starfish
description: You can create a psionic mystic starfish that can fulfill the Concentration requirement of powers when you cannot.
benefits: you can create a mystic starfish. doing so takes one day for each 1,000 gp. in its base price. the base price of a mystic starfish is equal to the highest-level power it can maintain, squared, and multiplied by 500 gp. to create a mystic starfish, you must use up raw materials costing one-half its base price.

name: Craw Daddy
description: Your claws have grown abnormally large.
benefits: your smaller attack claw (or both claws if you are female) has grown abnormally large. both attack claws inflict 1d8 damage instead of 1d6 or 1d4. the male karkanak's large claw is unaffected by this feat.

name: Create Podling
description: You prepare yourself to create a podling, thus furthering your species and taking another step towards immortality. Alternatively, if you are beheaded (your eye pod is chopped off) before you can initiate your transformation, you will fall unconscious (instead of instantly dying) and the process starts immediately after the beheading, culminating after 10 hours, provided your unconscious body is left in peace. Any significant injury to the body after beheading will interrupt the process and death will ensue naturally. Special You can take this feat, multiple times, provided that you qualify.
prerequisites: nelumbu, physical contact with another nelumbu, middle-age or greater age category.
benefits: any time after you take this feat, but only once, you may elect to create a podling during eight hours of uninterrupted rest. during the process, your eye-pod drops off and turns into a podling, your bloom becomes a new eye pod, the arm closest to your old eye-pod becomes a new bloom, and you grow a new arm in its place. your physical age is then reset to 6-years-old (young adult).

name: Crippling Bite
description: You can bite your opponents limbs off.
prerequisites: carchardian race, weapon focus (bite), str 15, improved critical (bite).
benefits: once per combat, on a successful critical hit you sever a limb. roll randomly based on the number of limbs possessed by the target. the head cannot be severed with this maneuver.

name: Cryptid Anonymity
description: Your talent for stealth has crossed into the realm of the supernatural.
benefits: by making a stealth check, dc 20, you can cast invisibility as a spell-like ability up to three times per day.

name: Crystal Gore
description: You gain a natural attack with your crystal head.
benefits: you gain a natural gore attack that does 1d8 piercing damage.

name: Culicidite
description: You metamorphose into a mosquito marine entobian.
benefits: you gain the following racial traits

name: Current Rider
description: You have learned how to compensate for water currents. Normal While in a current you travel at a rate equal to the speed of the current, minus any of your base swim speed that you wish to sacrifice to the current.
benefits: for every 5 feet that you sacrifice to fight the effects of a water current, you may subtract 10 feet from how far the current takes you. in addition, you gain a +5 circumstance bonus to any acrobatics check made to leave a current.

name: Dashing Skith
description: Your swirling skith leads you through the battlefield.
prerequisites: sorsalsel style, disorienting skith, acrobatics 8 ranks
benefits: while wielding a skith, you ignore difficult terrain when you charge, run, or withdraw. in addition, when charging with a skith, a hit allows you to roll the skiths damage dice twice and add the results together before adding modifiers (such as from strength) or extra dice (such as precision- based damage or dice from weapon abilities). the extra damage dice are not multiplied on a successful critical hit.

name: Deathless Spirit
description: You can resist the powers of death.
benefits: you gain resistance 5 against negative energy damage. you do not lose hit points when you gain a negative level, and you gain a +2 racial bonus on saving throws against death effects, energy drain, negative energy, and spells or spell-like abilities of the necromancy school.

name: Defender of the Vents
description: You have grown accustomed to hot water. Special You can take this feat multiple times, increasing the energy resistance by 5 each time.
benefits: you gain energy resistance 5 against steam and heat. if you already have energy resistance against steam and heat, it increases by 5.

name: Deliquesce
description: Once per day per level, you can slip out of bonds and grapples.
benefits: once per day per character level, as a swift action, you can automatically escape a grapple or free yourself from all bonds or shackles.

name: Denizen of the Deep
description: You can tolerate deeper depths.
prerequisites: anumi whose base animal has a depth tolerance greater than 300 feet.
benefits: you gain the base animals depth tolerance.

name: Disorienting Skith
description: You are a master of disorienting opponents with your skith.
prerequisites: special taking this feat allows you to qualify for the whirlwind attack feat even if you do not meet that feats . if you do not meet that feats , you can only use whirlwind attack while attacking with a skith.
benefits: while using a skith, whenever you hit an opponent, you gain a +4 bonus on checks made to trip that opponent with this weapon, as long as this combat maneuver is your next attack by the end of your turn. you do not provoke an attack of opportunity from the target of the maneuver. in addition, when you score a critical hit against an opponent while using a skith, that opponent is also knocked disoriented (or prone, if on land).

name: Dolphin Flip
description: You dart away from an opponent that you just hit.
benefits: after making a standard action melee attack, you may withdraw as a move action as long as you are swimming away.

name: Dream Bubble
description: You create a bubble that defies water.
benefits: at will, you become encapsulated in an ephemeral bubble that grants you 0 buoyancy and the ability to breathe underwater, but otherwise has no effect other than visual.

name: Durable Spirit Aspect
prerequisites: spirit devotion class feature, caster level 5th
benefits: select a particular spirit aspect. that aspects are doubled in duration.

name: Durable Tupilaq
description: Your tupilaq is more resistant to damage than most.
benefits: your tupilaq increases its starting damage reduction by 2 every time this feat is taken.

name: Earthen Tupilaq
description: You can mix stone and metal with your tupilaq granting it strength and enhanced fortitude.
prerequisites: +12 craft skill bonus, tupilaq class feature
benefits: you know how to work earthen materials into your tupilaq. each time you choose this feat, grant your tupilaq a +4 bonus to natural armor or a +2 strength bonus.

name: Ectoplasmic Ink
description: You can create a cloud of ink that cannot be dispersed.
benefits: by expending your psionic focus, you can emit a 15-foot-radius cloud of murky purple ink as a free action while underwater. this cloud provides total concealment and remains where it was released. the ink persists for 1 minute, and is immune to environmental and magical effects that would normally disperse murky water.

name: Embrace Bloodline
description: You gain another physical trait of your spiritual ancestors.
benefits: roll another 1d8 for the physical traits in the racial abilities section and gain that physical trait. if you roll a trait that you already have, roll again until you get a trait that you dont already have.

name: Enchanted Voice
description: You are adept at casting enchantment spells with just the lilt of your voice.
prerequisites: siren song class feature, spell focus (enchantment), caster level 5th, cha 15.
benefits: enchantment spells cast by you no longer have a somatic or material component. however, all enchantment spells have a vocal component. additionally, your enchantment spells are much simpler to cast. when making a concentration check to cast a spell from the enchantment school, you may add your charisma modifier to the roll. if you already add your charisma modifier, you may simply add it again.

name: Enhanced Subtype
description: Your subtype abilities become more powerful. Special If you change your subtype, the new subtype is automatically affected by this feat accordingly. If you have the Split Subtype, this feat can be taken twice, each time applying to a different subtype.
benefits: an abyssal squole continues to remain difficult to discern while moving half their normal speed, so long as they are doing nothing else (such as attacking or quaffing a potion). a polar squoles resist cold increases to 10. a squills fast healing rate increases to 3 hit points per level per day. a stinging squoles acid does 1d3 versus an unarmed strike and 1d6 when grappled. a twilight squole can use her flash ability twice per hour.

name: Enthralling Performance
description: While using your perform skill, you cause your audience to become fascinated. For every three levels you have attained, you can target one additional creature with this ability (two at 3rd level, three at 6th level, etc.)
prerequisites: amphian, 5 ranks in any perform skill
benefits: while you are psionically focused and actively using a perform skill, you can cause a creature to become fascinated with you. the creature must be within 90 feet and able to see, hear and pay attention to you. you must also be able to see the target. the distraction of nearby combat or other dangers prevents the ability from working.

name: Eviscerating Bite
description: Your teeth are especially large and sharp.
benefits: your natural bite attack does 1d6 damage and has a critical threat range of 19-20/2.

name: Evolutionarily Advanced
description: You are ahead of your peers at water adaptation.
benefits: your swim speed increases by 10 feet, your depth tolerance is 600 feet, and you can breathe water as well as air.

name: Expanded Senses
description: Your ultrasonic senses have expanded in range. Special You can gain this feat multiple times, each time extending the range of your water sense ability by 10 feet, to a maximum of 60 feet.
benefits: the range of your water sense ability increases by 10 feet.

name: Extra Arms Attack
description: You gain an additional attack with your extra arms.
prerequisites: mutations class feature, two or more mutations with the [extra arms] descriptor
benefits: while you maintain psionic focus, you may make one additional attack using your extra arms. standard rules apply for attacking with multiple weapons.

name: Extra Mutation (Aquanaut)
description: You gain an additional mutation. Special You can take the feat multiple times, choosing a new mutation each time.
prerequisites: benefit gain a mutation from one of your phyla that has no or descriptors.

name: Extra Song
description: Compared to others whove mastered the siren song, your repertoire of lyrics is larger.
prerequisites: siren song class feature, caster level 3rd
benefits: upon taking this feat, you may immediately gain a siren song you opted not to earlier in your characters advancement. for example, if at 3rd level you choose entrancing voice, you could select shattering note upon taking this feat. in short, this feat grants you the other song from any one level where you had to choose a single song.

name: Fantastic Tongue
description: Your tongue is very long and good at grappling.
benefits: when using your grasping tongue racial trait, your range improves by 10 feet, and you gain a +2 bonus on checks made to grapple a foe in this way.

name: Ferocious Tenacity
description: Your orc heritage allows you to fight on. Normal A sahuakin with the orc ferocity racial trait can fight for 1 more round after he is brought below 0 hit points.
prerequisites: con 13, sahuakin, orc ferocity racial trait.
benefits: you gain the ferocity universal monster ability, allowing you to continue fighting at negative hit points. when using this ability, you gain a +2 bonus on intimidate checks.

name: Ferocious Visage
description: You can appear much scarier than you actually are.
benefits: through posturing, flaring your gills, and flexing your muscles you can add double your charisma modifier when making intimidate checks.

name: Ferocious Walloping
description: Your savage ferocity combines with primitive attacks to inflict more damage.
prerequisites: mrawgh, base attack bonus +8, primordial brutality, str 17.
benefits: you gain a +2 competence bonus to attack rolls made while using improvised weapons. if you have the stick and spear feat, you may also apply this bonus to weapons affected by that feat.

name: Fins & Flippers
description: You gain mutations to help you swim faster.
prerequisites: anumi, base animal with swim speed greater than 30.
benefits: you sprout subtle fins, flippered feet, or other mobility enhancing accoutrements appropriate to your base animal, and your base swim speed permanently increases 10 feet.

name: Fishform
description: You can assume the form of a fish.
benefits: you can change your shape into that of a medium-sized unassuming green fish as a full round action for up to one round per character level per day. this ability otherwise functions as a polymorph spell. you do not adjust your ability scores (although you gain a swim speed of 100 feet).

name: Fishfriend
description: You can speak with fish.
benefits: you can communicate with fish as if using a speak with animals spell. in addition, you gain a +4 racial bonus to handle animal checks when dealing with fish.

name: Fists of Ice
description: Your unarmed attacks can inflict cold damage.
benefits: you may (at your discretion) deal an additional 1d4 cold damage on a successful unarmed melee attack. this ability only works with bare fists.

name: Fluid Form
description: You have mastered fluidity of form.
benefits: you can cast fluid form (advanced player's guide) as a spell-like ability once per day.

name: Flying Fish
description: You can jump out of the water and glide short distances.
benefits: as a full-round action, you can glide in a straight vertical arc (from surface of the water, back to surface of water in a straight line), reaching up to 10 feet above the water at the center of the arc, for up to 60 feet in one round, reentering the water at the end of the round. this ability must be initiated at the surface of the water.

name: Flying Fish Leap
description: You are an expert at jumping out of the water.
benefits: when you make a high jump out of the water, you do not receive the normal 10 penalty. in addition, you can move as far horizontally as you can jump vertically.

name: Forge of Eternity
description: Items made with your mystic forge ability are permanent.
benefits: your mystic forge ability creates permanent items rather than items that revert back to their original form after 10 minutes.

name: Form and Family
description: You can easily shift into animals that are similar to your own form.
prerequisites: ability to manifest metamorphosis, anthromorph subtype
benefits: when you manifest minor metamorphosis, major metamorphosis, or metamorphosis to assume the form of a natural animal within the same family as your race, the manifestation time is a swift action instead of a standard action and requires one less power point per level of power (minimum 1 power point). family, with regards to this feat, refers to the base animal the anthromorph race represents. for example, karkanaks are humanoid crabs, pisceans are related to fish, zefs to snails, nagas to snakes, sebek-kas to crocodiles, and mogogols are frogs.

name: Form of Sebek
description: You can assume the form of a crocodile or alligator.
benefits: you gain a spell-like racial ability that functions like the beast shape i spell, except as noted here. you can only turn into a crocodile or alligator. you may use this ability once per day. the effect lasts for 1 hour, or until you change back. changing form (to crocodilian or back) is a standard action and doesnt provoke an attack of opportunity.

name: Four Eyes, Four Ears
description: It is very difficult to blind or deafen you.
benefits: you can roll twice for a saving throw versus a blindness or deafness effect and take the best result.

name: Freezing Weapons
description: Supernatural cold stirs within your body and the weapons that you wield.
benefits: as a swift action, you can make up to two held manufactured metallic or ever-ice weapons become super-cooled for 1 round, dealing 1d3 additional points of cold damage with a successful hit. this does not stack with other effects that add cold damage to weapons, such as the freezing weapon special ability. when you are grappling, you deal this damage to your grappling opponent on your turn.

name: Friendbringer
description: You can use summon oceans ally more often.
prerequisites: shazalarian triton, summon oceans ally racial ability.
benefits: you can use your spell-like ability of summon oceans ally a number of times per day equal to half your character level instead of once per day.

name: Frigid Aura
description: A blizzard rages inside you, causing your body to radiate intense cold.
prerequisites: freezing weapons, character level 7th, ice elf.
benefits: when you use the freezing weapons feat, on your turn as a free action, you may create an aura of cold that lasts for 1 round. this aura deals 1d6 points of cold damage to any creature that begins its turn adjacent to you.

name: Frostbreath
description: You can breathe out a cloud of freezing water.
benefits: once per day, as a standard action, you can make a supernatural breath weapon attack that deals 1d6 points of cold damage in a 15-foot cone. all creatures within the affected area must make a reflex saving throw to avoid taking damage. the save dc against this breath weapon is 10 + 1/2 the your character level + your constitution modifier. those who succeed at the save take no damage from the attack.

name: Fuel Maneuver
description: You can channel the power of your element into performing combat maneuvers.
prerequisites: elemental lash class feature, base attack bonus +5.
benefits: while using your elemental lash class feature, as a swift action at the start of your turn, you can forgo the energy damage and instead gain half that damage as a bonus on combat maneuver checks against the target of your lash. the effects of your elemental lash feature return to normal at the start of your next turn.

name: Gadget Virtuoso
description: You have a knack with hitogoi mechanisms.
benefits: you gain a bonus to craft (mechanical) checks equal to your ranks in your knowledge (engineering) skill when building or maintaining hitogoi mechanical items. in addition, you can maintain these items for free.

name: Gamble Fate
description: You can avoid losing hit points when using Bribe Fate feat, at a possible price.
benefits: you may use your bribe fate racial trait without losing hit points. if you succeed at your second saving throw, you immediately lose your level in hit points.

name: Glowing Wounds
description: You have retained some of your ability from your youth.
benefits: wounds caused by your stinging tendrils racial ability glow brightly for 1 hour, attracting the attention of wandering predators. the glow is suppressed out of the water, but resumes instantly once the body part is re-submerged.

name: Golden Eye
description: Your eye is finely tuned to perceive objects made of gold. Normal Sense coins only helps to detect coins.
benefits: your sense coins racial trait also applies to all things made of gold metal.

name: Good Karma
description: You generate an extra point of Karma per day.
prerequisites: ability to cast spells with the chronomancy descriptor.
benefits: even if you are not a chronomancer, you begin regenerating karma at a rate of 1 point per day. if you are a chronomancer, this is in addition to your normal pool.

name: Greater Amphibiousness
description: Your ability to traverse land and sea improves.
benefits: if you have lungs, you can survive underwater for 1 hour per point of constitution. if you have gills, you can survive on land for 1 hour per point of constitution.

name: Greater Assault
description: Your mystical assaults do more damage on a critical hit.
benefits: instead of an extra point of energy damage, your mystical assault does 1d6 energy damage on a successful critical hit.

name: Greater Blood Frenzy
description: Your wounds move you into a deeper frenzy.
benefits: you no longer take a penalty to ac while in a blood frenzy. in addition, if you strike an enemy with your bite attacks while in a blood frenzy, you can inflict bleed damage (1d4).

name: Greater Elemental Touch
description: Your touch of the elements does more damage.
prerequisites: wis 13, touch of the elements class feature.
benefits: when damaging an opponent with your touch of the elements class ability, the victim takes an additional 1d6 points of energy damage of the same type at the start of your next turn.

name: Greater Guise
description: You have mastered passing yourself off as a normal animal.
benefits: you gain a +8 on your bluff check to pass as a normal animal.

name: Guardian Spirit
description: The spirits you summon look upon you favorably and grant you the strength to persevere.
benefits: whenever you invoke a spirit aspect you gain a +2 bonus to saving throws for 1 round.

name: Gyrinite
description: You metamorphose into a whirligig beetle marine entobian.
benefits: you gain the following racial traits

name: Halobite
description: You metamorphose into a sea skater marine entobian.
benefits: you gain the following racial traits

name: Hardy Brawler
description: You can shrug off non-lethal blows without effect.
benefits: you gain dr against nonlethal damage equal to your constitution modifier.

name: Healing Molt
description: You can regenerate limbs when you molt. Note Molting is an 8-hour process, during which you have the disabled condition.
benefits: once per week, you can initiate a molt (shedding of your exoskeleton), during which you can regrow lost limbs, wings, and other body parts and regain all of your hit points.

name: Healing Spirit
description: Your summoned spirits are imbued with greater healing power.
benefits: whenever you summon a spirit aspect that heals allies or grants them temporary hit points, you may add your wisdom modifier to the amount healed or gained. if the spirit aspect already keys off of wisdom to determine the amount healed or gained, simply add the wisdom modifier again.

name: Hypnotic Eyes
description: You can initiate a powerful hypnotic gaze attack.
benefits: at the beginning of your turn, you may spend your psionic focus as a free action to initiate a powerful hypnotic gaze attack. any creature within 30 feet of you may be subject to your gaze. creatures thus affected who fail to make a will save (dc 12 + 1/2 your level) become fascinated with you for 2d4 rounds. targets that successfully resist your gaze attack become immune to your gaze for 24 hours.

name: Ice in the Blood
description: Extreme cold heals you faster. You can heal up to 2 hit points per level per day with this ability, after which it ceases to function.
benefits: you gain fast healing 2 for 1 round anytime you take cold damage (whether or not this cold damage gets through your cold resistance).

name: Icy Berserker
description: When you enter your barbarian rage, your body becomes infused with cold energy.
benefits: as long as you are under the effects of a barbarian rage, you gain the cold subtype. you gain immunity to cold but have vulnerability to steam.

name: Icy Grasp
description: You deal extra cold damage while lightly armored and grappling.
benefits: if you are wearing light or no armor, you deal an extra 1d6 cold damage on a successful grapple attack to deal damage.

name: Imp Mastery
description: You have mastered control of the remora imp.
prerequisites: trueform subtype, remora imp tool use ability.
benefits: you gain one additional remora imp that you can control. in addition, you can put one or more of your imps into reserve. these imps will follow at a distance of up to a mile and generally stay out of sight, but be recoverable within 3d6 minutes with a simple command in pelagic. reserve imps still count towards the limit of imps that you can control.

name: Implanted Bioluminescence
description: You have successfully incorporated bioluminescent zooplankton into your body
benefits: you can control the intensity of your bioluminescent light from no light at all, up to the intensity and functionality of a hooded lantern.

name: Improved Force Manipulation
description: Your force manipulation ability grows stronger and more nimble. Special You can take this feat two additional times, for a maximum bonus of +6 (and scores not exceeding 16). Normal Your force manipulation ability has a Strength and Dexterity score of 10.
prerequisites: trueform subtype, force manipulation tool use ability.
benefits: the effective strength and dexterity score of your force manipulation ability increases by 2 points.

name: Improvisational Artist
description: You may draw materials from your surroundings to create your art.
prerequisites: woggle, racial bonus to a craft skill.
benefits: when you craft an item using the craft skill with a racial bonus, you can pay 1/4 of the items price for the raw material cost. you must still succeed at the appropriate dc check, and the work takes the same amount of time as a normal item. if you fail the craft check by 5 or more, you ruin all the raw materials and must begin again.

name: Indissoluble Will
description: Your Will save remains unaffected by effects that specifically target it.
benefits: spend you psionic focus as an immediate action to ignore all penalties to your will save for a number of turns equal to your character level.

name: Innate Talent
description: Your talent is instinctual and its unlikely for you to fail at it.
prerequisites: woggle, racial bonus to a craft or perform skill.
benefits: once per day, when you use a craft or perform skill with a racial bonus, roll twice and keep the best roll.

name: Innate Two-Weapon Fighting
description: Each head can control a melee attack independently, eliminating penalties for attacking with a light weapon in each hand.
benefits: you do not take a penalty on attack rolls for fighting with two light weapons.

name: Inspire Courage
description: Your presence bolsters your allies against fear.
benefits: you grant allies within 50 feet of you a +2 morale bonus to saving throws versus fear effects.

name: Inspire Lust
description: You can use your spell-like ability more often. Special You can take this feat multiple times, adding an additional casting per day.
benefits: you can use your unnatural lust spell- like ability one additional time per day.

name: Iron Shell (feat)
description: Your carapace is especially thick. Special You can take this feat three additional times, each time adding +1 to your natural armor bonus, to a maximum of +6.
benefits: you gain an additional +1 natural armor bonus for having an exceptionally thick carapace.

name: Jet Away
description: You can spirit away at amazing speeds. Special You can take this feat multiple times, gaining an additional jet per day each time.
benefits: once per day, you can jet away as a full round action, at a speed of 120 feet. you must move in a straight line, but do not provoke attacks of opportunity while jetting.

name: Kami/Oni Touched
description: Resistance to holy or unholy energy comes from either your kami or oni heritage.
benefits: when you take this feat, you must choose either kami (good) or oni (evil) and this choice cannot be opposite to your own alignment. you gain spell resistance (sr) equal to 5 + your level against spells and spell-like abilities with the chosen alignment descriptor, as well as any spells and spell-like abilities cast by outsiders with the subtype equal to your chosen alignment descriptor.

name: Koi Shape
description: You inherited some innate magic from your mother.
benefits: you have the supernatural ability to assume the appearance and mobility of a medium-sized koi fish (swim 60 ft, racial buoyancy -25b). you gain a +10 racial bonus on disguise checks made to appear as a normal fish. changing shape is a standard action. this trait otherwise functions as alter self, save that you do not adjust your ability scores.

name: Kuls Intuition
description: You get a second chance to disable a device.
benefits: if you fail a disable device check to disable a trap or open a lock, you may immediately reroll and use the second result instead. this effect is used as an immediate action after the first check is attempted but before the results are revealed by the gm.

name: Land Delver
description: You have trained yourself to breathe air.
benefits: you gain lungs and the ability to breathe air indefinitely. you still retain your gills as well, effectively becoming amphibious.

name: Lethocite
description: You metamorphose into a water bug marine entobian.
benefits: you gain the following racial traits

name: Libellite
description: You metamorphose into a dragonfly entobian.
benefits: you gain the following racial traits

name: Limit Mutation
description: You can further limit the number of random choices for your Daily Form racial trait.
benefits: before you roll for your daily form for the day, choose and write down three numbers from 1 to 10. you may reroll for your daily form racial trait if any number that you have written down is rolled.

name: Liquefy
description: Once per day, you can turn to liquid and escape bonds and grapples.
benefits: once per day, you may spend your psionic focus as a swift action to automatically escape a grapple or free yourself from any bonds or shackles.

name: Liquid Body (feat)
description: You are less susceptible to critical hits.
benefits: you have learned how to let massive shock flow through your body without causing great damage to you. while you are psionically focused, any critical threats made against you only confirm if the second roll results in a natural 20 on the die.

name: Luck of the Beast
description: You call upon animal instinct to avoid bad situations.
prerequisites: anumi, 6th level, and either the bestial fortitude racial trait or the bestial reflexes racial trait.
benefits: if bestial fortitude is granted by your subrace, once per day, you may reroll a failed fortitude save. if bestial reflexes is granted by your subrace, once per day, you may reroll a failed reflex save. this effect is used as an immediate action after the first save is attempted, but before the results are revealed by the gm. the anumi must take the second result, even if it is worse. this does not stack with other abilities that let you reroll saving throws.

name: Magic of the Fey
description: You gain a minor spell-like ability. Special You may take this feat multiple times, each time choosing a different 0th level spell.
benefits: choose a 0th level spell. you may cast this spell once per day as a caster equal to your character level. the dc (if any) is 10 + charisma modifier.

name: Manifest Form
description: You can assume the form of an animal that you resemble. Your options for new form include all creatures with the animal type that can be considered the same subrace as you are, and one that you are familiar with. For example, a carniform anumi can become any animal type of seal or otter that the character has encountered. Changing form (to animal or back) is a standard action and doesnt provoke an attack of opportunity.
benefits: you gain a spell-like racial ability that functions like the beast shape i spell, except as noted here. you may use this ability once per day. the effect lasts for 1 hour, or until you change back.

name: Manipulate Probability
description: Through sheer will, you can make yourself less likely to fail at one task.
benefits: a number of times per day equal to your wisdom modifier, you may roll 5d4 in the place of a d20 for a skill check, saving throw, or roll to hit.

name: Many Faces
description: You can change your appearance several times per day.
prerequisites: apsara with minor metamorphosis psi-like ability.
benefits: you can use minor metamorphosis a number of times per day equal to half your character level.

name: Maridian Envoy
description: You work well with marids.
benefits: you gain a +4 racial bonus on bluff, diplomacy, and sense motive checks when dealing with marids.

name: Master of Art
description: Even the most lackadaisical artistic effort yields masterful results.
prerequisites: woggle, racial bonus to a craft or perform skill.
benefits: when you use craft or perform skill with a racial bonus and take 10 with this skill, treat your die result as a 15 instead.

name: Merform
description: You can assume a merfolk-like form.
prerequisites: anumi, species with fish or dolphin-like tail, fins & flippers feat, wis 13.
benefits: for a number of rounds per day equal to your level (which do not need to be taken consecutively), as a spell-like ability, your lower half becomes like your base animal and you gain that animals swim speed (both adjusted for size). the effects are otherwise similar to an alter self spell.

name: Metamorph (feat)
description: You start your journey of transformation. In addition, you gain lungs and retain the ability to breathe air even after you take a metamorphosis feat. During this time of your life you are truly amphibious, possessing both gills and lungs allows you to breathe air and water with equal ease. You lose your gills after you take a metamorphosis feat.
prerequisites: marine entobian who has not taken a metamorphosis feat or the neotonite feat, character level 2.
benefits: you may take a metamorphosis feat as soon as you qualify for one.

name: Mid-day Form Change
description: Once per day, you can change your form as if it were sunrise.
benefits: once per day, as a full-round action that provokes an attack of opportunity, you can invoke a change of form as if it were the sunrise of a new day. regardless of the time before sunrise, the next sunrise will still provoke your daily form racial trait normally.

name: Midwinter Hide
description: Your hide has grown particularly thick and insulated.
benefits: you gain an additional +1 natural armor bonus and cold resistance 5.

name: Might and Magic
description: You gain a minor spell-like ability. Special You may take this feat multiple times, each time choosing a different 1st level spell each time.
benefits: choose a 1st level enchantment spell from the wizard/sorcerer spell list. by expending a number of power points equal to or less than your level, you may cast this spell once per day. the caster level is equal to the number of power points spent. the dc (if any) is 10 + your charisma modifier.

name: Mightier Roots
description: Your gripping roots ability has become much stronger.
benefits: as a move-equivalent action that does not provoke an attack of opportunity, you can root yourself in place onto any unyielding surface. while rooted, you receive a +3 circumstance bonus (in addition to your racial bonus) to your combat maneuver defense when resisting a bull rush or trip attempt. if you move or are moved from the square in which you initiated this ability, the bonus ends.

name: Mind Venom
description: Your bite introduces venom that makes your victims more susceptible to your telepathic attacks. Mind Venominjury; save Fort DC 12 + 1/2 your level; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d2 Wis damage. In addition, anyone under the influence of your venom takes a -2 penalty to all Will saves against your psionic powers. ; cure 3 saves.
benefits: while you maintain psionic focus, your bite attack inflicts the following venom instead of the standard naga venom

name: Mireborn
description: You were born in an estuary, and are acclimated to both salt and freshwater.
benefits: you suffer no ill effects going to water with a different salinity level.

name: Mismatched Gem
