benefits: your melee attacks ignore any temporary hit points the target may have. the target retains these temporary hit points, but damage from your attack subtracts from the creatures regular supply of hit points without acknowledging the temporary hit points.

name: Tearing Grip
description: You rend your foes as you wrestle them to the ground.
benefits: once per round with a successful grapple check you may deal 1d6 + strength modifier slashing damage to the target of your grapple. if you possess weapon finesse, or a similar ability that would allow you to use your dexterity bonus on attack rolls, you may use your dexterity modifier in place of your strength modifier for this damage.

name: Technique Mastery (Combat)
description: You can quickly switch between techniques as needed. Normal It takes a swift action to begin or switch your techniques.
prerequisites: any two technique feats, base attack bonus +5
benefits: you can switch your technique as a free action. at the start of combat, pick one of your techniques. you start the combat using that technique, even in the surprise round.

name: Technique Feats
description: Those trained in the art of war often seek out new methods of employing their skill at arms. While monastic orders and martial artists looked to nature for their inspiration, mighty warriors and battle-hardened crusaders instead looked to the stars, shaping their techniques after the powerful outsiders of the multiverse. Editor's Note The feat Technique Mastery can let you switch techniques faster. The techniques from Paths of Magic are as follows, along with specific feat pathsfeats that complement each technique. (Editor's Note Only the first feat in a technique chain, the one with "Technique" in the name, has the Technique feat descriptor. The other feats in the chain are not Technique feats, but are listed here for convenience.) Combat Reflexes, base attack bonus +8 Bash, Tower Shield Proficiency, base attack bonus +4 Improved Shield Bash, Tower Shield Proficiency, base attack bonus +6 base attack bonus +6 Combat Reflexes, base attack bonus +9 attack bonus +6 Power Attack, base attack bonus +9 Improved Sunder, Power Attack, base attack bonus +11 (whip), Whip MasteryUC, base attack bonus +5 Greater Whip MasteryUC, Two-Weapon Fighting, Weapon Focus (whip), Whip MasteryUC, base attack bonus +11 Attack or Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +10 Perception 3 ranks, base attack bonus +2 Kami Technique, Perception 7 ranks, base attack bonus +5 Improvised Weapon Mastery, Kami Technique, Kami Insight, Perception 11 ranks, base attack bonus +8 bonus +5 Technique, base attack bonus +7 Technique, Protean Twist, base attack bonus +11 attack bonus +2 Bluff 5 ranks, base attack bonus +3 Rakshasa Technique, Bluff 7 ranks, base attack bonus +5 base attack bonus +3 Weapon Focus (scythe), Whirlwind Attack, base attack bonus +7 base attack bonus +4 Technique, Str 19, base attack bonus +8
prerequisites: as a swift action, you enter the stance employed by the combat technique that a technique feat embodies. although you cannot use a technique feat before combat begins, the technique you are using persists until you spend a swift action to switch to a different combat technique. you can use a feat that has a technique feat as a only while in the stance of the associated technique. for example, you if you have feats associated with archon technique and inevitable technique, you can use a swift action to adopt inevitable technique at the start of one turn, and then can use other feats that have inevitable technique as a . by using another swift action at the start of your next turn, you could adopt archon technique and use other feats that have archon technique as a .
benefits: as techniques rely on using a weapon as an extension of your body, they must be used with weapons. they cannot be used with unarmed strikes or natural weapons, even if the effects of the technique do not rely on a specific weapon. for example, although protean technique does not specify a weapon, you would not gain its with an unarmed strike. you cannot use a technique feat while you are using a style feat.

name: Tempest Gale Haze
description: The very wind that carries your attacks to the enemy protects you from retaliation.
prerequisites: tempest gale style, sleight of hand 7 ranks.
benefits: ranged attacks against you suffer a 20% miss chance.

name: Tempest Gale Storm
description: You can fire off precisely aimed shots at rapid pace.
prerequisites: tempest gale style, tempest gale haze, sleight of hand 11 ranks.
benefits: you can make two different ranged combat maneuver attempts with your tempest gale style feat against a single target as a standard action. you only provoke attacks of opportunity once when doing so.

name: Tempest Gale Style
description: Your arrows and slings are able to strike targets in unusual ways.
prerequisites: sleight of hand 3 ranks, one tempest gale stance known.
benefits: you can make bull rush, dirty trick, disarm, and trip attempts using a ranged weapon against any target within your first range increment. attempting a combat maneuver in this way is a standard action that provokes an attack of opportunity (unless you have the appropriate improved combat maneuver feat). you use your dexterity modifier instead of your strength modifier for determining your combat maneuver bonus for these attempts.

name: Tempest Strike (Combat)
description: A furious blast of air batters foes in your way.
prerequisites: nature magicacg or the ability to cast druid or ranger spells; vital strike, knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.
benefits: you can use this a number of times per day equal to your wisdom modifier (minimum 1). you can choose to use this ability as a free action after you hit the enemy with the attack. this is a supernatural ability.

name: Terrible Two-Step
description: With a spin and a flourish you reveal that that spin was actually a spin-kick.
benefits: once per round, while using dance-fu, when you make a melee attack against a foe you may force them to make a perception check (dc 10 + your perform (dance) bonus) if they fail they are considered flat footed against that attack. every 10 by which they fail renders them flat-footed against an additional attack you make this round.

name: Terrifying Blow (feat)
description: When you succeed on an awesome blow combat maneuver, as a free action you can force one creature within 30 feet to succeed on a Will save (DC 10 + your base attack bonus + your Strength modifier) or be shaken for 1 round. For every 5 points by which your combat maneuver check exceeds the DC, you may force an additional creature to save or become shaken. Creatures that cannot see you and your target are immune to this effect. If you have Awesome Blow, Mighty Blow, and Improved Bull Rush, you can make use Terrifying Blow in place of an attack, including as an attack action, in place of an attack of opportunity, or in place of one attack made during a full-attack action or when using Spring Attack. You cannot use Terrifying Blow more than once per round. In addition, if roll a natural 20 on your combat maneuver check, you can make a second combat maneuver check against the same CMD; any bonuses you gain that apply to confirming critical hits apply to this roll. If you again meet or exceed the targets CMD, your maneuver deals double your normal claw or slam attack damage while also pushing your target back twice as far (and causing double damage if it hits an intervening obstacle). In addition, all enemies within 30 feet must save or become shaken for 1 round. While this functions similarly to a critical hit from an attack, effects and feats which affect critical hits have no effect on your Terrifying Blow. Special This feat may be taken multiple times; each time it is taken, you are considered to be an additional size category larger when using the awesome blow combat maneuver, and the DC to avoid becoming shaken after witnessing your successful maneuver increases by 2. In addition, if you push a creature back with a successful combat maneuver and it strikes another creature or object, that creature or object takes 1d6 points of damage (2d6 if you confirmed a critical hit), plus an additional 1d6 points of damage for every time after the first you have selected his feat.
prerequisites: this feat serves in place of the normal for awesome blow, and if you take awesome blow it also serves in place of all other for mighty blow. if you have awesome blow, you can use terrifying blow as often as desired. in addition, you are considered to be one size category larger when using the awesome blow combat maneuver.
benefits: you can use your claw or slam attack to attempt an awesome blow combat maneuver, as if you had the awesome blow feat. you can use this ability a number of times per day equal to your strength modifier (minimum 1) against creatures of your size or smaller. a successful combat maneuver check deals claw or slam damage, as appropriate, and pushes the target back 10 feet and knocks it prone, as normal for an awesome blow.

name: Thrashing Dragon Pounce
description: Your swift movements allow you to close the gap and strike quickly against your foe.
benefits: whenever you initiate a strike that requires you to make only a single melee attack, you can make an additional attack with another weapon as a free action. this attack is made at your highest base attack bonus, although you take the penalties for fighting with two weapons as normal. this attack does not gain any of the of the strike you initiated.

name: Thrashing Dragon Style
description: Your skill with two weapons makes you as dangerous as foes who wield one larger weapon.
prerequisites: acrobatics 3 ranks, one thrashing dragon stance known.
benefits: once per round, when you make an attack as a standard action or attack action, you can make an additional attack with another weapon as a free action. this attack is made at your highest base attack bonus, although you take the penalties for fighting with two weapons as normal.

name: Thrashing Dragon Whirlwind
description: Your fury strikes out at all enemies around you.
prerequisites: thrashing dragon style, thrashing dragon pounce, acrobatics 11 ranks.
benefits: as a full-round action, you can make one melee attack with a weapon in your main hand and a weapon in your off hand against each opponent within reach. this attack is made at your highest base attack bonus, and you do not take the penalties for fighting with two weapons on these attacks.

name: Threadspinner
description: You can rapidly weave threads of silk to use in combat.
prerequisites: special this feat counts as weapon focus (araenae thread) and weapon focus (ironweb thread) for the purposes of . if you gain a feat or ability that applies to one of these two weapons, it applies to both instead.
benefits: you can expend one of your daily uses of your web ability to create a spool of araenae silk thread in a free hand. unlike a normal spool of araenae silk thread, this spool is more fragile than normal, has no value, and decays to the point of uselessness after one hour. you have also learned to wield araenae silk thread in such a way that you can constrict and bruise your foes using it. araenae silk thread you wield gains a damage die of 1d3/1d3 bludgeoning damage, and you can choose to deal nonlethal damage with your araenae silk thread without a penalty on attacks rolls. like with ironweb thread, you can choose to deal double this damage whenever you maintain a grapple using your araenae silk thread, and when you tie up a creature using araenae silk thread you can choose whether or not the creature attempting to break free damages it. additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and combat maneuver checks made using araenae silk thread or ironweb thread.

name: Thunderstruck
description: Your music carries the fury of the elements. An affected ally does not gain the normal competence bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls, and instead deals additional 1d6 damage with their weapons for each point of competence bonus that your inspire courage would normally grant. The type of this damage depends on your primary element. This feat is a supernatural ability. Special If you do not have a primary element or if your primary element is not on the above list, then this feats additional damage type defaults to electricity. At the GMs option, you can use a different damage type from the list (or an entirely new one) based on your primary element.
prerequisites: fire starter, inspire courage class feature.
benefits: when you use your inspire courage ability, you can choose to imbue the attacks of affected allies with elemental energy, rather than giving them a bonus on attack and weapon damage rolls. this choice is made when you activate the ability, and choice applies to affected allies.

name: Titan Grip (Combat)
description: With great strength and a hard grip, you can wield weapons of immense size with ease.
prerequisites: power attack, titan technique, str 17, base attack bonus +4
benefits: the penalty for wielding an inappropriately-sized weapon that is too large for you is reduced by 1. the penalty is reduced by an additional 1 at base attack bonus +8 and every 4 thereafter, to a maximum reduction of 5.

name: Titan Technique (Combat, Technique)
description: You are adept as using weapons of great proportions to take down large foes. Normal The measure of how much effort it takes to use a weapon (whether the weapon is designated as a light, one-handed, or two-handed weapon for a particular wielder) is altered by one step for each size category of difference between the wielders size and the size of the creature for which the weapon was designed. For example, a Small creature would wield a Medium one-handed weapon as a two-handed weapon. If a weapons designation would be changed to something other than light, one-handed, or two-handed by this alteration, the creature cant wield the weapon at all.
benefits: you can wield weapons intended for creatures that are one size category larger than you, using the same handedness. you take a -2 penalty on attack rolls when wielding a weapon that would otherwise be unusable (such as a large two-handed weapon, if you are medium); this is in addition to the normal penalty for wielding a weapon not appropriately sized for you.

name: Titan Slayer (Combat)
description: You can wield weapons of incredible size. Normal The measure of how much effort it takes to use a weapon (whether the weapon is designated as a light, one-handed, or two-handed weapon for a particular wielder) is altered by one step for each size category of difference between the wielders size and the size of the creature for which the weapon was designed. For example, a Small creature would wield a Medium one-handed weapon as a two-handed weapon. If a weapons designation would be changed to something other than light, one-handed, or two-handed by this alteration, the creature cant wield the weapon at all.
prerequisites: power attack, titan grip, titan technique, str 19, base attack bonus +8
benefits: you can wield weapons intended for creatures two size categories larger than you with the same handedness. the penalty described in titan technique still applies. when wielding a weapon that is too large for you, your reach increases by 5 feet.

name: Trade Blows
description: You can react and exchange a series of blows with enemies when they strike at you. Normal You can only ready a standard action, a move action, a swift action, or a free action. After taking a readied full attack, you can spend 5 stamina points to act immediately ahead of the character whose action triggered your readied action, even if you made attacks after the other character finished acting.
prerequisites: base attack bonus +14, weapon training class feature with a melee weapon.
benefits: as a full round action, you can ready a full attack. if your readied action interrupts another characters turn, then when it triggers, you can take the first attack of your full attack, and then the character whose turn you interrupted can continue to act. during that characters interrupted turn, each time that character takes a move or standard action or makes an attack, you can interrupt with the next attack in your full attack. if you still have attacks remaining from your full attack after the other character finishes acting, you can complete your full attack, but if you do so then your initiative result changes so that you act immediately after the character whose action triggered your readied action, rather than immediately ahead of that character.

name: Transient Body
description: You have learned to return partially to your infant state, eschewing your rocky body to find one more suitable to you.
prerequisites: special if you have this feat, you can select the adamantine ore, mithral ore, necroform mossling, and wooden form feats even if you arent 1st level, and you may take multiple of these feats at once. this feat also counts as having the stone body trait for the purposes of meeting those feats . when doing so, you may only benefit from one of these feats at a time and must find a boulder (or skeleton, log, or stump) to meld with to gain the benefits of those feats. you can also retrain those feats as long as you have this feat, but you cannot retrain this feat if you have more than one of those feats.
benefits: if you have enhanced your previous body, it remains enhanced despite you no longer being attached to it. if you (or another mossling) meld your body with it again you regain the of those enhancements.

name: Twin Throw
description: You can hurl multiple weapons at the same time.
prerequisites: dex 17, point-blank shot, two-weapon fighting, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: when making a full-attack action with a thrown weapon, your first attack fires two thrown weapons. if the attack hits, both weapons hit. apply precision-based damage (such as sneak attack) and critical hit damage only once for this attack. damage bonuses from a high strength bonus apply to each weapon, as do other damage bonuses, such as a rangers favored enemy bonus. damage reduction and resistances apply separately to each weapon.

name: Two-Fisted Shooter
description: Your skills are unparalleled, allowing you to wield firearms in each hand without issue.
prerequisites: dex 17, proficiency with one-handed firearms, two-weapon fighting
benefits: you can draw and sheath one-handed firearms as a free action, allowing you to sheath one of your firearms to reload the other between attacks. additionally, you treat the following firearms as if they were light weapons for the purposes of two-weapon fighting coat pistol, dagger pistol, pistol, revolver.

name: Umbral Striker (Combat)
description: You can infuse your weapons with shadowy energy.
benefits: when you use the arcane strike feat, your weapons are also considered silver and cold iron for the purpose of bypassing damage reduction. in addition, you may choose to have the bonus damage dealt by arcane strike be negative energy damage, as opposed to dealing the weapons damage type. this damage stacks with other negative effects, such as a necrotic enchantment, and is multiplied on a critical hit. the damage does not harm nor heal an undead (nor any other creature that would be healed by negative energy).

name: Unquiet Grave Hunger
description: Blissful as the vampires bite.
benefits: you may choose to inflict a dexterity penalty with unquiet grave style instead of a strength penalty. whenever you inflict an ability score penalty or ability damage with an unquiet grave maneuver, you gain an equal number of temporary hit points. treat these temporary hit points as though they were gained from an unquiet grave strike.

name: Unquiet Grave Return
description: Rise up, o lord of the night.
prerequisites: unquiet grave style, unquiet grave hunger, knowledge (religion) 11 ranks
benefits: you may choose to inflict a constitution penalty with unquiet grave style instead of a strength penalty. if used against an undead creature, you may instead inflict a charisma penalty. once per day, whenever you would die, you do not die. instead, you take on a deathly pallor, rise up with dread purpose, and remain alive and conscious for 1 minute. no matter how many negative hit points you accrue during this time, you still remain animate. if you do not slay a creature before the minute is up, you die. if your hp is below 0 when the time elapses after slaying a creature, you are brought to 1 hp. otherwise it remains at its current total.

name: Unquiet Grave Style
description: Cold like the touch of the wight.
prerequisites: knowledge (religion) 3 ranks, one unquiet grave stance known.
benefits: whenever you score a critical hit with an unquiet grave discipline weapon, the target also takes a -2 penalty to strength for a number of rounds equal to your initiation modifier. this penalty increases by 2 for every 4 initiator levels beyond 3. the penalties from this feat stack with themselves and from unquiet grave maneuvers, but do not stack with other strength penalties (such as from ray of enfeeblement). this penalty cannot exceed a creatures strength score. this penalty is treated as though it was inflicted by an unquiet grave maneuver.

name: Variable Wind
description: Youve learned to use the many styles of the Solar Wind discipline.
prerequisites: one solar wind maneuver known, one solar wind stance known.
benefits: you gain the ability to change your active element if you cannot already. any solar wind maneuver you initiate that deals fire damage instead deals damage of your active elements associated energy type (see the elemental flux discipline for more information on active elements, and the the elements and solar wind sidebar on the solar wind page for more information on the elemental variants of solar wind).

name: Veiled Moon Shunt
description: You twist an enemys location, shunting them into a dangerous position of weakness.
benefits: once per round, when you hit with an attack, you can expend a readied maneuver as a free action to forcibly teleport your target. that creature must succeed at a will save (dc 10 + the expended maneuvers level + your highest initiation modifier) or be teleported to any unoccupied space within 30 feet of them that you can see. you need not teleport them to a location that can support them; you can teleport them into the air, into difficult terrain, or into dangerous situations as you see fit. this is a supernatural ability, and is considered a veiled moon maneuver for the purposes of save dcs and abilities such as the discipline focus feat.

name: Veiled Moon Style
description: Your secret knowledge of ethereal pathways allows you to slip through cracks in this world and come out the other side. Special You can use this feat to bypass a 5 feet worth of obstacles when making a charge; you treat a square you bypass as empty for the purposes of determining if you can charge your target.
prerequisites: stealth 3 ranks, one veiled moon stance known.
benefits: whenever you move, you can treat up to 10 feet of that movement as teleportation. this teleportation may be taken at any point during your movement, and cannot exceed the total movement you would normally be allowed to make. you must have line of sight to your destination, and cannot teleport into an occupied space. this is a supernatural ability.

name: Veiled Moon Warp
description: Your strikes can force an enemy into the aether for a short time.
prerequisites: veiled moon style, veiled moon shunt, stealth 15 ranks.
benefits: as a standard action, you may expend one of your readied strikes and make a melee attack against an opponent. if it hits, deal weapon damage as normal and the target must succeed at a will save (dc 10 + 1/2 your character level + your highest initiation modifier) or become incorporeal for one round. the target can no longer grasp their weapons (unless they could be wielded by incorporeal creatures) but their other equipment remains on their body without becoming incorporeal, effectively rendering them incapable of using any items that do not have the ghost touch property or an equivalent effect. this is a supernatural ability.

name: Venemous Strike (Combat)
description: A poisonous sting accompanies your attacks.
prerequisites: nature magicacg or the ability to cast druid or ranger spells; vital strike, knowledge (nature) 5 ranks.
benefits: you can use this a number of times per day equal to your wisdom modifier (minimum 1). you can choose to use this ability as a free action after you hit the enemy with the attack. this is a supernatural ability.

name: Venomous Maw
description: You possess venom that you can use to incapacitate foes. Araenae Venom Price N/A; Weight  Type contact, injury; Save Fortitude DC (10 + 1/2 Level + Constitution mod + 2) Frequency 1/round for 6 rounds Effect 1d3 Dexterity damage Cure 1 save Araenae Venom (Unchained) Price N/A; Weight  Type poison, contact, injury; Save Fortitude DC (10 + 1/2 Level + Constitution mod + 2) Track Dexterity (special); Frequency 1/round for 6 rounds Effect SluggishStiffenedStaggeredImmobileImmobile; the second Immobile is an end state Cure 1 save
benefits: you possess a dangerous toxin known as araenae venom that is delivered by your bite attacks. alternatively, you can coat one of your weapons in your venom a number of times per day equal to your constitution modifier +  your character level (minimum 1) as a swift action. you are never at risk of poisoning yourself with your venom, and are immune to the effects of araenae venom. this venom is highly volatile with air, oxidizing and becoming inert after 1 minute if not used to attack a creature. this volatility also makes it worthless to sell or store.

name: Victorious Recovery
description: You learn how to use victory over a foe to your advantage, repositioning yourself and recovering a martial maneuver.
benefits: once per encounter, you may recover maneuvers equal to your initiator modifier when you reduce an opponent to zero or less hit points.

name: Vortex Rush
description: You trace paths of elemental fury across the battlefield.
prerequisites: two elemental flux maneuvers known, two fools errand maneuvers known.
benefits: while you maintain an elemental flux stance, whenever you move as part of a maneuver or combat maneuver, or force creatures to move as part of a maneuver or combat maneuver (including when dragging a locked creature), you and those creatures leave behind a trail of energy in every square exited during the movement. creatures entering or passing through a trail takes points of damage equal to your initiation modifier of your active element's associated energy type. a creature can only take this damage once per action; for example, if a creature moved (or was dragged) across a trail multiple times in the same action, they would only take the damage once. each trail you create with this feat is considered to be part of the same trail for the purposes of damaging creatures multiple times, and your trails vanish one round after you make them. you do not take damage from your own trails, and may suppress or resume this ability as a free action. this is a supernatural ability.

name: Warriors Focus
description: You have mastered a subdivision within your psyche that thinks only of battle.
prerequisites: must possess the warriors path class feature.
benefits: you gain an additional psionic focus, a special type dedicated to combat and the warriors path; this focus is gained and used exactly like the characters normal psionic focus, but may only be used to maintain or use your warriors path class feature.

name: Weaken the Prey
description: The weak crumble before your power.
prerequisites: one cursed razor, eternal guardian or steel serpent maneuver known.
benefits: cursed creatures, diseased creatures, and creatures suffering from ability damage take a 2 penalty on saving throws against your maneuvers.

name: Weapon Group Adaptation
description: You specialize in a specific family of weaponry, adapting many techniques to suit them.
prerequisites: special you can take this feat multiple times. each time you take the feat, you choose a different weapon group to gain its benefits for. in addition, once you reach base attack bonus +5, this feat counts as the weapon training class feature with the chosen fighter weapon group for the purpose of weapon mastery feat and what weapons you can use with weapon mastery feats.
benefits: choose a weapon group (excluding siege weapons and siege firearms). that weapon group is considered associated with disciplines you have access to.

name: Web Expertise
description: You have gained further expertise in using your webs.
benefits: additionally, you gain the following with your webs

name: Winds of War
description: Those you have Claimed cannot hide, and now they can no longer even run.
benefits: you gain a +5-foot bonus to each of your movement speeds. this bonus increases by +5 feet for each creature you currently have claimed.

name: Wooden Form
description: Your body is one of dense hardwood rather than stone. The armor bonus granted by your Stone body trait is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 0), but your base land speed is increased by 10 feet, you are treated as unarmored for the purposes of effects and abilities, and you gain a +5 racial bonus on Stealth checks while in undergrowth, forests, jungles, marshes and swamps. This bonus is doubled if you make a Stealth check and only move 5 or fewer feet in any given round. You also weigh half as much as a normal mossling with a stone body of your wooden bodys size.
prerequisites: special unlike most feats, this feat must be taken at first level during character creation and can never be retrained. you cannot select both this feat and the adamantine ore, mithral ore or necrofrom mossling feats. additionally, this feat may be selected as a bonus feat by any class who gains a bonus feat of your choice at 1st level, even if it doesnt normally meet the for those feats (such as a monks bonus feat).
benefits: your body is formed around a fallen log or stump made of dense hardwood rather than a boulder. your wooden body reduces your durability slightly, but increases your mobility and your ability to hide in your forested home.

name: Wrack and Ruin
description: You leave your cursed victims bleeding and torn.
benefits: your attacks against cursed creatures deal additional bleed damage equal to your wisdom modifier.

name: Greater Planar Infusion
description: You have mastered the powers of another plane.
prerequisites: improved planar infusion, planar infusion, character level 13th.
benefits: choose a plane for which youve gained an improved infusion via improved planar infusion. you gain that planes greater infusion as well.

name: Improved Planar Infusion
description: Your connection to the planes has grown stronger.
benefits: choose a plane youve gained an infusion from via planar infusion. you now gain that planes improved infusion as well.

name: Planar Infusion
description: After enduring hardship on another plane, your body, mind, and soul have become infused with that planes power. Planar infusions that take actions to activate are supernatural abilities unless they specifically allow for the use of a spell, in which case they are spell-like abilities. Your caster level for spell-like abilities granted by a planar infusion is equal to your Hit Dice (maximum CL 20th). All other planar infusions are extraordinary abilities. Special You can take this feat multiple times. Each time you do, you must select another plane for which you qualify. In cases where the specific effects of Planar Infusion are identical, the effects do not stack. Basic The drifting vapors of the Stairway shroud and protect you. You gain a +1 bonus on Fortitude saves, a +2 bonus on CMD against being restrained or removed from combat, and a +2 bonus on Stealth skill check where vapors are not out of place (GMs discretion). When you gather surging essence, you gain an additional point of temporary essence. Improved You can call the Mist from the Cloud Stairway as a swift action a number of times per day equal to your highest Mental Ability Score modifier. This grants you 1 temporary essence which you may immediately invest as part of the action (and reallocate other essence as usual) and concealment in the space you occupy for 1 round. While in this mist, you may make Stealth checks as though unobserved. Greater You have learned to take into your being the essence of the Mist. You gain 1 point of essence. You may take essence burn to activate the following spell-like abilities undetectable alignment (2 essence burn), monstrous physique I (3 essence burn), monstrous physique II (3 essence burn), and monstrous physique III (4 essence burn). You caster level for these abilities is equal to your character level. Basic The essence of the Dark Shogunate has seeped into your being. You are granted a measure of the dark, silent cold of the Realm. Every time you inflict cold damage to a living creature you may gain 1 temporary essence for 1 minute from this infusion if you do not already have any. You may invest essence in this Planar Infusion feat. For each essence you do you gain a +1 insight bonus to Stealth and 1 point of resistance to cold damage. As long as you have at least one point of essence invested in this feat you are protected against environmental cold in a manner similar to an endure elements. Improved You carry the stain of Izanamis tears within your flesh. You may inflict a special version of contagion as a spell-like ability once per day. You may inflict this contagion through any effect or ability that deals cold damage. Creatures failing against the afflicted disease and allies around them suffer a -1 morale penalty to saving throws, AC, attack rolls, and damage. This penalty increases at 10th level and every 5 levels there after to a maximum of -4 at 20th level. If the creature fails its save and contracts a disease, you gain 2 temporary essence for 1 minute. Essence gained from this ability stacks with other sources of temporary essence (including other infusions). It is a supernatural ability and an [emotion] effect. Greater You weep dark tears of ultimate sorrow and loss once per day as a standard action. Enemy creatures near you treat this as a though your shed tears were a symbol of weakness. You gain up to 1 temporary essence plus 1 additional temporary essence for each creature that takes Strength damage from this ability, to a maximum of 5 temporary essence. Temporary essence lasts for 1 minute. Additionally, once per day you may as an immediate action take 5 points of essence burn to cause the tears to trigger a symbol of death effect on any creature still is suffering Strength damage from the tears original effect. Basic The Kingdoms perspectives of adaptation and balance have become your own. You gain a +1 bonus on Will saves, a +1 bonus on Diplomacy checks for each step a creatures alignment differs from your own. Diplomacy also becomes a class skill if it is not already. When on a non-Neutral plane you gain 1 essence. Improved You have learned to mitigate the powers of extremes. After meditating on the principles of Balance for 1 hour, you are protected by the Kingdom. Against any attack from a creature with a single neutral alignment component you gain DR 5/- and 5 resistance to acid, cold, electricity, and fire. Against the attacks of creatures with no neutral alignment component these resistances and damage reduction increase to 10. The first time in a day this ability prevents damage from a specific creature you gain 1 temporary essence for 1 minute. This ability may prevent up to 10 points of damage per hit die. Basic The calm of the Interdiction of the Quiet Lands has become part of you. You gain a +1 bonus on saves, effects from creatures with an alignment type [other than the optional Neutral subtype], a +2 bonus on CMD against being bull-rushed or repositioned, and a +2 bonus on a skill check of your choice between Autohypnosis, Perception, or Sense Motive. Whenever you successfully save against an aligned effect, if you have no temporary essence from this infusion you gain 1 point of temporary essence for 1 minute. Improved You are moving into true alignment with the energies of the Quiet Lands. When drawing in essence from crystallized essence you gain 1 additional point of temporary essence (with the same descriptors as the crystal. While investing temporary essence from crystallized essence into a class ability, feat, or veil you gain a +1 insight bonus to saves against [evil] or [good] effects, powers, and spells. Greater You unlock the deepest mysteries of the power of crystallized essence. You may as a standard action tap a shard of crystallized essence to shape a spell or power effect that matches the descriptor of the crystallized essence. The spell or power must be one level lower than the amount essence in the crystal. This process is not easy and requires a Knowledge (arcana) check with a DC equal to 15 + twice the level of the power or effect. Psionic powers created in this manner have manifester levels equal to the minimum required to manifest them. Basic Valhalla has awakened the spark of eternal heroism within you. You gain a +1 bonus on Fortitude saves, a +2 bonus on CMD against being restrained or removed from combat, and a +2 bonus on a skill check of your choice between Fly, Intimidate, or Perform. Improved You are imbued with the flight of the valorous. So long as you are below half your total hit points you may, as a swift action, manifest a pair of magical wings appropriate to your nature. These wings grant you the effects of overland flight for up to one hour per level each day. While the wings are active you gain 1 point of essence. Greater You rise from defeat the first time your hit points fall below 0 each day. Treat this as though a breath of life spell had just been cast on you with a caster level equal to your character level. This effect can return you to life even if you are dead under the normal rules of the spell though you are staggered for one round after returning to life in this manner. You gain 3 temporary essence for 1 minute when this ability activates.
prerequisites: benefit your body, mind, or soul gains a benefit of some sort as a result of your infusion with the plane of your choice for which you meet the . details on planar infusions can be found below.
benefits: greater you have made allies with the very winds of the kingdoms, and may ride them from one to the next. by taking 3 points of essence burn you may cast communal air walk as a spell-like ability. you may use this ability a number of times per day equal to your wisdom or highest veilweaving ability bonus. creatures ing from your communal air walk also gain a +1 insight bonus to initiative and will saves.

name: Adaptable Confluential Partnership
description: You have learned to adapt your storms to better meld with your allys.
benefits: each day when you shape your veils, you can change the [confluence] feat you have selected with confluential partnership. if you have selected that feat multiple times, you can change the [confluence] feat selected for each instance of the feat.

name: Burning Ash
description: Ash and flames mix in the sky above your storm, raining poisonous flaming death upon your foes.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the conflagration and the devastation storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the conflagration and the devastation storm veils shaped, their abilities combine to form a storm of toxic, flaming ash. when a creature is struck by the conflagration, or caught in one of its explosions, they must make a fortitude saving throw or take 1 constitution damage, plus an additional point of constitution damage per 3 essence invested in the devastation. the dc of this fortitude save is equal to the dc of the devastation. this is a poison effect. the devastation deals an additional 1d6 fire damage, plus 1d6 per 3 essence invested in the conflagration. this damage is halved if the creature succeeds on their fortitude save versus the devastation.

name: Burning Shards
description: Meteoric shards of metal fall from the sky, burning and raising all who they strike. When you shape both veils at the same time, The Shardrain gains the Fire descriptor and the shards of metal created by it are infused with burning heat. Creatures struck by one of these shards risk catching fire, as if they were struck by a ball of fire and ash created by The Conflagration. This uses The Conflagrations saving throw DC, and deals damage as per the Conflagration.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the conflagration and the shardrain storm veils.
benefits: your balls of ash and fire created by the conflagration are filled with shards of heated metal. whenever you use an ability of the conflagration, you may choose to have it deal slashing and piercing damage instead of bludgeoning damage. if you choose to, the shards gain any enhancement bonuses to attack and damage rolls granted by the shardrain. damage granted by this bonus is an increase to the veils slashing and piercing damage.

name: Bursting Blooms
description: Your storms nurture life to the extinction of all else; blooms turn toxic, plants strangling life. When you use the standard action ability of The Infestation to create a burst of spores, you can cause those spores to additionally take root upon any terrain within the burst, causing them to grow as if they were natural vegetation when determining the effects of The First Bloom. When you use the standard action ability of The Infestation, rather than creating a burst of spores you can choose to have all vegetation within the area of your storm affected by The First Bloom to release spores instead. These spores affect every creature within a space of difficult terrain created by The First Bloom, rather than in a burst. When you use the standard action ability of The First Bloom, you can cause creatures to also become infected as per The Infestation if they fail their saving throw. If the creature ends this entanglement, the infection bursts as if they took damage.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the first bloom and the infestation storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the first bloom and the infestation veils shaped, you may use the abilities of these veils in the following ways

name: Confluential Partnership
description: You have learned to work with another wielder of the storm to combine your storms into a confluence. You and your ally must both possess this feat and have chosen the same [confluence] feat using it. You and your ally must both have shaped one of the two veils required for the chosen [confluence] feat each, and must have both of the required veils shaped between the two of you. You and your ally must both be within the area of each others Storm veil. Additionally, you and your allys Storm veils treat the area of the other Storm that is part of the confluence as part of their Storm when determining its area. You and your ally must still remain within the initial area of your respective Storm veils to maintain the conditions required for this feat. Special This feat can be selected multiple times, selecting a new [confluence] feat each time it is selected.
prerequisites: while meeting those , you and your ally gain the benefits of the chosen [confluence] feat, using your storm veils statistics and essence when determining any effects related to your storm veil, and your allys storm veils statistics and essence when determining any effects related to their storm veil.
benefits: if you have multiple allies with this feat who meet the conditions to trigger a confluence, you may use the of this feat with each ally who meets the conditions at the same time. when determining the effects of the [confluence] feat you choose which allys veil you wish to use the statistics of when determining the effects of the [confluence] feat on your veil each time the effect is triggered.

name: Chilling Embrace
description: The world slows around you as the heat and life drain from everything within your storm, the calm sleep of winter taking hold.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the blizzard and the permafrost storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the blizzard and the permafrost storm veils shaped, their abilities combine to emulate the chilling embrace of a deadly winter storm. when a creature takes cold damage from the blizzard, the damage they take is increased by 1d3 cold damage per 3 essence invested in the permafrost. a creature who takes damage from the rain of icy shards of the permafrost must make a fortitude saving throw using the blizzards dc, or suffer a -2 penalty to the blizzards saving throws for 1 round, plus 1 round per 3 essence invested in the blizzard. this penalty does not stack with itself. the radius of the permafrosts cylinder increases by 5 feet per 3 essence invested in the blizzard.

name: Crystal Torrent
description: Wind begins to swirl, pulling crystalline shards from the air into cyclones of whirling, frigid death.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the crystalline and the cyclone storm veils.
benefits: when at least 3 points of essence are invested in both the crystalline and the cyclone, the storms merge in effect, carrying shards of dangerous crystal ice along with the cyclones. if a cyclone you have created enters one of your crystal pillars, or if you create a crystal pillar on top of one of your cyclones, the pillar is picked up by the cyclone, causing it to swirl with deadly ice, destroying the pillar. a cyclone can only pick up a single crystal pillar. until the end of your next turn, you gain a +1 bonus to your cmb when making bull rushes using that cyclone, plus an additional +1 per 3 essence invested in the crystalline, and the first creature bull rushed by the affected cyclone is affected as if it triggered the crystal pillar, with a +1 increase to its saving throw dc per 3 points of essence invested in the cyclone.

name: Devastating Fallout
description: Your ash brings a lingering and invisible death upon all who it touches Penalties imposed by The Devastation persist until the creature has cured their ability damage caused by The Fallout, even if they leave the area of the storm, and the saving throw DC of each veil is increased by +1 per 3 points of essence invested in the other veil. For example; if 6 essence were invested in The Devastation and 3 in The Fallout, The Devastation would have a DC of 17 + your veilweaving modifier, and The Fallout would have a DC of 15 + your veilweaving modifier. Additionally; if you have bound both The Devastation and The Fallout to your Storm chakra, not only are plants in the area of your storm diminished, the area your storm passes over is also left mildly radioactive. The area counts as Low radiation for a number of days equal to the number of points of essence invested in The Fallout. Unlike normal radiation, this radiation deals ability damage instead of drain and does not stack with ability damage caused by The Fallout.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the devastation and the fallout storm veils.
benefits: while you have both the devastation and the fallout shaped, their powers combine to devastate creatures and plants within your storms area with poison and radiation.

name: Freezing Shards
description: Frozen shards of metal hail down from the sky, chilling the flesh as it cuts to bone. When you shape both veils at the same time, The Shardrain gains the Cold descriptor and the shards of metal created by it are infused with freezing cold. Creatures struck by a shard must make a Fortitude saving throw or have their flesh dangerously chilled, halving their movement speeds (minimum 5 feet) and imposing a -5 penalty on Acrobatics checks. Each round at the end of their turn they make a new Fortitude saving throw to end this penalty. These saving throws use The Permafrosts saving throw DC. If you strike a creature already under the effects of this ability with your supercooled shards they do not make additional saves, they instead take a number of additional points of cold damage on a successful hit equal twice the number of points of essence invested in The Permafrost.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the permafrost and the shardrain storm veils.
benefits: your shards of ice created by the permafrost are laced with fine shards of supercooled metal. whenever you use an ability of the permafrost, you can choose to have any piercing damage it deals to count as both piercing and slashing damage. if you choose to, the shards gain any enhancement bonuses to damage rolls granted by the shardrain, and the initial saving throw dc to avoid being damaged by the shards increases by +1 per 2 points of essence invested in the shardrain. damage granted by this bonus is an increase to the veils slashing and piercing damage.

name: Frigid Fog
description: Fog swirls amidst chilling air, freezing those it touches in place.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the enshrouding and the rime storm veils.
benefits: for every 3 points of essence invested in the enshrouding, the cold damage dealt and temporary hit points granted by the rime increase by 2. when you have at least 3 points of essence invested in the rime, the fog created by the enshrouding becomes bitterly cold, quickly freezing creatures in its area. whenever a creature ends their turn in the area of the storm, they gain a +1 natural armor bonus to their ac per 3 essence invested in the rime (this ac stacks with other sources of natural armor), and must make a reflex saving throw using the enshrouding to determine its dc. on a failed saving throw the affected creature is frozen in place, becoming entangled and rooted to the floor until the end of their next turn. if the creature was airborne, swimming, or not touching the ground through another means, they are entangled but not rooted to their current position. a creature with immunity to cold damage automatically passes this saving throw, and a creature with resistance to cold damage gains a +1 bonus to their saving throw for every 5 points of cold resistance they possess.

name: Healing Deluge
description: Your mastery over the healing aspects of water has allowed your deluge of rain to wash the injuries from your foes. If you have bound both of these veils to your Storm chakra, whenever you grant a creature temporary hit points using The Deluge, you can burn a point of essence invested in either The Cleansing Rain or The Deluge to allow that creature to make a new saving throw against an effect they are suffering from, as per The Cleansing Rains bind effect. If you wish to allow multiple creatures to reroll a saving throw, you must take a point of essence burn for each creature.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the cleansing rain and the deluge storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the cleansing rain and the deluge veils shaped, for every hour a creature spends within the effects of the cleansing rain they are healed 1d6 hit points, plus an additional 1d6 hit points for every point of essence invested in the deluge.

name: Inverse Coalescence
description: Dark meets light, positive blends with negative. The very forces of life and death buckle at your command. Additionally while both veils are shaped, whenever a creature is affected by the standard action ability of either veil you may choose whether you affect them as if they were being affected by your choice of those two veils. For example; if you target four creatures you could choose to treat two as if they were affected by The Gleaming and two as if they were affected by The Gloaming (or any combination of those two veils). When doing so, you use the veil invested with the most essence when determining the effects of both veils. For every 3 points of essence invested in the lesser-invested veil, calculate the healing and damage done by the effect as if the greater-invested veil were invested with one additional point of essence. If both veils are invested with the same amount of essence, choose which counts as the greater-invested veil and which counts as the lesser. If you have the ability to bind veils to your Storm chakra, at the end of your turn you may choose to affect each creature in the area of your veils with either the effects of The Gloaming, the effects of The Gleaming, or both. Your choice applies to each creature in the area. Each veil uses its own invested essence when determining its effects.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the gloaming and the gleaming storm veils.
benefits: while you have both the gloaming and the gleaming shaped, at the beginning of each your turns you may choose whether to reduce the light level (as per the gloaming), raise the light level (as per the gleaming), or neither raise nor lower the light level in the area of your storm.

name: Maelstrom Gale
description: Your storm is the meeting of sky and sea, death to all who enter it.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the tempest and the vortex storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the tempest and the vortex storm veils shaped, their effects combine and empower each other. you may cause and control currents as you would winds, changing their direction in straight lines. you may also control winds as you would currents, allowing you to spin them clockwise or counterclockwise. creatures you bull rush take damage as though they were battered by the waters of the vortex, and you may bull rush creatures even while underwater. you may treat the vortex as though it did not have the seastorm descriptor when resolving its effects, allowing you to use it above water by battering creatures with wind. if you have the vortex bound to your storm chakra, you can form a tornado, waterspout, hurricane, etc above water and cause creatures and objects trapped within to be thrown upwards instead of down. they take fall damage as normal when landing. houses and other large structures count as ships for the purpose of how they are affected, and may be protected by weatherproofing as a ship would be.

name: Rain of Rot
description: Rotting flesh begins to fall from the sky like rain, quickly decaying all that it falls upon. Damage dealt by The Corrosion now ignores all forms of damage reduction and resistance, and deals double damage to corporeal undead as it quickly rots away their already decaying flesh. Additionally, the damage dealt by The Putrefaction now counts as acid damage for the purposes of your abilities that modify or enhance acid damage, and for the purposes of acid vulnerability (it still ignores damage reduction and resistances). As a standard action, you can cause a puddle of this rotting rain to form upon terrain in a 10-foot radius burst within your storm. This puddle counts as difficult terrain, persists for 1 round + 1 round per 3 points of essence invested in The Corrosion, and any creature who ends their turn inside the puddle of rot must make a Fortitude save or suffer the effects of the standard-action ability of The Putrefaction. The DC of this saving throw is equal to the saving throw DC of The Putrefaction. Additionally, for every 3 points of essence invested in The Corrosion you may increase the radius of the puddle of rot by 5 feet. If an area of this puddle leaves the storm, that area of the puddle immediately dissipates.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the corrosion and the putrefaction storm veils.
benefits: while you have both the corrosion and the putrefaction shaped, their effects combine to form a rain of rotting flesh which quickly erodes all that it touches.

name: Scouring Maelstrom
description: Your storm is a roaring maelstrom of sand and wind, the deserts wrath manifest to scour the world. Siege Weapon Penalty
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the scouring and the tempest storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the scouring and the tempest storm veils shaped, their winds combine to form a maelstrom of rending sand. the scouring sand of the scouring is accelerated by the confluences devastating winds, dealing an additional point of damage per point of essence invested in the tempest. the wind of the tempest is accompanied by rending sands, empowering it. successful bull rushes made using the veil deal damage to the target as if they were struck by the scourings scouring sands, and the effects of the tempests wind speed are empowered, as per table scouring maelstrom wind penalties.

name: Shocking Exultation
description: Lightning and thunder arc and boom all around you, the world becoming a devastating onslaught of sound and light.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the fulmination and the uproar storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the fulmination and the uproar storm veils shaped, their abilities combine to form a devastating storm of thunder and lightning. the lightning of the fulmination is accompanied by a clap of damaging thunder, dealing an additional 1d4 sonic damage per 3 essence invested in the uproar, halved on a successful fortitude saving throw using the uproars dc. a creature who fails this fortitude save is dazzled and takes a -2 penalty to the uproars saving throws for 1 round, plus 1 round per 3 essence invested in the uproar. this penalty does not stack with itself. the thunderous bursts of the uproar are accompanied by a flash of lightning, dealing an additional 1d6 electricity damage per 3 essence invested in the fulmination, halved on a successful reflex saving throw against the fulminations dc. a creature who fails this reflex save is dazzled and takes a -2 penalty to the fulminations saving throws for 1 round, plus 1 round per 3 essence invested in the fulmination. this penalty does not stack with itself.

name: The Cold Dark
description: Where shadows of calm meet, the cold dark comes to draw the living into a cold, dark sleep.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the quelling and the stillness storm veils.
benefits: when at least 3 points of essence are invested in both the quelling and the stillness, the two storms merge in effect and inflict intense drowsiness upon all who remain within their area. creatures who fail their saving throw against the stillness begin to grow drowsy, falling asleep at the end of their next turn if they dont escape the area of the storm. affected creatures remain asleep until another creature shakes them awake as a standard action, they take damage, or they end their turn outside of the area of the storm. the hit dice of creatures that can be affected by this effect is determined by the amount of essence invested in the quelling, and their current status. creatures of 2 hit dice or fewer per essence invested in the quelling are affected if they are fatigued, creatures of 3 hit dice or fewer per essence invested in the quelling are affected if they are exhausted, creatures of 4 hit dice or fewer per essence invested in the quelling are affected if they are exhausted and staggered, and creatures of any number of hit dice are affected if the creature is exhausted, staggered, and helpless. this is a mind-affecting sleep effect.

name: Thundersnow
description: Bolts of lightning strike chaotically within the blinding snow, rendering the world in harsh shadows and bright flashes.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the blizzard and the fulmination storm veils.
benefits: when at least 3 points of essence are invested in the blizzard, the bolts of lightning created by the fulmination are shrouded by the blinding snow and darkened sky, causing spots of light and blindness in the vision of those affected. creatures struck by these bolts are dazzled for 1 round per 3 points of essence invested in the blizzard on a failed saving throw, or for 1 round on a successful save. a dazzled creature who fails their saving throw is instead blinded until the end of your next turn, or until the beginning of their next turn on a successful saving throw. when at least 3 points of essence are invested in the fulmination, the freezing snow of the blizzard becomes charged with ozone, causing creatures in the area of the storm to take a -1 penalty to saving throws and ac against electricity effects per 3 essence invested in the blizzard.

name: Torrential Flood
description: A deluge of rain bolsters the floods you command, causing their waves to reach new heights and drown even those who thought themselves out of harms way. As a move action you can cause the might of both of your storms to surge, doubling the height of The Flash Floods water until the end of your next turn. Multiple usages of this ability do not stack, activating it again while it is already active instead resets its duration.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the deluge and the flash flood veils.
benefits: when determining the height of the water created by the flash flood, add the number of points of essence invested in the deluge.

name: Winds of Flame
description: You have gained total mastery over the forces of wind and heat, your Storm laying destruction upon the world around you. The DC of The Siroccos saving throw is increased by 1 per 3 essence invested in The Cyclone. In addition, if a creature fails this saving throw it takes an additional 1d6 points of bludgeoning damage, and is pushed 5 feet in a direction of your choice per 3 essence invested in The Cyclone.
prerequisites: ability to shape two or more storm veils, ability to shape the cyclone and the sirocco storm veils.
benefits: when you have both the cyclone and the sirocco storm veils shaped, your storm becomes a cyclonic whirlwind of heat and fury. when a creature is successfully bull rushed by the cyclone the creature takes an additional 1d6 fire damage and is pushed an additional 5 feet per 3 essence invested in the sirocco. the fire damage dealt by the cyclone is dealt to any flammable objects and terrain the cyclone passes over, potentially causing particularly flammable objects to catch fire. if a creature fails its strength check against the cyclone, they take an additional 1d6 fire damage and are flung an additional 10 feet per essence invested in the sirocco.

name: Ability Focus (Malefactions)
description: You have a knack for potent, complex curses.
benefits: increase the dc of your malefactions by 2.

name: Additional Invincibility
description: Your armor sheds the mightiest blows. Special You can select this feat multiple times, each time gaining an additional use of your armored invincibility class feature.
benefits: you gain an additional use of your armored invincibility class feature.

name: Additional Shadow
description: Your shadows flow from your inner power.
benefits: whenever you use your shadow copy class feature, you create an additional shadow copy.

name: An Insult Knows No Bounds
description: Warning This character contains strong language that may be unsuitable for anybody.
benefits: your magical insults can affect creatures who cannot normally be affected by your insults. this includes things like deaf creatures, mindless creatures, etc. a creature must still be able to be affected by the resulting condition or effect imposed on them by the insult.

name: Anathematic Hand
description: The mere touch of your divine arm is enough to make your foes squirm.
benefits: when your divine arm is active, creatures you touch with an alignment opposed by your divine arm binding must make a will save (dc 10 + 1/2 godhand level + charisma modifier). if they fail, the creature suffers a mild superficial burn, and you become aware of that alignment component of the creature (for example, if you had a good-aligned arm, you would realize the creature you touched is evil, but not know if they are lawful, neutral or chaotic evil). this functions as a supernatural detect evil/good spell effect, and effects that block such spells, like an undetectable alignment spell, also block this ability.

name: Animal Focus
description: Your animal spells are more potent than most.
benefits: add +1 to the difficulty class for all saving throws against spells you cast that have the animal descriptor.

name: Animal Spirit
description: You allow your spirit to guide you rather than your wisdom.
benefits: you use your charisma to determine any shifter class feature which would normally use your wisdom to determine its effects, such as defensive instinct. in addition, you may apply your charisma modifier to your will saving throws instead of your wisdom modifier, up to a limit equal to your shifter level.

name: Arcane Veil
description: You can convert any spell into an invisible veil.
prerequisites: spell focus (illusion), arcane spellcaster, caster level 9th
benefits: as a standard action, you can sacrifice a prepared spell or unused spell slot of 1st level or higher and transform it into a transparent veil, granting yourself invisibility, as the spell. this invisibility lasts for 1 minute for every level of the spell or spell slot you sacrificed. once the invisibility ends (for any reason), you cannot use this feat again for 1 minute.

name: Arcing Chains
description: The primary target of a chained power takes extra damage for each subsequent target who takes damage.
benefits: when using the chain power feat, the chains create an arcing feedback loop, which means that for every secondary chain target that is damaged, the original target takes additional damage equal to the minimum damage the original power could cause (for example, an acid energy ray that would deal 5d6 acid damage would deal 5 acid damage to the original target for each secondary target).

name: Astrology
description: You have come to understand that the workings of the universe and even the capricious machinations of the gods can all be divined from the motions of the heavens. If you can cast psychic spells or have the Psychic Sensitivity feat, you can use prognostication one additional time per day. Spending 1 minute consulting a star chart or cosmogram that is accurate for the world or plane you are currently on, prior to attempting a Sense Motive check, grants you a +2 insight bonus on the check. Special A zodiac, or a path of the mage vizier, can expend uses of their stargazing or personal astrarium ability to use prognostication an additional time per day.
prerequisites: knowledge (geography) 3 ranks and sense motive 3 ranks, or the ability to manifest at least 1 constellation and sense motive 3 ranks.
benefits: you can perform the prognostication occult skill unlock even if you cant use psychic magic, though you must employ this occult skill unlock via horoscopy. with a dc 10 + creature's hit die prognostication task you can determine the astrological conditions at the time of a creature's birth. this can allow you to ascertain information about a creature that is based on those astrological conditions such as a creature's date of birth or the they would receive from the auspicious birth feat. this task follows the normal rules for the prognostication occult skill unlock.

name: Augmented Elements
description: You have the spark of psionic power, allowing you to broaden your elemental abilities.
benefits: you learn a simple blast from any element (including your primary element, if there is another blast for you to choose). unless you later gain access to this blast through another method, you increase its burn cost by 1 whenever you use it. in addition, you gain the psionic subtype, allowing you to take psionic feats, metapsionic feats, and psionic item creation feats. if you do not have your primary elements basic utility talent (for example, if you have traded it away with an archetype), you also gain that wild talent.

name: Autonomous
description: You have a knack for psionic self-sufficiency. Your self-sufficiency is exemplary.
benefits: the bonus on autohypnosis and knowledge (psionics) skill checks from autonomous increases by 2. in addition, you can expend one use of mythic power to treat an autohypnosis or knowledge (psionics) check as if you had rolled a natural 20. you must decide to use this ability before making the roll.

name: Bad Romance
description: Creatures who are subject to your feel the love compulsion will suffer for their love.
benefits: creatures who are subject to your feel the love compulsion only determine the target of their affection from your visible allies. furthermore, the compulsion is not broken prematurely if the target of the compelled creatures affections acts hostile towards them.

name: Band Battle
description: Your glorious sound permits no other noise to be heard.
benefits: you and all allies within 30 feet of you reduce sonic damage by the minimum damage of your rock-out class feature if you have used your rock-out or solo class feature within the last 3 rounds.

name: Basic Alteration
description: You are in touch with more basic forms.
prerequisites: shifter shape, dragon shape, fairy shape, giant shape, mimic shape, or necro shape class feature.
benefits: you can take the form of a small or medium humanoid with your shifter shape or other listed class feature. while taking the form of a humanoid, this ability functions as alter self. in addition, you can speak regardless of which form you take with shifter shape or other listed class features.

name: Bestial Roots
description: Despite your alternative route to power, you can still tap into the power of animals. Special This feat does not allow you to take the form of magical beasts.
prerequisites: benefit you may use the abilities to transform into animals as though you had the shifter shape class feature.

name: Biomech Pilot
description: Your mech incorporates many biological parts, offering it versatility not seen in other machines. The following mech enhancements can be selected by a mech pilot with this feat in addition to regular mech enhancements Special If you possess this feat as well as the ability to craft constructs, you may craft constructs with the biomech template and create mechs that use the mech enhancements listed above.
prerequisites: knowledge (nature) 1 rank, bonded mech/vessel or ability to craft a mech
benefits: your mech is at least partially biological, if not completely so, and as a result has access to many additional abilities. such entities are known as biomechs and possess the biomech template.

name: Black Market Dealings
description: You walk dark alleys and trade in secrets.
benefits: in addition, you can use the diplomacy skill to locate merchants who have deeper pockets in a black market or settlement. if you are looking inside a black market, the dc is equal to the black markets access dc. if you are looking more widely in a settlement, use the black markets access dc + 5 (if a settlement has no black market, the dc is 30; pcs can apply the settlements crime modifier to their checks). if successful, you can treat the black market or settlement as one step larger for the purposes of base value, items available, and purchase limit. if the settlement was already a metropolis, nearly all minor and medium magic items are for sale, as well as 3d8 major magic items; the base value is 32,000 gp; and the purchase limit is 200,000 gp. if the black market was already an underworld, nearly all minor and medium magic items are for sale, as well as 4d8 major magic items; the base value is 64,000 gp; and the purchase limit is 300,000 gp. this does not stack with other ways to increase the effective size of a black market or settlement (such as the black market connections rogue talent). you can attempt this check only once per week.

name: Blade of Terror
description: You have learned to blend the fearsome arts of the dread with your mind blade.
prerequisites: ability to generate a mind blade, knowledge of one blade skill and one terror
benefits: you may use your mind blade to deliver your terrors as if you had used your devastating touch, and you may add half your soulknife level (rounded down) to your dread level to determine saving throws for your terrors. additionally, anytime you successfully use a fear effect (either through a terror or a manifested power) you may regain your psychic strike as a free action once per round.

name: Blinding Flare (feat)
description: Your flaring powers are blinding.
benefits: when using the flaring power feat, all targets that are affected are blinded the first round instead of dazzled.

name: Blood Knowledge
description: You have the ability to extract knowledge from the blood you consume.
prerequisites: special if you possess the vampire template you can select this feat as vampiric power. additionally, dhampir with the blood drinker feat are treated as vampires for the purposes of this feats .
benefits: by drinking at least a pint of an intelligent creatures blood, or similar vital fluid, you can extract its memories. at any point within 24 hours of imbibing the creatures blood you can attempt a diplomacy or intimidation check to extract information from the traces of that creatures soul in your blood. the base dc of this check is 20 + creatures charisma modifier. this check is modified as follows simple information (-5), unimportant secrets (+5), valuable secrets (+10 or more based on gm discretion). the information gained is limited by the creatures knowledge at the time the blood was taken and what they believed to be true. the dc also increases by +5 each time you attempt this check against a given creatures blood. after 24 yours the traces of the creature's soul vanish entirely. this ability is supernatural a necromancy effect with the evil and death descriptors.

name: Blood Scion
description: Your dark martial prowess feeds your insatiable hunger
prerequisites: cruomancer level 1, two manuevers from black seraph, leaden hyena, or unquiet grave
benefits: your levels in initiator classes that provide access to a qualifying maneuver count as cruomancer levels and increase blood powers and feats accordingly.

name: Blood Sovereignty
description: Your killing blows reap a sanguine harvest
benefits: whenever you drop a foe beneath 0 hit points that has an active dark claim, siphon, or bleed damage inflicted by you, you gain 1 blood point. the same is true whenever you drop a foe to 0 hit points with a maneuver from black seraph , leaden hyena, or unquiet grave. you cant gain more than one blood point per creature in this way, even if they if more than one of these effects apply.

name: Blush of Life
description: You have learned to hide the signs of your undeath. Normal Undead always detect as evil when subjected to the detect evil spell.
benefits: you lose the shadowless racial trait. additionally, you detect as your actual alignment when subjected to the detect evil spell or similar abilities (unless you have another ability that would alter how you are detected), and knowledge (religion) checks made to identify you as undead or discern your vampiric nature suffer a -4 penalty.

name: Bonded Expert
benefits: you gain an additional use of your bonded armors ability to summon itself, and your anima gains an additional use of teleport anima.

name: Boon Phantom
description: Your phantoms connection with you is exceptionally strong.
benefits: the abilities of your phantom are calculated as though your class were 4 levels higher, to a maximum effective spiritualist level equal to your character level.

name: Bramble Caster
description: Plants you magically command grow thick with bark and thorns, piercing enemy defenses.
benefits: when you cast a spell with the plant descriptor that deals slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage, it counts as magic for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. at caster level 10th, the spell also counts as silver and cold iron. at caster level 15th, it counts as adamantine. this is in addition to any other damage types the spell counts as to overcome damage reduction.

name: Plant Focus
description: Your plant spells are more potent than most.
benefits: add +1 to the difficulty class for all saving throws against spells you cast that have the plant descriptor.

name: Careless Burrowing
description: You can make a best guess to use a burrowing power, but with mixed results.
benefits: you can choose to use the burrowing power feat even though you cant see the target, instead choosing to affect a target in the square behind the barrier. however, the power has a 50% miss chance when used carelessly.

name: Chain Reaction
description: Your spatial distortions can affect additional targets.
benefits: when you use a distortion with a level requirement of 8th level or lower that targets a single creature (such as decaying bolt), you can choose another creature within 30 feet of the first target to also be targeted by the effect. if the distortion normally only targets you (such as fade), the second target must be a willing creature within 30 feet of you. you must pay double the distortionss quintessence cost to do so, or triple the cost if the distortion normally only affects you.

name: Shaper
description: Beneath the expanses of the multiverse lies an infinite realm of nothingness. A vast gulf of entropy, all planes are connected to and shaped by the null space between realms, a place defined not by its existence but lack thereof. Reaching into this boundary between creation and destruction is usually beyond mortal ability, but it is possible to breach it. Whether born from a desire to mold the world as they see fit, planar experimentation gone awry, or even an otherworldly presence within their soul, a rare few can grasp the darkness between worlds. Called shapers, these warriors manipulate the void to control the battlefield, unleashing planar force that consumes all that would stand in their way. Role A shaper is an arcane warrior that uses reality-bending magic to hinder their foes and protect their allies. They work best in the thick of a fight, unleashing entropic distortions to ravage opponents while warping space to defend themselves. Alignment Any Hit Die d10 Starting Age Trained Starting Wealth 5d6  10 gp (average 175 gp). In addition, each character begins play with an outfit worth 10 gp or less. CLASS SKILLS The shapers class skills are Acrobatics (Dex), Climb (Str), Craft (Int), Escape Artist (Dex), Fly (Dex), Intimidate (Cha), Knowledge (arcana) (Int), Knowledge (planes) (Int), Perception (Wis), Profession (Wis), Spellcraft (Int), Stealth (Dex), and Use Magic Device (Cha). Skill Ranks Per Level 4 + Int modifier. All of the following are class features of the shaper. Shapers are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, with all types of armor (heavy, medium, and light), and with shields (except tower shields). A shaper can cast shaper spells while wearing armor and using a shield without incurring the normal arcane spell failure chance. A multiclass shaper still incurs the normal arcane spell failure chance for arcane spells received from other classes.
