Any damage dealt by the spell counts as both magic and silver for the purposes of overcoming damage reduction (in addition to its listed types). At 10th caster level, it is also considered cold iron. At 15th caster level, it is also considered adamantine. A metallic spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spells actual level.
benefits: only spells that deal slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage can be affected by this feat.

name: Reinforced Spell (Metamagic)
description: Your artifice is more refined and resistant to damage. Any created object or barrier (such as a wall of iron or a weapon created by conjure weapon) has its hardness increased by 5 and its hit points increased by 50%. Any item created by the spell is considered masterwork, if a masterwork equivalent exists for that item (subject to GM discretion). A reinforced spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spells actual level.
benefits: only spells that create one or more objects, barriers, or structures that have hit points can be affected by this feat.

name: Transcendent Spell
description: Your magical abilities replicate the strange techniques of psionics Level Increase +2 (a Transcendent spell uses up a spell slot two levels higher than the spells actual level.)
benefits: the spell cast using this feat is treated as a psionic power of no particular discipline for all purposes (feats, class abilities area effects, power resistance, etc.). this does not allow metapsionic feats to be applied to the spell.

name: Twilight Spell (Metamagic)
description: Light and darkness spells you create are more intense. A twilight spell is treated as being four levels higher for the purposes of countering, dispelling, or suppressing other spells with the light or darkness descriptor. For example, a daylight spell modified by this feat is treated as a 7th-level spell for interacting with darkness effects, and can automatically counter or dispel a spell with the darkness descriptor of 7th level or lower. Additionally, if the spell raises or lowers the light level in an area, it is lowered or raised by an additional step in the same direction (i.e. a darkness effect would lower the light level by two steps, instead of one). This does not allow a spell to create magical darkness unless it could already do so. A twilight spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spells actual level.
benefits: you can only apply this metamagic to a spell with the light or darkness descriptor.

name: Volcanic Spell (Metamagic)
description: Your spells are comprised of molten stone. A volcanic spell conjures lava to harm its targets, causing its damage to become half fire and half bludgeoning. If a target fails its saving throw against the spell it is covered is lava, taking fire damage equal to double the spells level for 1d3 rounds. This effect is only applied on the first failed saving throw against the spell, not any subsequent failed saves. If the spell didnt offer a saving throw, the target can make a Reflex save to avoid this effect. A volcanic spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spells actual level.
benefits: you can only apply this metamagic to a spell with the earth or fire descriptor that deals damage.

name: Admixed Power
description: You can combine energy types in your powers.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when you manifest a power that deals cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage using this feat, choose an additional energy type. the power counts as being both energy types and only the lowest resistance works against the admixed power. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Bulwark Power
description: You manifest a personal power so that it takes effect at a later time.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you manifest a personal psionic power that instead of triggering immediately, instead triggers the next time you are attacked (someone makes a successful attack roll, or you fail a saving throw). using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Burning Power
description: You cause creatures to take extra damage when you affect them with a power that has the acid or fire descriptor. Powers that do not deal fire or acid damage cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. the acid or fire effects of the affected power adhere to the creature, causing more damage the next round. when a creature takes acid or fire damage from the affected power, that creature takes damage equal to 2  the powers level at the start of its next turn. the damage is acid or fire, as determined by the powers descriptor. if a burning power has both the fire and acid descriptor, the manifester chooses what kind of damage is dealt by the burning power effect. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Burrowing Power
description: Your powers sometimes bypass barriers. If a power requires line of sight (which includes most powers that affect a target or targets instead of an area), you cannot manifest it as a burrowing power unless you can somehow see the target, such as with clairvoyant sense. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can attempt to manifest your powers against targets that are sheltered behind a wall or force effect. your power briefly skips through the astral plane to bypass the barrier.

name: Chain Power
description: You can manifest powers that arc to hit other targets in addition to the primary target. Each target gets to make a saving throw, if one is allowed by the power. You choose secondary targets as you like, but they must all be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once. You can choose to affect fewer secondary targets than the maximum (to avoid allies in the area, for example). Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 6. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can chain any power that affects a single target and that deals either acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. after the primary target is struck, the power can arc to a number of secondary targets equal to your manifester level (maximum twenty). the secondary arcs each strike one target and deal half as much damage as the primary one did (round down).

name: Cleaving Power
description: You know how to enhance your powers with a foes pain, blowing through them into another target.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. if any creatures are reduced to 0 or fewer hit points (or 0 or fewer points in one of its ability scores) by the affected power, choose one additional creature within 30 feet of your victim; that creature suffers the effects of the affected power (including but not limited to any augmentations or additional metapsionic feats). the second creature must be a legal target for the power, and is still entitled to power resistance and/or a saving throw, as the power allows. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. only powers with one or more specific targets may be modified by this feat.

name: Composite Power
description: You can fuse elements together.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can mix a second element into any power that deals cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. choose one other energy type from that list; half of the powers damage is that element rather than its normal type. if the power has additional effects based on the type of damage it deals, then both the effect of the original element and the effect of the second element are applied to the targets. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Concussive Power
description: You cause creatures to be disoriented when you affect them with a power that has the sonic descriptor. A concussive power causes creatures that take damage from a power that has the sonic descriptor to take a 2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks for a number of rounds equal to the power level of the power. A concussive power only affects powers with the sonic descriptor. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Powers that do not deal sonic damage cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. with sonic damage comes a concussive wave of energy that rattles creatures affected by the power.

name: Contagious Power
description: Your powers are hazardous to those who would try to inhibit them Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. this feat can be applied only to targeted powers that are harmful to their target, allow a save, and dont have a range of personal; a contagious power never spreads to someone who would from being the target of the power. a manifester level check to dispel or remove a contagious power that fails by 5 or more causes it to spread from the original target to the creature that attempted to remove it. the power spreads to the new target regardless of its normal range or any special targeting requirement like a melee or ranged touch attack. the power is treated as if you had just manifested it on the new target. the new target receives a saving throw as well as the of power resistance (if applicable) if the power normally allows it. a contagious power can be identified normally as it is being cast with a successful spellcraft check. identifying whether a power is contagious by its effect, however, requires the use of the analyze aura spell or a similar effect.

name: Dazing Power
description: You can daze a creature with the powers you manifest.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can modify a mind-affecting power that targets only one creature to possibly daze the creature. when a creature makes a successful save against a dazing power, they must make an additional saving throw or become dazed for a number of rounds equal to the level of the power. if the power does not allow a save, the target can make a will save to negate the daze effect. if the power effect causes the creature to become dazed, the duration of this metapsionic effect is added to the duration of the power if the creature fails its save. this is considered a mind-affecting effect; if the subject fails the save for the daze effect, he is unaware that he has been subjected to a mind-affecting power. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Delay Power
description: You can manifest powers that go off up to 5 rounds later. If you choose one of the first two triggers and the conditions are not met within 5 rounds, the power activates automatically on the fifth round. Only area and personal powers can be delayed. Any decisions you would make about the delayed power, including attack rolls, designating targets, or determining or shaping an area, are decided when the power is manifested. Any effects resolved by those affected by the power, including saving throws, are decided when the delay period ends. A delayed power can be dispelled normally during the delay, and can be detected normally in the area or on the target by the use of powers that can detect psionic effects. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. You have better control over your delayed powers. Normal You can delay a power for up to 5 rounds. Activating a delayed power is a standard action.
benefits: add your mythic tier to the number of rounds you can delay a power. in addition, you may activate a delayed power as a swift or immediate action instead of as a standard action. alternatively, you may expend a use of mythic power to manifest a power as a delayed power (gaining only the normal of a delayed power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Echoing Power
description: You have learned how to release most, but not all, of a powers potential when you manifest it.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when you manifest an echoing power a portion of it remains in your power point pool, and you can manifest it one additional time during that day. this second manifesting does not expend any additional power points. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Ectoplasmic Power
description: Your psionic powers breach the gulf between dimensions, sending ghostly emanations into the ether.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. an ectoplasmic power has full effect against incorporeal or ethereal creatures. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Empower Power
description: You can manifest powers to greater effect. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. You can increase the effect of a power by +75%. Normal All variable, numeric effects of an empowered power are increased by half including bonuses to those dice rolls.
benefits: when you manifest a power affected by empower power, all variable, numeric effects of the power are increased by +75%, including bonuses to those dice rolls. alternatively, you may expend a use of mythic power to manifest a power as an empowered power (gaining only the normal of an empowered power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Endowed Mind
description: You can make your powers more difficult to resist. Special Unlike most metapsionic feats, you do not need to expend your psionic focus to use this feat.
benefits: as long as you maintain psionic focus, increase the save dc of any power you manifest by 1 for every 2 power points you spend augmenting the power, provided the augmentation does not already increase the powers save dc. you may even spend 2 power points to increase a powers save dc even if the power does not have any augment options.

name: Enlarge Power
description: You can manifest powers farther than normal. Using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power. You can triple the range of a power. Normal An enlarged power with a range of close has a range of 50 ft. + 5 ft./level, while medium-range powers have a range of 200 ft. + 20 ft./level and longrange powers have a range of 800 ft. + 80 ft./level.
benefits: when you manifest a power with a range of close, medium, or long affected by enlarge power, its range is increased by +200%. an enlarged power with a range of close now has a range of 75 ft. + 15 ft./2 levels, while medium-range powers have a range of 300 ft. + 30 ft./level and long-range powers have a range of 1,200 ft. + 120 ft./level. alternatively, you may expend a use of mythic power to manifest a power as an enlarged power (gaining only the normal of an enlarged power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Explosive Power
description: Your powers that normally only affect a single creature explode on impact. Using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power if only a single creature was targeted by the initial effect. For powers that allow the direct targeting of multiple creatures, such as energy missile, each additional target of the initial power increases the cost of the power by 2 power points. Creatures cannot be affected by both the initial power and the explosion, nor by overlapping explosions.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can cause a power you manifest that deals hit point damage and has a direct target or targets (not an area effect) to explode upon impact, dealing its damage to all creatures adjacent to the target of the initial power. a successful reflex save halves the damage from this explosion, even if the original power did not allow a save, such as energy ray, in which case calculate the save based upon the level of the power manifested.

name: Extend Power
description: You can manifest powers that last longer than normal. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. You can triple the duration of a power. Normal An extended power lasts twice as long as normal.
benefits: when you manifest a power augmented with extend spell, it lasts three times as long as normal. a power with a duration of concentration, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat. alternatively, you may expend a use of mythic power to manifest a power as an extended power (gaining only the normal of an extended power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Flaring Power
description: You dazzle creatures when you affect them with a power that has the fire, light, or electricity descriptor. Powers that do not deal fire, light, or electricity damage cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. the electricity, fire, or light effects of the affected power create a flaring that dazzles creatures that take damage from the power. a flare power causes a creature that takes fire, light, or electricity damage from the affected power to become dazzled for a number of rounds equal to the level of the power. a flaring power only affects powers with a fire, light, or electricity descriptor. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Focused Power
description: When you manifest a power that affects more than one creature, one opponent finds it more difficult to resist. Powers that do not require a saving throw to resist or lessen the powers effect cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when manifesting a power that can or does affect or target more than one creature, you can choose one target or creature within the power effect. that creatures saving throw dc to resist the power is increased by +2. you must choose which target to focus the power on before manifesting the power. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Hustle Power
description: You can hasten the manifesting time of some powers. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Manifesting a hustled power still provokes attacks of opportunity. Special This feat cannot be used on powers that cannot be quickened.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you may manifest a power with a manifesting time of one standard action as a move action instead. powers with manifesting times other than one standard action may not be affected by this feat. you can perform another action, even manifest another power, in the same round that you manifest a hustled power.

name: Inducting Power
description: Once a foe is harmed by your ability, their woes are only beginning Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. this feat can be applied only to mind-affecting powers that allow a will save. if a target fails a will save against the power, they are immediately added to your collective. in order to make room for creatures, you may remove others from the collective as a free action as part of manifesting the power.

name: Irradiating Power
description: Your psionic abilities taint targets with radiation Manifesting a power in this way requires an expenditure of 4 additional power points, and the total expenditure cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this ability, you must expend psionic focus. any creature affected by an irradiating power must succeed on a fortitude save or contract radiation of a certain level. the fortitude save and level of radiation are based on the amount of power points spent on the power (including power points spent to use this metapsionic feat).

name: Lingering Power
description: Your power clings to existence, slowly fading from the world.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you may cause an instantaneous power that affects an area to persist until the beginning of your next turn. those already in the area suffer no additional harm, but other creatures or objects entering the area are subject to its effects. a lingering power with a visual manifestation obscures vision, providing concealment (20% miss chance) beyond 5 feet and total concealment (50% miss chance) beyond 20 feet. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power. powers that do not affect an area cannot be used with this feat.

name: Maddening Power
description: Your powers pollute the minds of those who experience them Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. this feat can be applied only to mind-affecting powers that allow a will save. if a target fails a will save against the power, they take an amount of sanity damage equal to the number of power points spent on the power. if sanity is not used, the target takes an amount of damage to 1 mental ability score equal to half the number of power points spent on the power (minimum 1).

name: Malleable Power
description: You are able to shape the effect of your power to exclude targets. For example, you may shoot an energy bolt from your fingertips and exclude the first two cubes of the power. The other 110 of the energy bolt would be manifest as normal. Manifesting a malleable power increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Powers that do not affect an area cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must spend your psionic focus. doing so lets you manifest a malleable power. this power may exclude any number of 5-foot cubes (5 long by 5 wide by 5 high). the cubes you exclude do not otherwise hamper the power.

name: Maximize Power
description: You can manifest powers to maximum effect. Augmented powers can be maximized; a maximized augmented power deals the maximum damage (or cures the maximum hit points, and so on) of the augmented power. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Your maximum psionic power is more than maximum. Normal All variable, numeric effects of a maximized power are automatically at their highest value.
benefits: when you manifest a power affected by maximize power, all variable, numeric effects of the power are treated as 150% of their maximum. alternatively, you may expend two uses of mythic power to manifest a power as a maximized power (gaining only the normal of a maximized power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Merciful Power
description: Your damaging powers subdue rather than kill. Powers that do not deal hit point damage cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must maintain your psionic focus, rather than expend it. you can alter powers that inflict hit point damage to inflict nonlethal damage instead. powers that inflict hit point damage of a particular type (such as fire) inflict nonlethal damage of that same type. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Network Power
description: You can temporarily alter the nature of certain powers to allow use over a mental link. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can treat a power as if it had the network descriptor. you may only use this feat on powers with a range of personal and a target of you.

name: Opportunity Power
description: You can make power-enhanced attacks of opportunity. Manifesting this power is an immediate action. You cannot use this feat with a touch power whose manifesting time is longer than 1 full-round action. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 6. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Normal Attacks of opportunity can be made only with melee weapons. Enemies who give you an opportunity do so at their own peril. Normal An opportunity power must have a range of touch.
benefits: when using opportunity power, you can use a power that does not have a range of touch, so long as the creature that provoked the attack of opportunity is the target of the power. alternatively, you may expend two uses of mythic power to manifest a power as an opportunity power (gaining only the normal of an opportunity power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Persistent Power
description: You can modify a power to become more tenacious when its targets resist its effect. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Powers that do not require a saving throw to resist or lessen the powers effect cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. whenever a creature targeted by a persistent power or within its area succeeds on its saving throw against the power, it must make another saving throw against the effect. if a creature fails this second saving throw, it suffers the full effects of the power, as if it had failed its first saving throw.

name: Piercing Power
description: Your studies have helped you develop methods to overcome power resistance.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when you manifest a piercing power against a target with power resistance, it treats the power resistance of the target as 5 lower than its actual pr. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Plague Power
description: You can manifest a power that spreads among targets.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when you manifest a power with a duration other than instantaneous or permanent, at any time during the duration, you can cause the power to affect an adjacent target as an immediate action. that target is affected as if you had just manifested the same power against the new target, including any augmentations used. you can cause a power to spread once for every five manifester levels you have. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Psychomachy
description: You are adept at assaulting the minds of your victims.
benefits: if a power you manifest deals damage to a mental ability score (such as ego whips damage to charisma), you may expend your psionic focus as part of manifesting that power. if you do, it instead deals damage to the mental ability score of your choice.

name: Quicken Power
description: You can manifest a power with a moments thought. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 6. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. Manifesting a quickened power does not provoke attacks of opportunity. Manifesting a power can be nearly effortless for you. Normal A quickened power that normally has a manifesting time of 1 standard action can instead be manifested as a swift action.
benefits: you can manifest any power as a swift action, regardless of its normal manifesting time. if a target provokes an attack of opportunity from you, you can target it with a quickened power as your attack of opportunity. only quickened powers with a specific number of targets (rather than effect or area) can be manifested as an attack of opportunity, and only the creature that provoked the attack is targeted by the power (regardless of how many creatures the power normally targets). alternatively, you may expend two uses of mythic power to manifest a power as a quickened power (gaining only the normal of a quickened power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Redirect Power
description: You can direct a failed power against a different target.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. whenever a redirecting power targeting a single creature has no effect on its intended target (whether due to power resistance or a successful saving throw) you may, as a swift action, redirect it to target another eligible creature within range. the redirected power behaves in all ways as if its new target were the original target for the power. powers that affect a target in any way (including a lesser effect from a successful saving throw) may not be redirected in this manner. using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Rime Power
description: Creatures damaged by your powers with the cold descriptor become entangled. This feat can only be used with powers that have the cold descriptor and deal damage. Using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. the frost of your cold power clings to the target, impeding it for a short time. a rime power causes creatures that take cold damage from the power to become entangled for a number of rounds equal to the original level of the power.

name: Riposte Power
description: You can manifest a power in response to an attack.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can manifest a riposte power as an immediate action against a target that has just attacked you or forced you to make a save against an ability, power, or spell. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Selective Power
description: Your allies need not fear friendly fire. Powers that do not have an area of effect cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when manifesting a selective power with an area effect, you can choose a number of targets in the area equal to your key ability modifier. these targets are excluded from the effects of your power. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Shared Power
description: Alternatively, you can expend your psionic focus to treat the power as if it has a range of Close (25 ft. + 5 ft./2 levels) and has the network descriptor. Using this feat in this manner increases the power point cost of the power by 2. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can manifest a power with a range of personal as if the range was instead touch. using this feat in this manner does not increase the power point cost of the power.

name: Sickening Power
description: You can sicken creatures with your powers. Powers that do not inflict damage cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can modify a power to sicken a creature damaged by the power. when a creature takes damage from this power, they become sickened for a number of rounds equal to the level of the power. if the power allows a saving throw, a successful save negates the sickening effect. if the power does not allow a save, the target can make a fortitude save to negate the sickening effect. if the power effect also causes the creature to become sickened, the duration of this metapsionic effect is added on to the duration of the power. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Split Psionic Ray
description: You can affect two targets with a single ray. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. Your rays affect multiple targets.
benefits: when manifesting a power affected by split psionic ray, it can affect an additional number of targets equal to one third of your mythic tier (rounded down) and the range between targets increases by 5 feet for each mythic tier you have achieved. alternatively, you may expend one use of mythic power to manifest a power as a split ray power (gaining only the normal of a split ray power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Through the Flesh
description: You can chain a telepathy power when using a psychometabolism power.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you manifest a psychometabolism power that targets a single creature and as a free action, you can manifest a telepathy power that targets the same creature. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost (psychometabolism and telepathy together) cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Thundering Power
description: You can conjure your powers into existence with blaring thunder or fearful shrieks, deafening creatures damaged by their effects. Powers that do not inflict damage cannot be used with this feat.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you can modify a power to deafen a creature damaged by the power. when a creature takes damage from this power, it becomes deafened for a number of rounds equal to the level of the power. if the power allows a saving throw, a successful save negates the deafening effect. if the power does not allow a save, the target can make a fortitude save to negate the deafening effect. if the power effect also causes the creature to become deafened, the duration of this metapsionic effect is added to the duration of the power. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 2. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Timeslipped Power
description: You can shift powers out of the timestream before they take effect, delaying their effect until needed.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you manifest a personal psionic power and slip it out of the timestream, which means it stops existing just before activating. activating a timeslipped power takes a swift action, at which point the power acts as if you had just manifest it. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 8. you can only have one timeslipped power per five manifester levels. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Toppling Power
description: Your powers with the force descriptor knock the affected creatures prone. A toppling power only affects powers with the force descriptor. Using this feat does not increase the power point cost of the power.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. the impact of your force power is strong enough to knock the target prone. if the target takes damage, fails its saving throw, or is moved by your force power, make a trip check against the target, using your manifester level plus your manifesting ability score bonus (wisdom for psychic warriors, intelligence for psions, and so on). this does not provoke an attack of opportunity. if the check fails, the target cannot attempt to trip you or the force effect in response.

name: Transcendent Power
description: Your psionic abilities cross over into the realm of magic Manifesting a Transcendent power costs 2 additional power points, and the total cost cannot exceed the characters manifester level.
benefits: to use this feat, a character must expend their psionic focus. the power manifested using this feat is treated as a magic spell of no particular school for all purposes (feats, class abilities area effects, spell resistance, etc.). this does not allow metamagic feats to be applied to the power.

name: Twin Power
description: You can manifest a power simultaneously with another power just like it. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 6. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. You can split the effects of a twinned power.
benefits: when manifesting a twinned power, you can choose separate targets or areas for the two effects. alternatively, you may expend two uses of mythic power to manifest a power as a twinned power (gaining only the normal of a twinned power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Unconditional Power
description: Disabling conditions do not hold you back. Only personal powers and powers that affect your person can be manifested as unconditional powers. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 8. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. You can manifest powers under nearly any condition. Normal Only personal powers and powers that affect your person can be manifested as unconditional powers.
benefits: you can manifest any power as an unconditional power and under any status effect except unconscious or dead. alternatively, you may expend two uses of mythic power to manifest a power as an unconditional power (gaining only the normal of an unconditional power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Unwilling Teleport
description: You can use psychoportation powers on a target you wouldnt normally be able to effect. Special This feat does not work with powers that have an augmentation option that allows them to target unwilling creatures.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. you may manifest a psychoportation power with a target of willing creatures on an unwilling creature within line of sight. the creature gets a will saving throw (dc 10 + the powers level + your main manifesting abilitys modifier) to avoid the effect. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 6. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. this feat follows the standard rules of teleportation, in that the teleported creature cannot be teleported upwards into the air or into objects or other creatures. the target creature must be teleported onto a clear, supported surface. attempts to teleport a creature outside these rules always fail.

name: Void Power
description: You manifest powers that deal damage of the void instead of an energy type.
benefits: to use this feat, you must expend your psionic focus. when you manifest a power that deals damage of your active energy type, but instead of using your active energy type, it draws upon the void itself, creating an inverse of energy. the power deals the same amount of damage, but this damage is untyped and not subject to energy resistance. using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. the powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level.

name: Widen Power
description: You can increase the area of your powers. Using this feat increases the power point cost of the power by 4. The powers total cost cannot exceed your manifester level. You can manifest powers that cover vast areas. Normal A widened power increases its area by 100%.
benefits: when you manifest a power affected by widen power, any numeric measurements of the powers area increase by 200%. only a burst, emanation, or spread-shaped power can be affected by this feat. alternatively, you may expend a use of mythic power to manifest a power as a widened power (gaining only the normal of a widened power, rather than the increased outlined above) without increasing the number of power points spent or expending psionic focus.

name: Extra Arm
description: Your projected form has an additional appendage compared to a normal humanoid. Special This feat can be taken up to twice. When it is taken a second time, your projected form gains a fourth arm. This feat qualifies you as having three arms for feats such as Multiweapon Fighting.
benefits: your projected form possess three arms. you can wield multiple weapons, but only one hand is your primary hand, and all others are off hands. you can also use your hands for other purposes that require free hands. this additional arm is always projected with your form, and cannot be turned off  though use of alter self can potentially hide it.

name: Extra Future Visions
description: You can see the future more often. Special This feat can be taken multiple times. Its
benefits: (editor's note the feat ends abruptly here. i assume it was supposed to say "its stack.")

name: Fast Friends
description: You are better at fusion than most mineralites.
prerequisites: fusion of forms racial trait, base attack bonus +5
benefits: so long as all the contributors of a fusion of forms possess this feat, they may perform the fusion as a standard action. additionally, if participants possessing this feat are in a fusion of forms with others who dont when the fusion falls apart, the possessors of this feat may make a dc 20 will saving throw. all contributors with this feat that make the saving throw remain in their own fusion instead of breaking into individuals. the new fusion still suffers the normal consequence of the original fusion falling apart.

name: Flexibility of Mind
description: You can retrain faster than humanoids because you can redesign your projected form.
benefits: whenever you wish to retrain a feat or class feature, you may dissipate your form instead. you must remain this way for 1 hour per day you would normally spend retraining. at the end of the time, your retraining is complete and you reform. if you retrain using this method, you must wait 1 week before you use it again.

name: Force Caster
description: Your command over force and force-effects create longer-lasting spell effects.
prerequisites: caster level 1st, projected form racial trait.
benefits: when you cast spells with the force descriptor, you are considered two levels higher when determining the duration of those spells.

name: Fusion Arms
description: You keep your projected weapons or armor in fusion form. Additionally, so long as at least two contributors possess this feat, the fusion may take the 3-point Amalgam Weapon evolution.
benefits: any participants of a fusion of forms with this feat may keep their projected weapons or armor (including gembound ones) while in the fusion form. the fusion is considered proficient with any weapons or armor kept this way. if two of the same type of item would be kept by multiple members in the fusion, like two mineralites each bonding with armor, the fusion can choose a single armor to project  which can be either of the members armors, or an amalgamation of them all. add all related bonuses together and divide those numbers by the number of items in the mix (rounded down). for instance, mundane leather armor (+2 armor bonus) and plate mail +2 (+9 armor bonus, +2 enhancement bonus) fused would grant a +5 armor bonus and +1 enhancement bonus to ac. keep only an appropriate number of special properties in the case of magic arms and armor available for the new fused bonus. these fusions arms and armors are always sized correctly for the fusion form. only weapon or armor can be included, not tools or other consumables like magic potions, etc.

name: Gem Companion
description: Your companion is shardborn.
prerequisites: familiar, animal companion, or mount class features.
benefits: your companion looks like any other member of their kind, except for the magical chunk of gemstone in their body. your companion gains the shardborn template. should you ever desire to change your companion, this companion changes into the new form instead of being dismissed and replaced. this specifically allows companions that are not the animal or magical beast type to gain the shardborn template, but only for so long as they are a characters companion.

name: Greater Holographic Resistance
description: Your training has helped you to realize your body is nothing but projected light. Special You may take this feat multiple times. Each time, choose a different condition you are immune to.
benefits: choose one condition disease, mind-affecting effects, poison, fatigue or exhaustion. you are now immune to those types of effects. you lose this immunity when targeted by a deeper darkness or similar higher level spell with the darkness descriptor.

name: Improved Holographic Resistance
description: You are training yourself to realize your body is nothing but projected light.
benefits: your racial resistance bonuses increases to +5, and you only lose these bonuses when targeted deeper darkness or similar higher level spell with the darkness descriptor.

name: Improved Projected Weapons
description: Your projected weapons are more powerful magic items. This bonded weapon can still be dispelled as a normal projected weapon, but you add its overall enhancement bonus to the DC to dispel it. If a weapon bonded with you is dispelled, it cant be reformed for at least 24 hours, 8 hours of which you must rest and meditate to reform the weapon in your mind. If a weapon bonded with you is destroyed, you lose the use of this ability for 30 days, or until you gain a level, whichever comes first. During this 30-day period, you take a 1 penalty on all attack and weapon damage rolls.
prerequisites: con 15, projected weapon racial trait, projected form adept, improved holographic resistance
benefits: your projected weapon counts as masterwork version of the type of weapon it is, granting a +1 enhancement bonus to attack. when youve attained a character level of 5th, your projected weapon gains a +1 enhancement bonus as a magic weapon. for every three levels beyond 5th, the weapon gains another +1 enhancement bonus, to a maximum of +6 at 20th level. these bonuses can be added to the weapon, stacking with existing weapon bonuses to a maximum of +5, or they can be used to add any of the following weapon properties axiomatic, brilliant energy, defending, keen, and speed. adding these properties consumes an amount of bonus equal to the propertys cost. these bonuses are added to any properties the weapon already has (if using a gembound weapon), but duplicate abilities do not stack. if the weapon is not magical, at least a +1 enhancement bonus must be added before any other properties can be added. the projected weapon imparts no bonuses if the weapon is held by anyone other than the original owner, but resumes giving bonuses if returned to the them. these bonuses apply to only one end of a double weapon.

name: Leverage Self-Worth
description: You can use the value of your gemstone as a material component in spells, at a cost.
prerequisites: ability to cast spells, gemstone form racial trait
benefits: you learned how to leverage the value of your gemstone against the material costs of your spells. when casting a spell with a costly material component, you can negate up to 500 gp worth of material component cost per character level you have. if you do so, your gemstone takes 1d4 points of damage. this damage bypasses hardness and any effects that would normally prevent damage. this damage cannot be repaired for 24 hours.

name: Magical Gemstone
description: You can tap inherent magical potential in your gemstone as spell-like ability. Special This feat may be taken multiple times. Each time you take this feat, the level of spell you may select from increases by 1, to a maximum of 3rd level spells.
benefits: select one cantrip from the sorcerer/wizard spell list. you can cast this spell 3/day as a spell-like ability.

name: Mind Over Photons
description: You understand that your body is nothing but light, and thus need not be affected by every ill or harm done to it.
prerequisites: con 17, life as photons racial trait, greater holographic resistance
benefits: for any fortitude saving throw you make, you may roll twice and take the more favorable result.

name: Photon Caster
description: Your command over light and photons create longerlasting spell effects.
prerequisites: caster level 1st, life as photons racial trait.
benefits: when you cast spells with the light descriptor, you are considered two levels higher when determining the duration of those spells.

name: Principles of Mindfulness
description: Your thoughtfulness for others aids you in remaining in fusion forms.
benefits: you are mindful of your thoughts and emotions and how they affect others. whenever you are a contributor into a fusion of forms, that fusion gains a +5 morale bonus to saving throws to maintain the fusion. a contributor can only take this feat once, but the bonuses from multiple contributors with this feat stack.

name: Quartz Determination
description: You show a perseverance similar to those living creatures with the Diehard feat. When using this feat, you are staggered. You can take a move action without further injuring yourself, but if you perform any standard action (or any other action deemed as strenuous, including some swift actions, such as casting a quickened spell) you take 1 point of damage after completing the act (affecting your gemstone, automatically bypassing any hardness or other reduction in damage it may normally have). If your negative hit points are equal to or greater than your Constitution score, your projected form dissipates as you retreat to your gemstone. Normal A mineralite without this feat who is reduced to negative hit points dissipates their projected from, reverting into their gemstone form.
benefits: when your hit point total is below 0, but your projected form does not dissipate, and you automatically stabilize. you do not need to make a constitution check each round to avoid losing additional hit points. you may choose to act as if you were disabled. you must make this decision as soon as you are reduced to negative hit points (even if it isnt your turn). if you do not choose to act as if you were disabled, your projected form slumps over and you appear (and are treated as being) unconscious.

name: Quick Reform
description: You are able to reform your projections faster than most mineralites. Special When used with Flexibility of Mind feat, you can retrain once per day instead of once per week, and it only takes you 10 minutes per day of normal retraining instead of 1 hour per. Normal Under normal conditions, you must wait till you would have fully healed all of your hit points to reproject your self from your gemstone if it dissipated from damage.
benefits: you can regain your projected form faster than most mineralites after it is winked out of existence involuntarily. if you lost your projected from from normal damage, you can reproject your body as soon as you have at least 1 hp. if your projected form was destroyed by some other means, like being dispelled or disintegrated, and you normally have to wait an amount of time before you could reproject, reduce this time by a factor of 10, so that 10 rounds becomes 1 round, 10 minutes becomes 1 minute, 60 minutes becomes 6 minutes, 24 hours becomes 2 hours 40 minutes, etc.

name: Strength of Diamonds
description: You have an especially resilient gemstone. Special You may take this feat multiple times, its effects stack for a maximum hardness of 30 and +30 hp to your gemstone.
benefits: your gemstone is tougher than most. your mineralite gemstones hardness and hit points increases by 5.

name: Projected Form Adept
description: You have great control over your projected form. Special No matter what final form you take, your gemstone is always located in the same basic location on your body (though additional mundane or magical means can still hide it). Additionally, the unnatural nature of your skin tone, hair, and other traits always shows through so that you take a -5 penalty on all Disguise checks.
benefits: you are able to make more substantial changes to your projected form, as if using alter self at-will instead of disguise self and vocal alteration. you retain those spell-like abilities as well.

name: Bestial Projected Form
description: You are able to alter your projected form into that of an animal-like creature. Additionally, no matter what final form you take, your gemstone is always located in the same basic location on your body (though additional mundane or magical means can still hide it). Additionally, the unnatural nature of your skin tone, hair, and other traits always shows through so that you take a -5 penalty on all Disguise checks.
benefits: special druids with this feat may only apply their special of wild shaping to their limited forms per day, but are able to still use the basic spell with this feat at-will.

name: Improved Bestial Projected Form
description: Your animal-like projected form becomes stronger. Special This feat can be taken multiple times, each time increasing the required minimum Constitution score by 2 points, and increasing the level of beast shape. So Con 17 for beast shape iii, and Con 19 for beast shape iv.
prerequisites: con 17, bestial projected form, projected form adept
benefits: you now use beast shape ii at-will instead of beast shape i.

name: Draconic Projected Form
description: You are able to alter your projected form into that of a dragonlike creature. Additionally, no matter what final form you take, your gemstone is always located in the same basic location on your body (though additional mundane or magical means can still hide it). Additionally, the unnatural nature of your skin tone, hair, and other traits always shows through so that you take a -5 penalty on all Disguise checks.
prerequisites: con 19, bestial projected form, improved bestial projected form, projected form adept
benefits: special druids with this feat may only apply their special of wild shaping to their limited forms per day, but are able to still use the basic spell with this feat at-will.

name: Monstrous Projected Form
description: You are able to alter your projected form to have monstrous features. Additionally, no matter what final form you take, your gemstone is always located in the same basic location on your body (though additional mundane or magical means can still hide it). Additionally, the unnatural nature of your skin tone, hair, and other traits always shows through so that you take a -5 penalty on all Disguise checks.
benefits: special druids with this feat may only apply their special of wild shaping to their limited forms per day, but are able to still use the basic spell with this feat at-will.

name: Improved Monstrous Projected Form
description: Your monstrous projected form becomes stronger. Special This feat can be taken multiple times, each time increasing the required minimum Constitution score by 2 points, and increasing the level of monstrous physique. So Con 17 for monstrous physique iii, and Con 19 for monstrous physique iv.
prerequisites: con 17, monstrous projected form, projected form adept
benefits: you now use monstrous physique ii at-will instead of monstrous physique i.

name: Giant Projected Form
description: You are able to alter your projected form to massive sizes. Additionally, no matter what final form you take, your gemstone is always located in the same basic location on your body (though additional mundane or magical means can still hide it). Additionally, the unnatural nature of your skin tone, hair, and other traits always shows through so that you take a -5 penalty on all Disguise checks.
prerequisites: con 19, monstrous projected form, improved monstrous projected form, projected form adept
benefits: special druids with this feat may only apply their special of wild shaping to their limited forms per day, but are able to still use the basic spell with this feat at-will.

name: Plant-Like Projected Form
description: You are able to alter your projected form into that of a plant-like creature. Additionally, no matter what final form you take, your gemstone is always located in the same basic location on your body (though additional mundane or magical means can still hide it). Additionally, the unnatural nature of your skin tone, hair, and other traits always shows through so that you take a -5 penalty on all Disguise checks.
benefits: special druids with this feat may only apply their special of wild shaping to their limited forms per day, but are able to still use the basic spell with this feat at-will.

name: Improved Plant-Like Projected Form
description: Your plant-like projected form becomes stronger. Special This feat can be taken a second time, increasing the required minimum Constitution score to 19, and increasing the spell to plant shape iii.
prerequisites: con 17, plant-like projected form, projected form adept
benefits: you now use plant shape ii at-will instead of plant shape i.

name: Absolute Focus
description: You can convert psionic power into mental focus.
prerequisites: autohypnosis 3 ranks, focus powers class feature.
benefits: choose one focus power you know. you can expend your psionic focus when using the chosen focus power to reduce its cost in mental focus points by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

name: Access Psionic Talent
description: You are able to manifest minor psionic abilities. Special This feat may be selected more than once. Each time, you gain five additional psionic talents.
benefits: you gain five talents (level 0 powers). these talents can be from any class list.

name: Additional Teletechnique
description: You have unlocked another offensive teleportation secret.
prerequisites: benefit you gain one additional teletechnique. you must meet all the for this teletechnique. this feat may be taken multiple times.

name: Additional Terror
description: You have unlocked an additional form of fear. Special You may take this feat multiple times. Each time, you gain a new terror.
benefits: you gain an additional terror.

name: Advanced Anomalous Path
description: You have developed finer control over of your psionic animus.
prerequisites: wis 13; animus potency or extra animus; any metapsionic feat, warriors path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: the anomalous trance now applies to your touch armor class against powers, psi-like abilities, spells, and spell-like abilities. additionally, when using the anomalous path maneuver, the animus provided from this ability increases from 1d4 to 1d6 at 3rd level, and from 2d4 to 2d6 at 7th level. this feat is a supernatural ability.

name: Advanced Archer Path
description: You have expanded expertise at ranged combat.
prerequisites: point-blank shot, precise shot, archer path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: half of the competence bonus from your archer trance is added to your damage rolls for attacks made with ranged or thrown weapons (natural weapons do not count for this ). in addition, when using the archer maneuver, you may perform a bull rush attempt instead of a trip attempt.

name: Advanced Ascetic Path
description: You are an expert of unarmed combat.
prerequisites: dodge, psionic dodge, ascetic path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: the competence bonus of your ascetic trance now applies to both ac and saves. in addition, when using the ascetic maneuver, you can deflect one attack as if using the deflect arrows feat, although you may alternatively deflect a melee attack.

name: Advanced Assassin Path
description: Your attacks have become even deadlier.
prerequisites: deep impact, psionic weapon, assassin path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: when using the assassin trance, you deal sneak attack as a rogue of half your psychic warrior level. your target must be eligible for sneak attack (not immune to precision-based damage, flanked, denied a dexterity bonus, etc). in addition, when using the assassin maneuver, your opponent must make a fortitude save (dc equal to 10 + your base attack bonus) or be staggered for a number of rounds equal to your wisdom modifier.

name: Advanced Brawling Path
description: Your grappling abilities are particularly effective.
prerequisites: improved grapple, improved unarmed strike, brawling path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: when using the brawling trance, you gain a +1 competence bonus to your grapple checks for every three psychic warrior levels you have. in addition, when using the brawling maneuver, the damage you deal can be lethal, instead of non-lethal.

name: Advanced Constructs
description: You are especially skilled at creating astral constructs. Menu A Menu B Menu C
benefits: you gain additional menu options for astral constructs, as detailed below.

name: Advanced Dervish Path
description: You seem to float between enemies, a blur of destruction.
prerequisites: dex 15, double slice, two-weapon fighting, dervish path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: when using the dervish trance, the competence bonus applies to your damage as well as your attack rolls. in addition, you can use the dervish maneuver even if you moved before your attack and you have no limit of how many 5-foot steps you can take while using the dervish maneuver, as long as you make at least one attack before each 5-foot step. the maximum distance you can move in this round is that of a double move.

name: Advanced Feral Path
description: Your natural attacks are more vicious.
prerequisites: psionic fist, unavoidable strike, feral path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: the competence bonus from your trance now also applies to damage rolls made with natural attacks. in addition, when using the feral maneuver, if two natural attacks in the same charge are successful, your natural weapons deal extra damage. this damage is equal to the damage dealt by one natural attack plus 1-1/2 times your strength modifier (if the two natural attacks deal different amounts of damage, use the lesser of the two).

name: Advanced Gladiator Path
description: Youve developed keen tactical instincts and are able to leverage these with both mental and physical power.
prerequisites: wis 13; combat expertise, ready response; warriors path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: the gladiator path trance ability allows you to tactically reposition yourself whenever you fail a combat maneuver attempt against an enemy or an enemy fails a combat maneuver attempt against you, allowing you to move up to 5 feet as a free action without provoking attacks of opportunity (even if it isnt your turn). you may use the maneuver of this warriors path as part of an attack action you have made as a free action once per round. you must expend your psionic focus and you may immediately make a combat maneuver attempt (such as a disarm or grapple) as part of that attack action. this feat is a supernatural ability.

name: Advanced Hungering Path
description: You ever-hungry psionic scar holds greater demands for greater power.
prerequisites: con 13; psionic body or toughness; warriors focus; warriors path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: the hunger paths trance causes those who fail a saving throw against your powers or class abilities to become sickened for two rounds from the power of your aura. when using the maneuver, the ranged touch attack not only draws in psychic power, but it also life energies. in addition to the power point drain, the attack inflicts 1d6 points of damage at 3rd level, and this damage improves by 1d6 points of damage at 7th level and every four levels thereafter. you gain 5 temporary hit points for 10 points of damage inflicted by this attack. these temporary hit points last for one minute or until they are taken away by damage; further applications of this ability do not stack up additional temporary hit points. this feat is a supernatural ability.

name: Advanced Infiltrator Path
description: You have a talent for getting wherever you need to go.
prerequisites: deceitful, infiltrator path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: when using the infiltrator trance, the competence bonus to disguise checks also applies to bluff and sense motive checks. in addition, when using the infiltrator maneuver, for the duration of your metamorphosis power, you gain the scent extraordinary ability and the competence bonus to intimidate checks also applies to survival checks.

name: Advanced Interceptor Path
description: You defend your allies with uncanny expertise.
prerequisites: combat expertise, interceptor path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: when using the interceptor trance, you can take a penalty to your armor class equal to the competence bonus granted by the interceptor trance to grant a deflection bonus to armor class to one ally threatened by an enemy within your melee reach. in addition, when using the interceptor maneuver, if your attack was successful, you can make a free disarm or trip attempt against the enemy struck.

name: Advanced Mind Knight Path
description: You have learned enhanced techniques to make sure you are always armed and dangerous
prerequisites: wis 13, psionic meditation, psionic shot or psionic weapon, mind knight path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: as long as you have both mind knight path powers, you can manifest both mind knight path powers at the same time as a single standard action. any time you manifest call weaponry, you may select one other 1st level power you know; you may manifest that power using martial power as if it were a path power, as long as the attack is made using the weapon summoned. in addition, when using the mind knight maneuver, you gain a +1 competence bonus on the attack rolls for every four psychic warrior levels you have.

name: Advanced Outrider Path
prerequisites: your ectoplasmic mount strikes at foes you pass. wis 13; mounted archery or ride-by attack; warriors focus, outrider path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6.
benefits: whenever you are riding the mount from your outrider trance and its movement takes you within 5 feet of an opponent during your turn, you may deal force damage equal to your wisdom modifier to that opponent. a given opponent can only take this damage once per round. this feat is a supernatural ability.

name: Advanced Survivor Path
description: You are capable of withstanding a variety of situations.
prerequisites: con 13, mind over body, toughness, survivor path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: when using the survivor trance, you gain resistance to your active energy type. the resistance is equal to 5 for every four psychic warrior levels you have. in addition, when using the survivor maneuver, the bonus to will saves can instead apply to fortitude saves.

name: Advanced Weaponmaster Path
description: You are a particularly dangerous opponent to duel.
prerequisites: combat expertise, improved disarm, weapon focus, weaponmaster path class feature, manifester level 10th, base attack bonus +6
benefits: the competence bonus from your trance now also applies to damage rolls made with a weapon (natural attacks do not count for this purpose). in addition, when using the weaponmaster maneuver, you can choose to make a free disarm attempt against your attacker in place of the single melee attack. if your disarm attempt is successful, you may then make a single melee attack against your opponent in place of the 5-foot step.

name: Aligned Attack
description: Your melee or ranged attack overcomes your opponents alignment-based damage reduction and deals additional damage. As long as you maintain psionic focus, your attack is treated as either a good, evil, chaotic, or lawful attack (depending on your original choice) for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction. You may choose to expend your psionic focus when making an attack to power this feats secondary ability. When you make a successful melee or ranged attack in this fashion, you deal an extra 2d6 points of damage of the type you originally selected if your target is of the opposed alignment. This attack is still treated as the appropriate alignment type. You must decide whether or not to use this ability prior to making an attack. If your attack misses, you still expend your psionic focus. You can switch the alignment of your attacks.
benefits: you can expend a use of mythic power as a swift action to change the alignment choice for the aligned attack feat. the alignment chosen must still match one of your alignment components.

name: Alternate Conscription
description: You've broadened your methods of conscripting enemies.
benefits: when you take this feat, you choose a method of conscription from a different set of highlord tenets. by expending your psionic focus as a free action, even if it isn't your turn, you may use the conscription ability of that tenet as if you were a highlord of that tenet for a round.

name: Amplified Momentum
description: You can amplify your augmented strikes with momentum, or recycle it into your evasiveness.
benefits: when you spend momentum to amplify an attack, you choose to gain one of the following

name: Animus Potency
description: You are capable of channeling animus into your psionic powers when you manifest them.
prerequisites: spellcraft 5 ranks, must possess an animus pool.
benefits: when you manifest a power that allows a saving throw, you can spend up 2 points of animus to increase its save dc by 1. at manifester level 8th and every four levels thereafter, you can spend an additional 2 points of animus to add an additional +1 to the save dc.

name: Armored Mind
description: Your mental resilience is psionically enhanced.
benefits: the of your enduring mind feat increase by 2 while you are psionically focused. you may expend your psionic focus as an immediate action to negate all mental ability damage from a single source (other than you) for 1 round.

name: Assassins Venom
description: The poisons you create are more effective.
prerequisites: base attack bonus +3, assassin warrior path, prevenom or prevenom weapon path power.
benefits: you gain a bonus on the save dc of prevenom and prevenom weapon equal to the competence bonus granted by your trance class feature.

name: Backtrack
description: Your parallel selves learn an old trick, even after opportunity had passed them by. Special You can take this feat multiple times; each time you do, you choose a different parallel action to learn.
benefits: you gain a voyager parallel action in a category of your class level or lower that you did not already possess.

name: Biokinetic Adept
description: You utilize biokinetic techniques when you gain your focus.
benefits: you may gain temporary hit points equal to 1/2 your manifester level whenever you gain your psionic focus. these temporary hit points last for up to one minute per character level. you may gain temporary hit points from this feat up to four times per day, and they do not stack with themselves.

name: Biokinetic Feedback
description: You convert your psychic enervation into physical feedback.
benefits: if you would lose power points as the result of psychic enervation, you may instead lose an equal number of hit points. additionally, if you possess the overchannel feat, you may use it in conjunction with your wild surge. the effects stack. combining your wild surge with overchannel in this manner increases your chance for psychic enervation by 20%.

name: Biokinetic Rhythms
description: You know how to heal your body with biokinetic techniques.
benefits: you may expend your psionic focus as a standard action to gain fast healing equal to your constitution modifier for 5 rounds. using this feat drains your bodys natural biorhythms; after activating this feat you must wait 10 minutes before activating it again.

name: Biokinetic Shielding
description: While focused, you enhance your form with biokinetic techniques.
benefits: you gain a natural armor bonus to your ac equal to your constitution modifier while psionically focused.

name: Biokinetic Surge
description: You can burn away long-term damage to your body.
prerequisites: biokinetic adept, con 13, wild surge class feature.
benefits: you may invoke your wild surge as a swift action to heal an amount of ability damage to your strength, dexterity, or constitution equal to your wild surges intensity. the first time per day that you use this feat, you do not need to check for psychic enervation. you check for psychic enervation as normal for each use thereafter.

name: Blink Ambush
description: You can surprise foes with your teleportation abilities. (Editor's Note "Slipstream Feint" does not exist. This was likely a feat that was removed before publishing)
benefits: once per round, when you teleport to or from a location within 10 feet of a creature, you can make a feint attempt against that creature as a free action (even if it isnt your turn). if your feint succeeds, you can expend your psionic focus to cause the target to become flat-footed for 1 round.

name: Blood Reveler
description: You delight in the pain inflicted by your lifeblood resonance.
benefits: once per round, when you deal damage to a creature with your lifeblood resonance, you may add your charisma modifier to the damage of the ability and gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt by it. at 8th and 15th levels, you can apply this effect to an additional use of your lifeblood resonance each round.

name: Body Fuel
description: You can expand your power point total at the expense of your health. You can recover additional power points for a proportional cost to Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution. These recovered points are added to your power point reserve as if you had gained them by resting overnight. Special Only living creatures can use this feat. You can take advantage of this feat only while in your own body. You are able to selectively decide which ability to sacrifice for more power points.
benefits: when using the body fuel feat, you need only choose a single physical ability score (strength, dexterity, or constitution) to suffer ability burn, instead of all three.

name: Bookmark
description: You can leave an imprint behind for as long as you wish, for you to retreat to later.
prerequisites: afterimage class feature, rewind parallel action.
benefits: as a full-round action, you can set a semi-permanent afterimage on your current location. you can use rewind to return to this location instead of one of your normal afterimages as long as you are within a certain range of it, based on your character level (see below). this afterimage lasts until you rewind to it, or until you set another afterimage using this feat. this ability cannot cross planar boundaries; it only functions if you are still on the same plane as the bookmark.

name: Boost Construct
description: Your astral constructs have more abilities. Special This effect stacks with the Summoners Call ability of the shaper. Your astral constructs are creatures of legendary might and toughness.
benefits: any astral construct you create is considered mythic for the purpose of interacting with other mythic creatures. it doesnt gain any mythic abilities or powers, but is affected by mythic powers, spells, and abilities as if it were a 1st-tier mythic creature. additionally, if the astral construct has damage reduction, its damage reduction becomes dr/epic.

name: Bound Self
description: As a last-ditch effort, you may bind your own soul to your psicrystal  preventing death at great cost. If your psicrystal is destroyed while you possess any negative levels gained from Bound Self, you must succeed at a Fortitude save (DC equal to 10 + your manifester level) or die instantly.
prerequisites: bound spirit, psicrystal affinity, spirited psicrystal, manifester level 15th.
benefits: special if you are immune to negative levels, you may not from this feat.

name: Bound Sigil
description: The sigils of your manifesting can be drawn on your body and activated later.
benefits: you can now draw your sigils on your body so that they etch themselves into you. 3 times per day you can manifest a power and turn it into a psionic tattoo on your body instead of having it manifest normally.

name: Bound Spirit
description: By binding a willing spirit to your psicrystal, you grant further power to yourself and enhanced survivability to it.
prerequisites: psicrystal affinity, spirited psicrystal, manifester level 10th.
benefits: three times per day, while the spirit is bound within your psicrystal, you may draw on its essence for power  choosing one of the following abilities. each of these abilities takes a standard action to activate, is a psi-like effect, and functions at your manifester level. for each bonus you take, you owe one of the following to the spirit, to be paid within the next 24 hours a part of your dreams (you must rest one additional hour to regain power points), some of your memories (you must spend one uninterrupted hour doing nothing but sitting and reminiscing), or a part of your soul (you gain one negative level). if you do not pay the spirit within the next 24 hours, you lose all of this feat and cannot from it again for one week.

name: Broken Dreams Style
description: Your unarmed strikes are empowered by nightmares.
prerequisites: devastating touch class feature, improved unarmed strike, intimidate 3 ranks
benefits: when performing an unarmed attack, you can choose to also deliver your devastating touch damage through that attack.

name: Brutal Surge
description: You are able to manifest powers using your anger to a greater degree.
prerequisites: ability to manifest a rage blade, ability to manifest 1st level powers from the gifted blade list.
benefits: you may treat the enhancement bonus increase from your rage blade as the wild surge class feature (see wilder base class for details) on powers that you manifest. you spend one round of your rage blade usage and initiate a wild surge and risk psychic enervation as per the wilder class (using the brutality blades enervation penalty).

name: Cerebric Guardian
description: You have bound a powerful spirit to your psicrystal, gaining a servant that grows as you do.
